loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primero Dios está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras.  El coordinador del grupo es el señor  Damaso Abba, él es agricultor de maíz, frijoles, trigo…etc. Además de eso el comercializa granos básicos desde hace varios años en su hogar y en mercado de Masaya. 
El con el crédito comprara granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz, trigo…etc.) 
Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Luisa  comerciante de calzado de manera ambulante y Robando es propietario de una zapatería desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The group “Primero Dios” consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. The group coordinator is Sr. Damaso Abba. He is a farmer who grows corn, beans, wheat, and other crops. In addition, he has been selling dry goods for several years from his home and at the market in Masaya. He will use his loan to buy dry goods such as rice, beans, corn, wheat, and other items.

The other members are María Lusia, a traveling shoe merchant, and Roblando, who has owned a shoemaking business for eight years.

loans.use: to buy dry goods such as rice, beans, corn, wheat, and other items.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, A. T. deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 6 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have six children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

A. T., the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 20,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Rhoda is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. Her husband mainly manages their rice farm and she assists in keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. Rhoda raises pigs in their backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Rhoda has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. She hopes for their ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Belida Irene

texts.es:
La señora Belida Irene es casada, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la venta de arena de río para construcción, inició este negocio siendo operaria para otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con e apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en capital para la compra de arena para su posterior reventa a un mejor precio, en el futro espera contar con una fábrica de blocks y mejorar así su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Belida Irene is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She sells river sand that is used in construction. Belida started this venture while working as an employee at another business. To date she has 10 years of experience and receives the support of her husband, who works as a merchant.

Belida decided to request a loan for investment because she needed to buy sand for eventual resale at a better price. In the future she hopes to start a factory that produces blocks so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sand for use in construction jobs.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 55 years old, married, and has two children. He lives peacefully in the province of Isabela where he plants rice as the family's primary source of income. Abraham is hardworking man. Aside from farming, Abraham manages his hog raising business, raising pigs for breeding. His desire is to expand his business premises and grow his business.

Abraham is requesting a second loan of 50,000 PHP, which he will use to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. His previous loan was invested in his business and had a positive impact. He hopes this loan will help him bring up his family with an increase of income from the business. With the business he manages, he is able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в городе Чкаловск. Возраст, 37 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он предоставляет услугу. Развозит людей по маршруту №87 Худжанд - Б. Гафуров. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины марки Газель.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the town of Chkalovsk.  He is 37 years old, married and has four children.  He provides a service and transports people along the #87 Khujand - B. G. route.  Rustam has been involved in this business for 12 years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his Gazel vehicle.

loans.use: to make repairs to his Gazel vehicle

loans.name: Ma.lora

texts.en:
Ma. Lora, 42, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Lora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Lora requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Lora has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Ma. Lora would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sindi Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sindi, vive con su mamá y dos hijos, es casada, es costurera, este negocio lo inicio gracias a su propia iniciativa, el trabajo lo aprendió en una academia, trabaja todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de telas, zipper, botones, hilos y otros materiales para la costura, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, a tener buenas ganancias y a si poder ayudar a cubrir los gastos familiares.  
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su negocio, para con ello mejorar sus ganancias y darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Sindi lives with her mother and her two children.  She’s married and is a seamstress.  She started this business on her own initiative having learned the occupation at an academy.  She works every day from 7am until 6pm.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread and other sewing supplies.  This purchase will help her strengthen the business.  Having good profits will help her cover family costs.

Her greatest dream is to improve her business to earn better profits to provide her children with education all the way through university.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread and zippers.

loans.name: Nezahat

texts.en:
Nezahat has been a widow for 7 years and has 3 children.  The eldest is 28 and the youngest is 14.  Her two youngest children are in school.  

During her husband’s illness, they accumulated a lot of debt.  She and her daughter worked in a car factory.  5-6 months ago, she started making handcrafted items (beaded doilies, tablecloths, etc. that she makes on a frame).  She sells them to those around her and in the municipalities' market stand.  A friend of hers recommended Maya (the lender) to her so she applied and was approved for a loan.  

She plans to make a trip to Istanbul to buy her raw material in bulk because she can get a better wholesale price there.  Once she buys her materials and increases her inventory, she plans on getting a stall in one of the local markets.  She has already tested her handiwork in the market and it sold very well.  In the future, she would like to open a workshop.  As for her children, she wants her daughter to finish law school and wants her youngest son to be an English teacher.  When asked what else she wanted lenders to know about her she said, “I want to thank them for opportunity to have this loan.”

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Nezahat Hanım,7 yıldır dul ve üç çocuğu var.  En büyüğü 28 ve en küçüğü 14 yaşında.  İki çocuğa da çalışıyor.  Eşinin hastalığından bu yana,çok fazla borçlanmışlar.  Kendisi ve kızı araba fabrikasında çalışmış.  Bundan 5-6 ay önce,el işleri yapmaya başlamış(boncuk işleri,masa örtüsü v.s. tel kırma üzerinde yapıyor) ve çevresindeki insanlara ve Belediye standlarında ürünlerini satmış. Arkadaşlarından biri  tavsiye etmiş, bu yüzden Maya’ya başvurmuş ve krediyi almış.  İstanbul’a toptan fiyatına mal almak için gitmeyi planlıyor çünkü daha uygun fiyata alacağını düşünüyor.  Bu malzemeleri aldıktan sonra,malzemeleri genişletip,yerel pazarlara vermeyi düşünüyor.  Pazarlardaki el işlerinin çok iyi satıldığını görmüş.Gelecekte atölye açmayı düşünüyor.  Çocuklarından kızının avukat olmasını ,oğlunun da İngilizce öğretmeni olmasını istiyor.  Kendisine borç verenler için,böyle bir fırsatı kendisine sundukları için teşekkür ediyor.

loans.use: to buy materials and increase her inventory

loans.name: Rajani

texts.en:
Rajani is 25 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 4.  In 2000, she established  her meat shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy goats and chickens for her business.  In the future, Rajani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with products and sales are brisk.  With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens and goats.

loans.name: Daniela Samantha

texts.es:
Daniela nació en la  ciudad de Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Daniela tiene 18 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre. Daniela desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.   

Daniela se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una tienda de ventas pero el local es alquilado. Ya son siete meses que se dedica a la venta de ropa y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Daniela pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Las reuniones de la socias son cada treinta días en la ciudad  de Ollantaytambo. Daniela requiere el préstamo para implementar la tienda y desea comprar muebles como por ejemplo vitrinas y otras cosas más. 

Daniela se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Daniela was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and has lived there since her birth. She is 18 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. Daniela has a regular economic activity in Ollantaytambo, namely selling clothes. She has her store in rented premises. She has been in this activity for seven months and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Daniela is a member of the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (the friendship of Ollantaytambo) of the microfinance institution Asociación Arariwa in Ollantaytambo. The members meet every month in Ollantaytambo. Daniela applied for the loan to install her store and buy some furniture, such as showcases and other objects.

Daniela is grateful for the opportunity provided by Kiva and commits herself to pay off her loan according to the time schedule.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as showcases and other objects.

loans.name: C2198 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
James is 36 years old and is married with two children aged nine and thirteen years old. He has a general business, which is open from 6am until 5pm every day. 
He is the leader of the group called "C2198 Abishyizehamwe" in the local language. James is on the right hand side and has three years of experience in this business. He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company, in order purchase more general store goods, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on to sell. 
With this profit, James will reinvest in his business and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more general store goods like sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent, 40 years old, is a single woman with a 13-year-old son. She describes herself as a self-motivated woman. She has been selling shoes for the last 11 years and has one employee. Her business is located in a busy market. Her business challenge is a shortage of shoes from her supplier. She will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more new shoes. Millicent's hopes and dreams are to be selling shoes wholesale and to venture into a new hardware business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more new shoes.

loans.name: 4 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El comité "4 De Octubre" está en el tercer ciclo del programa, está integrada por 9 señoras, quienes se esfuerzan al maximo para poder lograr sus metas. El objetivo de cada una de ella es seguir en el comité, fomentar el espíritu solidario y mantener la unidad en el grupo. Mediante la oportunidad brindada por la fundación paraguaya pudieron aumentar sus actividades algunas iniciarla.
Una de las miembros es la señora Edita, quien gracias a su esfuerzo y a su trabajo puede ayudar a su familia y mantener la casa. Ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de pollos, en lo cual le va muy bien, pues los pollos son muy pedidos ya que la carne está muy cara.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos en cantidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
The group “Octoer 4” is in their third loan cycle and consists of 9 women who try their best to achieve their goals.  Each woman strives to continue on the committee, encourage a spirit of solidarity, and maintain unity in the group.  Through the opportunity provided by the Paraguayan foundation, they were able to increase their business and initiatives.  

One of the members is Edita who, thanks to her effort and hard work, is able to help her family and maintain the house.  She tells us that she sells chicken and does very well, since her chicken are in high demand because meat is very expensive.  She requests the loan to buy chicken in quantity, with which she will be able to meet her client’s demand.  She is appreciative for this opportunity.

loans.use: buy chicken for sale.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 42-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Taghreed is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family living conditions.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Taghreed's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio, de 37 años, convive con Reyna de 33 años, padres de 04 hijos, quienes son la felicidad de su hogar y viven en su propia casa en la comunidad Manitea Alta. Leoncio, es un hombre de provecho, Es campesino y se dedica con mucho esmero a labrar la tierra para cultivar café, cacao y hojas de coca, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 18 años y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el agro. En tiempos de cosecha busca el apoyo de los jornaleros para que lo  apoyen en la extracción de los frutos. Sus frutos que mayor retabilidad le dan, son los granos de cacao y las hojas de coca, por lo que las empresas acopiadoras le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra y aumentar su producción. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, comprará más plantas de café  para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Leoncio is 37 and lives with Reyna, who is 33.  They have 4 children, who are their happiness.  They live in their own home in Manitea Alta.  Leoncio is a hard-working farmer who works with great effort to grow coffee, cacao and coca leaves, which he has done for the past 18 years through his own effort.  At harvest time he counts on the help of day laborers to bring the fruit crop in.  The crops which he gains most profit from are cacao and coca, as companies buy at good prices for each kilogram of produce.  A problem he faces is not being able to control insect pests that attack his fruit crop.  But his first priority is to buy more land to increase his production.  This is his 3rd loal from MFP, and he is ready to repay promptly, so as to be able to continue to have access to credit in the future.  He participates actively as a member of his communal lender. With 2,500 nuevos soles, he will buy coffee plants, to later graft them in order to produce fruit in a shorter time span.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Vida decided to set up a shop selling cosmetics and used children’s wear in Abura, Cape Coast. She has some years' worth of experience; she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. 

Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more products like powder, perfumes, pomade, body lotions, antiseptics, hair relaxers, used clothes etc, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her products so she can meet her customers' needs. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that her two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more products like powder, perfumes, pomade, body lotions, antiseptics, hair relaxers and used clothes.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 48 years old; he lives in Nablus with his wife and his four children.  He sells all kind of vegetables and fruits   in his vegetables shop, he opened it before twenty years ago, and this business helped the family income.
Ibraheem asked Ryada for this loan to purchase pay for a car wants to purchase it for vegetables and fruits sells, this will give him step forward and make his business wider, so he would be able to increase her stock and led to increase his income. His goal and become a successful entrepreneur, his dream is to be will know at the city so he tried to give the best service for his clients. 
Ibraheem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase pay for a car wants to purchase it for vegetables and fruits sells, this will give him step forward and make his business wider, so he would be able to increase her stock and led to increase his income.

loans.name: Jehovah Charma Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JEHOVAH CHARMA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Monique, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans est mariée à un certain Cosme. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Monique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Monique et son mari. Monique a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour cette raison, Monique vend des condiments, de l'huile végétale, des friperies et du riz dans sa région depuis quarante ans. Monique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Monique sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JEHOVAH CHARMA un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, de l'huile végétale, des friperies et du riz.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem is a smart man. He is not married and lives with his parent in Mafraq; he is fourth year student majoring computer ‎information system. He reads a lot of books and usually goes to the library. His parents are proud of him because he is ‎clever and hard-worker man. His aim is to be a high quality specialist and to work in the same field to get experience, ‎perhaps he will be a known man someday. Saleem now needs your financial support because his parents do not have ‎money to pay for his fees, therefore he asked for a loan to pay his education fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy inorganic manure for her land.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba D/O M. A. is married, has four children and lives in District 5 of Kabul City. She was in high school when the war broke out and that kept her from completing her education. The wars had a very bad impact on her financial situation and her life got worse day by day. In order to improve her family's finances, she took out her first loan to buy clothes for her sons to sell in the market and streets of Kabul City. Before the loan, only one of her sons was doing business, which made it difficult to overcome their financial problems. Her first loan made it possible to buy more clothes so two of her sons could work and earn money. She is requesting a second loan of $175 so she and her sons can continue to increase their income and opportunities to do business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Qanire

texts.en: Qanire I. has lived in Sabirabad for a long time, and she decided to open her small business. Mrs. I. is married and has two children. She is the owner of a women’s clothing store. She applied for a $1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to repair her store, and she plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to improve the store and her stock.

loans.use: Mrs. Ismayilova would like to repair and improve her women's clothing store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Born in 1977, Cecilia M. is married to Jonathan Suh and is a mother of 5 children. Her source of motivation is from difficulties she has faced, especially poor health which has resulted in a surgical operation on her leg. This further compounded the situation and the consequences include inability to educate her children even in primary school.
Encouraged by GHAPE borrowers Cecilia became a member of GHAPE and received a loan of $40 in 2003 and since then has proven her ability to receive, invest and repay loans up to the amount of $400. From previous loans she provided her community with fresh food. She is very proud of her achievements especially her success in owning and managing her own business. With profits from these loans, she has been paying children’s school fees. 
Given a loan of $600, Cecilia plans to continue in the same line of business of selling water fufu and Eru and crop cultivation. Water-fufu is made out of fermented cassava. It is palatable with okra and Eru. Eru is green vegetables prepared with smoked fresh  cow skin. When crayfish is added to it and a few magi cubes, even passers-by smell it and saliva is generated. Water fufu and Eru was once a highly appreciated traditional dish in the south west province of Cameroon but today it is widely eaten by most Cameroonians. Her intention is to use the profit to continue to educate her children and take care of her health. Cecilia plans to repay her loan during the loan term.

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs, hire labor, buy wood, transport expenses

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Channa has been married since1988 and has 4 children: 3 son and a daughter. She learned to weave from her mother in 1993, and started her own silk production business that same year. Her husband has also been weaving silk since 1995 when he was trained in this art by his wife. In addition, he is also a construction contractor in the village, while Mrs. E.'s entire family has been earning money planting food crops and raising cows in the village.    

Mrs. E. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$500 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Martha Aqueda

texts.es:
Martha E. is married and her business consists of making natural juices and selling them in the central market in Leon. Before starting this business she sold desserts from home and her clients then asked her to sell juices and natural squashes, and her and her husband managed to raise $15 to start their new business.

They have now been doing this for 6 years. Although they don't have a stall in the market they have a tricycle which they use to transport their products, and the good thing is that they make everything fresh and the more they invest the more money they earn.

During the three years that she has been getting loans from CEPRODEL she has been able to invest in her business and it is the only income her family has.

Martha's aim is to keep saving so that she can get her own stall in the market and strengthen her business, God permitting, so that they can finish building themselves a nice house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Martha E. es casada, su negocio consiste en preparar jugos naturales y venderlos en todo el mercado Central de León. Antes de comenzar con este negocio vendía repostería(postres) a domicilio y sus clientes le pidieron que tambien vendiera frescos (o Jugos naturales), de manera que con su esposo lograron recaudar $15 dólares para iniciar con este nuevo negocio.

Ahora lleva 6 años desempeñando esta actividad. Aun no tienen un módulo dentro del mercado, le toca transportarse en un triciclo para ofrecer su producto, lo bueno es que ella ofrece algo que se consume a diario y mientras mas invierte en el negocio sus ganancias van aumentando.

En estos tres años que lleva de trabajar con el crédito de CEPRODEL, ha sabido aprovecharlos y los invierte bien en el negocio, pues es su único medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia.

La meta de doña Martha es ir ahorrando todas sus ganancias para poder comprar su propio módulo en el mercado y fortalecer su negocio...y si Dios le permite...terminar de construir su casita para tener una vivienda Digna.

loans.use: To buy utensils to make squash and ingredients: sugar, rice, fruits etc/Compra de Activos Fijos, utencilios para hacer sus refrescos, asi como los insumos: Azucar, Arroz, Frutas ...etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Mrs. Luisa belongs to the communal bank “Las Saposoinas”, and lives in the San Martín region of the province of Huallaga. Her business is located on the corner of Bolivar and Bolognesi streets. She dedicates herself to selling clothing for children and adults.

Thanks to the support of her son, and to her own diligent efforts, her business is growing. She experiences increased sales activity during the holiday season.

With the loan of 1,500 soles, to be repaid over six months, she will buy more clothing for children and adults (both men’s and women’s) in a variety of styles and for every occasion.

Mrs. Luisa is 36 years old, is single and lives alone with her son. She demonstrates that, by working hard every day, there are no limits to what one can achieve.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoinas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa. Su negocio está ubicado en la esquina de Jr.Bolivar y Bolognesi s/n y se dedica a vender ropa de niños y adultos. Gracias al apoyo de su hijo y al esfuerzo que ella pone en su negocio está saliendo adelante en sus ventas. Actualmente incrementó su negocio para las fiestas navideñas ya que en esa fecha vende mas. Con el préstamo de S/.1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará más ropa de vestir para niños y adultos (hombres y mujeres) en variedad de modelos y para toda ocasión. La señora Luisa tiene 36 años, vive sola con su hijo, no tiene pareja, trabaja diariamente, demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir metas no hay límites y se puede alcanzar lo que se propone.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Julia Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs.Julia Garcia sell basic grains (rice, frijoles, corn) wholesale and retail. She began her business with $100 saved up from her previous employment picking fruit.

The section of the market where she has her stall is in very poor condition and they don´t even have a roof. When it rains (especially in winter), the water floods her stall and damages her products.

Mrs.Julia has benefitted from 19 microloans financed by Ceprodel over the past three years. These loans were used to purchase greater amounts of grain. The current loan she is soliciting will be used to improve the working conditions of her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase rice, frijoles, corn

loans.name: Namoz.

texts.ru:
Namoz lives in the Khuroson region. He is 36 years old, is married, has 3 children and a high school education. Namoz works in agriculture and plants wheat and other grains. He plans to use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting. He has worked in this area for 3 years and this business is the main source of income for his family. In addition agricultural expansion helps to provide locals with wheat and flour. Namoz plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагайназаров Намоз Тошкуватович житель района Хуросон. 36 лет ,женат, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством, посевом пшеницы и других злаковых культур. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку зерна и удобрений для посева.Опыт работы ав данном бизнесе 3 года. Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода его семьи. Так же развитие сельского хозяйства позволяет обеспечить население пшеницей и мукой.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao M., 51, is the head of his family. To support the family income, he works as a motor-taxi driver. He earns approximately $3 a day of profit. His wife, Mrs.Kaot Njem, 46, is a company staff member with a salary of $150 a month. They have six children, two of whom are married and live away from home and others who stay at home and do not earn an income.

To earn an additional income, Mrs. Kaot Njem is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a business (motor-taxi driver). If she has enough money in the future, she will buy a market stand for her daughters to sell groceries. (Mrs. Kaot Njem is pictured with her youngest son)

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru:
Odil H. lives in Yavan. He is married with five children and has a happy family. He is 45 years old. He has no higher education. Odil earns his money by buying and re-selling calves. He buys young calves, feeds them to fatten them up and then sells them. The profits from this business are not bad and they help provide for his family. Right now Odil is looking to expand the business and to buy more calves to make a larger profit. The loan would help him expand and thus also help his large family. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Халимов Одил житель города Яван. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Ему 45 лет. Образования не имеет , но зарабатывает купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Привозит молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает. Этот бизнес дает неплохой доход , который позволяет кормить семью.Сейчас он хочет увеличить товарооборот , который даст возможность заработать больше. Кредит сможет помочь ему и его большой и дружной семье. Погасить кредит одил сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy  more calves

loans.name: Ndiawar

texts.fr:
This is a jeweler who is established at the grand market of Moussanté in Thiès. He is married, a father of five, and possesses a solid 30 years of experience along with an excellent customer base. Improving his business is the purpose of applying for this loan. He can then complete his customer orders.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

C'est un bijoutier installé dans le grand marché de Moussanté à Thiès. Il est marié, père de 05 enfants.Il dispose d'une expérience solide de 30 ans et d'une excellente clientèle. C'est dans le but d'améliorer ses activités qu'il sollicite ce prêt pour terminer ses commandes.

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov C. is a subsistence farmer in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her business now faces small problem because Mrs. Pov C. has insufficient draft animals Thus, Mrs. Pov C. asked a loan to buy one more cow to work with the cow she has now. Her husband, Mr. Mom Suon, is a bed maker.

Mrs. Pov C. is 32 years old and the mother of four children. One is employed in a garment factory. Two others attend school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Pov C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a pig for breeding. Last year, one of Mrs. Pov C.’s children got dengue fever and she spent $75 to have her cured. Her husband appears on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi N., 39 years old, has 2 children who are going to school. She joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Living in a family that has agricultural tradition, she used her money in breeding and planting vegetables. After 10 years of membership, she now has more savings and more experience to be able to expand her farm. She and her husband are investing in a fish-raising project because she has a large pond at home. Besides, she is raising 100 chickens. She earns about 200 USD/ month from raising chickens and fishes. Her family living conditions have improved. This time, she wants to borrow 1075 USD to buy more fishes, chickens and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị N. năm nay 39 tuổi. Gia đìnhchị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Vốn là gia đình thuần nông nên khi vay vốn về chị sử dụng đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt.Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương cùng với số vốn vay tăng đần và vốn kinh nghiệm được tích luỹ qua quá trình chăn nuôi hiện nay mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn, Hiện nay vợ chồng chị đang đầu tư vào dự án chăn nuôi cá. Với diện tích ao sẵn có tại gia đình, vợ chồng chị N. đã đầu tư vốn để mua cá giống về nuôi. Ngoài ra gia đình đang nuôi 100 con gà thịt. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng từ việc chăn nuôi gà, cá điều kiện sống của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện và tăng lên rõ rệt. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn nuôi cá và mua thêm gà, cá giống về nuôi.

loans.use: Raising chicken and fish

loans.name: Thi Yen's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Yen (ID number 17120007), born in 1969, has a business in renting wedding decorations. Her husband is a taxi driver and her two children are of school-going ages. She would like to borrow 5,300,000VND through Binh Minh to expand her business. Her family's frequent income is very suitabL. to repay the loan weekly, thus they would like to apply for more loans to raise their standard of living. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Tran Thi Lien (ID Number 17120006), born in 1960, has a small general store. Her husband passed away, so she has to raise her two school-going children by herself. She would like to borrow 5,724,000VND to expand her store.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thu Ha (ID Number 17120008) was born in 1973. Her husband is an electrician. She would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to invest in her drink store.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Hanh (ID Number 17120013), born in 1976, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to expand her drink store.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thanh Nga (ID Number 17120020, born in 1984, would like to borrow 4,452,000VND to invest in her eatery.
  • The total amount requested is 1,525.00USD).

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

     Đỗ Thi Yến (Ms 17120007), sinh năm 1969, chị làm nghề kinh doanh dịch vụ cho thuê đồ cưới hỏi. Chồng chị là lái xe taxi, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Chi vay mức vốn: 5.300.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh. Chị vay vốn ở tài chính vimô Binh Minh để có thêm vốn hỗ trợ kinh doanh của mình. Thu nhập thường xuyên của hai vợ chồng rất phù hợp với hoàn trả tuần nên vợ chồng chị mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài để cải thiện cuộc sống. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Đỗ Thị Lan (Ms 17120006), sinh năm 1960, làm nghề buôn bán nhỏ. Chồng chị đã mất, chị phải một mình nuôi hai con còn nhỏ ăn học. Mức vay của chị: 5.724.000 vnđ để mở rộng cửa hàng. Lê Thị Thu Hà (Ms 17120008), sinh năm 1973. Chồng chị là thợ điện. Mức vay; 4.876.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng giải khát. Dương Thị Hạnh (Ms 17120013), sinh năm 1976, mức vay:4.876.000 vnđ đểmở rộng cửa hàng nước giải khát. Lại Thị Thanh Ngà ( Ms 17120020), sinh năm 1984, mức vay:4.452.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng cơm bình dân.

loans.use: Supplying Wedding Decorations

loans.name: Ramla's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Ramla is 32 years old, married, and has three children, all between 3 and 8 years old. Since 2007, Ramla has been earning income as a bites seller. She works every day, earning a monthly profit of about US$80 from the sales.

Ramla is now asking for a loan to improve her business by expanding the stock of goods. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, Mwanahawa and Somoe, who have businesses dealing with cassava an clothing sales.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ruth Maribel

texts.es:
Ruth inició el negocio porqué siempre ha sentido gusto por las ventas y el comercio ademas es una actividad que puede hacer en su casa en determinada horas, lo que le permite estar siempre al cuidado de su hija y de su hogar, además de esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en Marzo de 2000, primero vendiendo productos de belleza , y actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa, primero vendia estos productos entre familiares, vecinos y amistades y ellos le fueron recomendando más clientes y gracias a Dios hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien ya que en la actualidad tiene una buena cartera de clientes. El anterior crédito que recibío de KIVA le sirvió para invertir en mercancía lo cual le ayudó bastante para surtir su negocio de ropa para fin de año y así pudo sostener el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $550 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir mercancía que le permita tener un mejor surtido de ropa para sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ruth started her business because she's always liked sales, and it is something that she can do in her house during predetermined hours. Her business allows her to care for her daughter and her home, and its a way to help her husband cover household expenses. Ruth began in March of 2000, first selling beauty products. Now she sells clothing, initially to family, neighbors, and friends. These clients recommended her to others, and thanks to God Ruth's business has done well to date. Now she has a good client portfolio. Ruth's prior loan from Kiva helped her invest in merchandise, with which she supplied her business for the holiday season, and thereby sustained the business. Ruth needs a loan of US$550, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy merchandise that will allow her to have a better supply of clothing for her clients and improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Koan's Group

texts.en:
Koan E. is 36 years old and the father of two children. He and his wife, Yoem Da, are farmers who own 0.5-hectar field.  They cultivate rice for a living. Since they have only one plantation, Koan cannot support his family well so he is asking ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and hopes to increase his income after he sells his cow. 
Seven people in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut Village in Takeo Province are made up the village bank loan. Koan is the village bank president. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness I. O. is 54 years old and is married with seven children. Happiness purchases drinks from distributors in Benin City to sell to her customers. She is happy because the demand for her drinks will increase during this festive season.

Happiness needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Put

texts.en:
Put H. is 28 years old and sells Khmer silk clothes by transporting them to customers' homes. She buys them from the manufacturer and then resells them for a profit. She has been in this business since 2003, and currently earns around $10 per day. Her husband, Mr. Pheng Kreal, is 41 years old and works cooking for wedding parties. The couple has two children, both of whom are teenagers. They both work hard with the business to support the family's living expenses.

So far, her business is doing well and she needs to expand it to make more profits. Therefore, Put H. would like to request a loan to purchase more silk clothes for resale. The loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more silk clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Chinigul, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Chinigul is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children.

Chinigul started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than 10 years, she has operated a store where she sells women’s clothing and men’s shirts. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Chinigul hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family especially for her two children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose in mind, Chinigul is requesting 2500 Somoni for a term of 9 months. She promises to repay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing underclothes for girls and women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Santa Bárbara, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, posee un negocio de venta de calzados (zapatillas), relojes y joyas en el mercado de Puno; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (zapatillas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería (zapatillas y relojes), que piensa venderlos en los mercados de Puno y Juliaca, con ello piensa ayudar en su calidad de vida y apoyo en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo." She's 50 years old (with an elementary school education), married, and has 4 children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for three years, and she owns her own business selling shoes, watches, and jewelry inside the Puno market. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise (shoes) for her business. With this loan for 1500 soles ($475 dollars), that she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise (shoes and watches) which she will sell in the Puno and Juliaca markets. Being able to grow her business will allow her to further support her children's education and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu purchase additional merchandise (shoes and watches) for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has five children, two females and three males. The oldest daughter is a seamstress. The other children are in the senior high and junior high schools. Janet lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are into commercial activities. 

Janet is a trader who deals in underwear such as panties, brassieres, socks, slips, etc. to help provide for the family. She buys the goods in Kumasi. She sells house-to-house except for Wednesday, market day, when she sells in the market. Janet has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy more goods. It is her dream to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To buy undergarments

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia LUZMILA; es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos mayores y con familia propia, y 2 de (18, 14) años de edad, ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba, en pleno valle sagrado de los inkas, gozan de un clima benigno.

La socia alternas sus actividades del hogar con la de la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno en el que cultiva (maíz, habas, trigo, cebada, verduras), ella también desea invertir en la compra de semillas y de aves de corral, para su procreación y así su próxima venta.

La socia esta muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado para la realización de sus proyectos y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a native of Urubamba province in Peru. She is 51 years old and has 6 children, four of whom are older and have their own families, and 2 living at home (18 and 14 years respectively). They live in the province of Urubamba, in the middle of the sacred valley of the Incas, and enjoy a temperate climate. Luzmila moves between her work at home and her work in agriculture. She has a field in which she plants corn, beans, wheat, barley and vegetables. She also wants to invest in the purchase of seeds and poultry, in order to cultivate them and then resell them for profit. Luzmila is very thankful and values the loan offered in order to help her with her projects, and she promises to complete the total repayment of her loan in the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and poultry

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Шодиева Малика проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 36 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке "Саховат" города Турсун-заде. Привозит ткани из города Душанбе. Клиентка имеет опыт работы с кредитами. В данный момент она планирует получить повторный кредит и использовать его для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Таким образом она сможет завезти сезонный товар.
texts.en:
Malika S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 36 years old, married and has three children. She has been in the retail business for five years now. She sells on the market Sahovat in the Tursun-zoda. She brings fabrics from Dushanbe. She has an experience working with loans. At this time she plans to get another loan and use it to increase commodity circulation. This way she can bring in seasonal merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Eugenia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado, en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, cereales, además Eugenia tiene teléfonos públicos.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, gaseosa, aceite y azúcar.
Los sueños de Eugenia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios y construir su casa para tener una local propio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank Triunfo. She is married, 44 years old, and has 2 children. Eugenia has a store in a rented locale where she sells general merchandise, vegetables, and grains. She also has a public telephone. Eugenia needs a loan of 2600 soles that will be invested in the purchase of milk, soft drinks, oil and sugar. Eugenia's dreams are that her children complete their university studies and to build her own home so she have her store there.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of milk, soft drinks, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thủy Thị Đào was born in 1971 (no. 010107010006). She lives with her husband and 2 children, one is going to school. Her husband is a driver. Her family has an income of about 2,500,000 VND. She was believed by everybody in her village. Besides housework, she also attends in social work and she is a group leader. She wants to borrow 3,270,000 VND (185 USD) to breed pigs and poultry. There are 4 other Fund participants in her group: 

Mai Thị B. Nguyễn was born in 1983 (no. 010107010008). She is a worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (350 USD) to repair her house.

Thanh Thị Như Nguyễn was born in 1960 (no. 010107010009). She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

May Thị Nguyễn was born in 1954 (no. 010107010007). She wants to borrow 1,962,000 VND (110 USD) to buy vegetables for reselling in the market.

Luật Thị Nguyễn was born in 1950 (no. 010107010107). She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Adizatu

texts.en:
Adizatu Y. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Adizatu sells provisions at Ashante Road in Cape Coast, something she has done since 1989 but on a smaller scale. Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Adizatu uses her income to pay for school fees, utility bills and clothing for her children and other expenses. Adizatu will use the loan to purchase more provisions to fill her store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adizatu plans to support her husband in saving towards a house they plan to build for the family so that they can stop paying rent and also have enough rooms for their large family.

loans.use: Adizatu will use the loan to purchase more provisions to fill her store.

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
H. Phạm Thị (627981313) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four adult children.

H. owns and operates a service-based business providing cargo transport services to local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve her business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Dennis Julian

texts.es: Dennis Julián Hernández A. tiene 43 años de edad. Su estado civil es soltero. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su compañera de vida cuida a sus hijos. Su actividad económica es joyería. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, ya que es aquí donde obtenido la mayoría de sus clientes. Sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio para el beneficio de su familia ya que de esto depende la manutención de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de oro, plata, piedras y algunos ácidos. Sus deseos para el futuro son de que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dennis Julián Hernández A. is a 43-year old single father of three. His life partner takes care of his children. He is a jeweler and has done it for a living for more than five years. His business is located outside a marketplace, which is where he has obtained the majority of his customers. His intention is to expand his business to benefit his family, which is dependent on his income. He is asking for financing to buy gold, silver, stones, and acids. His goal for the future is that his children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. 

Grace is a trader. She trades in utensils, rubber and plastic products. She hawks and treks to other towns to sell her products. Grace buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for more than 20 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Estanislao Roberto

texts.es:
Estanislao paga alquileres en Vergel (LLojeta), es estudiante de la carrera de informática, trabaja reparando computadoras e instalando programas de esta manera genera sus ingresos, en su domicilio actual instalo un taller de reparación de equipos de computación, el crédito que solicita es para legalizar la licencia de funcionamiento y de esta manera seguir manteniendo esta fuentes de ingresos ya que le esta yendo muy bien.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Estanislao rents a home in Vergel (Llojeta). He is a computer science student. He works repairing computers and installing programs on them. In his home, he built a repair shop for computers. The loan he is requesting is to aquire a business license and in this way maintain his business legally becaue the business is going very well.

He has already been a client of Impro and paid back his loan, so he is eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business license to open computer repair shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is fifty – six years old. She is divorced and has give birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Mary is a trader. She trades in provision and other food items. She sells in a store by the road side in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 24 años, es una joven madre de familia. Actualmente vive en la casa de su hermana junto a su esposo Javier de 25 años y su menor hijo, Yovani de 5 años, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sacar adelante a su familia. En el Centro Educativo “Escuela de Chóferes“ de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el kiosco de golosinas de Rosa y gracias a que ganó la licitación para poder vender dentro de la escuela ha podido mejorar su situación económica, su kiosco es muy concurrido por los niños, quienes la prefieren por la variedad de golosinas que vende.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que simultáneamente puede cuidar a su hijo, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su kiosco, aun así sabe que tiene estar ahí para vender más. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosa con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad de crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario al resto de los integrantes de su grupo. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para su kiosco y así incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old and a young mother. She currently lives in her sister’s house with her husband Javier, who is 24 years old, and their young child Yovani, who is 5 years old. She is willing to work very hard in order to see her family succeed. At a driving school in the city of Juliaca, Rosa manages a kiosk where she sells candy. Thanks to the bid she won to sell candy near the school, she has been able to improve her financial situation. Children keep her kiosk very busy since they prefer the variety of candy that she sells.

What Rosa enjoys most about her job is the ability to work and care for her child at the same time. She has been in business for 2 years and the most difficult part is spending all day at her kiosk, yet she knows she has to be there in order to make more sales. In the future, she hopes to open a grocery store so that she can improve her quality of life.

This is Rosa’s fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity to access credit. Rosa is admired within her Communal Bank and she is willing to provide all the necessary assistance to the other members of her group. With the loan of 600 soles that she requested, she will purchase more candy for her kiosk to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more candy to increase her inventory

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela sells clothes to make a living. She is 37 years old and married with three children. She is a friendly and hardworking woman and she uses her friendliness to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes for a loan of 140,000 naira to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Simona de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos,  los cual  se esfuerza para darles estudios y una buena alimentación, se dedica ala venta de ropa, zapatos desde varios años, comenzó ambulante por las calles de capital vendiendo ropa, el cual muy cansada llegaba a su casa, pero tenia que seguir adelante lo cual logro con el tiempo comprar un tramo, todo lo hizo con dinero que su ex esposo dio y con ahorro de su trabajo ya que trabajaba en servicios domestico en un tiempo. Pero su objetivo era lograr incrementar su negocio para poder dar los estudios a sus hijos. Ella va  a los departamentos a vender ropa ya que se vende bien lo cual le genera buenas ganancias, las dificultades que se le presenta es que el cliente abecés no paga en la fecha acordada y se atrasa con los pedidos y sus pagos los atrasa también pero mas difícil ya que en las instituciones no andan viendo los problemas personales del cliente. Con este crédito comprara ropa, zapatos en variedad y aprovechar la temporada de la navidad que es buena. La institución ha sido la fuente de  incrementar el inventario y de poder estar en mejores condiciones ya que con el crédito anterior hizo un cuarto para dar privacidad a sus hijos y se siente contenta por los beneficios obtenidos.
texts.en:
Simona, 49, is a single mother with four children. She puts forth great effort in order to give them an education and good food. She has been selling clothes and shoes for many years. She started selling clothes as a street vendor on the streets of the capital. She was very tired when she returned home from selling. But, she had to keep going forward. In time, she was able to buy a space to sell. She did it with money that her ex husband gave her and with savings from work. She worked for a time in domestic services. Her objective was to increase her business to be able to give her children an education. She goes to the departments to sell clothes. They sell well, which generates good earnings. The difficulty that presents itself is that sometimes the customers do not pay on the agreed upon date. The orders are late and the payments are also delayed. The most difficult thing is that the institutions do not look at the clients’ personal problems. She will use this loan to buy a variety of clothes and shoes to take advantage of the Christmas season, which is good. The institution has been the source of increasing her inventory and being able to be in better conditions. With the previous loan she built a room to give her children privacy. She is very content with the benefits she has obtained.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothes and shoes for this Christmas season

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese T. is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Fogapoa. She is single and does not have any children. Ese owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 140 WST a month. In 2008, Ese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ese is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Yeiza

texts.en:
Yeiza D. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Yeiza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. Her main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Yeiza has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $176 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Yeiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Yeiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 6th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Brak P., 47, is a widow who cares for her school-aged child in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she selling traditional Cambodian medicine and earns $7 per day. 

Brak and her family seek to improve their standard of living by generating a better income.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase more medicines to resell. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes to run a big store selling more traditional medicines. She also wants her child to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy medicine to re-sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to Memoh Gideon and they have seven children. She and her entire family live in a house with 12 rooms. Being a very hard working woman, she has encountered some family expenses, such as the death of family members. 

She runs a restaurant business and farming business with the support of her children and her husband. She will invest the loan in buying flour, palm oil, sugar groundnuts and seedlings for farming. With previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with cooked food for their social activities. 

This will be her third loan from GHAPE; she joined GHAPE in 2007. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location in mile 11 Bambui, the quality of her food, and her reasonable prices. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
The part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of her children; the other part will be used to expand the business. Mary does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization.

loans.use: Buy flour, palm oil and groundnuts for her restaurant and seeds for planting

loans.name: Victoria Antonieta

texts.es:
Victoria P. de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ya tiene varios años divorciada, no tiene hijos.

Victoria hace años atrás empezó a vender almuerzos a una constructora que había por su casa, poco a poco comenzó a tener ingresos necesarios para poner un pequeño restaurante en su casa.

Ahora victoria trabaja de lunes a viernes sola, cocinando platos como arroz con pollo, carne con puré, ceviches, caldos de carne, pollo, legumbre etc. Tiene un promedio de ganancias diarios de $ 30.00. Una de las dificultades que tiene es el poco espacio que tiene para atender a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para poder arreglar su casa y tener espacio para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere compra una cocina industrial y poder tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Victoria P., 49, lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil's beltway in a cement house that has all basic utilities. She has been divorced for several years and has no children. Years ago, Victoria started to sell prepared lunches to employees of a construction company near her house. Gradually, she earned enough to set up a small eatery in her home. Now, Victoria works alone, from Monday through Friday preparing dishes like: rice and beans, meat with mashed potatoes, ceviches, meat broths, chicken, vegetables, etc. Her daily profits average $30.00. One of her obstacles is that she has very little space available for her customers. She will use the funds to buy cement, stone, and sand to build a better space in her house for her eatery. In the future, she would like to buy an industrial stove and to have her own space.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, stone, sand.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. I. is forty two years old, married and has three children aged between twenty years and fifteen years. Her business is located at Mukiriti, a busy market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.

Irene has been selling fruits such as oranges, pineapples, mangoes, plums, pawpaws and bananas for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of enough funds. She also gets harassment from the local government. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Irene is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruit to expand her business. She hopes to supply her fruit to different parts of the country in future and wants to be a successful wholesaler.

Irene hopes and dreams of buying a plot for her family. She is God-fearing and friendly.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and mangoes

loans.name: Recardo

texts.en:
Recardo T. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. He is 42 years-old and married with seven 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Recardo buys and sells a variety of bananas in the local community. Recardo has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Recardo joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recardo is requesting a first loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”, actualmente se encuentra en el II ciclo, las reuniones D. los socios son una vez al mes en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa, el banco comunal esta conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las ciudades del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.
               
Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta D. yeso y tejas, venta D. comida, venta D. comestibles, venta D. verduras, venta D. ropa y zapatillas y otros ofrecen servicios D. transportes, construcción D. casas y carpintería. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Fidelia forma parte del banco comunal “Los Lideres”, ella tiene 38 años D. edad, ella vive en la ciudad D. Cusco, ella tiene tres hijos (2 varones y 1 mujer). Fidelia nos cuenta que se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. muebles D. madera, ella y su esposo tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio, ella nos cuenta que los días sábados venD. sus productos en la feria sabatina del  mercado el Molino II y los domingos en la feria dominial del Mercado D. San Sebastián, ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Fidelia requiere el préstamo para implementar su casa, ella desea comprar calaminas para techar la parte que falta D. su domicilio, su mayor anhelo D. la socia es tener su propia tienda donD. pueda expender sus productos.           

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Los Lideres Communal Bank is currently in its 2nd loan cycle. The group meetings take place once a month insiD. Asociación Arariwa's central office. This group is comprised of 14 hardworking and enterprising people who are looking for opportunities to get ahead at every moment, struggling on a daily basis to proviD. their children with a better future. The members of this group live in the city of Cusco, a place that is well known for its archaeological centers, its history, and its landscapes, which makes it an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.

The members are involved in plaster and tile sales, fast food sales, general stores, vegetable sales, and clothing and footwear sales. The other members offer transportation services, home construction, and carpentry. This group has been in existence for several loan cycles. The group members state that they are happy and satisfied with the microfinance institute's loans, savings, and training. One of the positive aspects of this bank is the chance for savings and for turning a profit.

Fidelia is a member of the Los Lideres Communal Bank. She is 38 years old and lives in the city of Cusco. She has three children (2 sons and a daughter). Fidelia makes and sells wooden furniture for a living. She and her husband have a small workshop in their home. She states that they sell their furniture at the El Molino II market every Saturday, and at the San Sebastián market every Sunday. They have been in business for 10 years and have been prosperous. Fidelia needs a loan for her house. She would like to purchase corrugated roof panels for the area of her house that lacks a roof. Her greatest wish is to have her own store to sell her products.

All the group members in general are grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan, and they are committed to making their repayments according to their pre-established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corrugated roof panels

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
