Khursheed Bibi is the wife of R. A.. She lives in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Her house consists of four rooms. She has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of her sons are over 18 and they are daily wage laborers. Her husband has a business selling sweetmeat and fruits. He has been selling these items for over 30 years. He has obtained a good reputation in the market. 

Khursheed stays at home and takes care of her family. She has fully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva partner). Now she is applying again for her husband so he can purchase items such as dry fruits, sugar, cooking oil, etc., and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy items for sweetmeat-selling business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Graciela es casada, tiene 54 años y 2 hijos, Graciela viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales, Graciela vende la carne de casa en casa, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado ovino y porcino.
Los sueños de Graciela son que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgen Mary). She is 54 years old, married, and has two children. Graciela travels to different fairs in the region to buy animals. She sells the meat door to door and engages in this business every day.

Graciela needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of sheep and pigs. She dreams of increasing her business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita L. is from the city of Annafunan West, Tuguegarao City. She is 56 years old. Teresita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Rafaela tiene la edad de 52 años, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, el cual inicio hace varios años con dinero de su trabajo como cocinera, ha invertido en cosmético y ropa, pero luego decide poner su pulpería que ha ido invirtiendo en inventario con los financiamiento que la institución ha dado.
Para mejorar su pulpería, su casa es de concreto aun falta poner el piso aun es de suelo, pero lo que quiere hacer es subir un poco mas el techo ya que es bien baja y produce mucho calor, es por eso la necesidad de levantar mas las paredes para poder estar en mejores condiciones. Para esto comprara, bloques, cemento, hierro, madera, clavos y comenzara  hacer la obra, contenta por que a través de estos préstamos esta logrando un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Rafaela is 52 years old. Her business is a small store where she sells a variety of products, which she started several years ago with money from her job as a cook. She had invested in cosmetics and clothing, but later decided to create her store for which she has been investing in stock with the funding provided by the institution. To improve her store, her house is made of concrete although it still lacks a ground floor. However, what she wants is to do is raise the roof a little more, since it is rather low and generates a lot of heat. For this reason, there is the need to put up walls in better condition. For this, she will purchase blocks, cement, iron, wood, nails, and will began to do the work. She is pleased that through these loans she is obtaining a better roof.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blocks, sand, cement, wood to raise the walls for the roof (which is currently too low and generates heat)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction supplies & pay for labor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Disud in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a general store. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Jocelyn's 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 


       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products for her store

loans.name: Nsozi Catholic Women's, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Hard-working 40-year-old K. Elizabeth has a dependable sense of purpose regarding anything to do with her six-year-old agro produce business. The devoted farmer has worked tooth and nail to keep her business, which trades in general produce sales from Karibagyira, Kyenjojo town. On the sunny side, her strong work ethic has gotten her far. Her business currently generates 140,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.  With these modest earnings, she has been able to make the best of the bad bargains that have hit her business on occasion. She gleefully reveals how she is able to educate her five school-going children (out of her eight children) in different institutions of learning with her small profits. With this loan, she envisions being financially empowered to buy more stock of maize grains, beans and cereals as she looks at expanding into a wholesale business and improving her household income from the sales in her business.

K. Elizabeth appears at the top left in the small photo just like in the big group photo.

loans.use: To purchase more maize grains, beans and cereals

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is married with six children, all of them in school, and also takes care of additional family members. She owns a bar in Nakulabye selling local brew. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerycans of local brew and local gin. She has been in this business for ten years. She also has a restaurant and sells to all categories of people. Teddy works six days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. She hopes to see her business grow big and start selling wholesale only. She lives in, and owns, a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerycans of local brew and local gin

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, comparte su vida a lado de sus hijos, juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 20 años practica el tejido, además estuvo trabajando en programas sociales, capacitando en el tejido a diversas mujeres. El buen prestigio que posee en el área del tejido a mano, le ha servido para instalar una tienda de venta de lana, de las cuales lo vende por madejas, además incluye el servicio de enseñar a tejer, este es su estrategia de venta para captar más clientes. Lleva 5 meses en este trabajo independiente, por lo que cada día lo disfruta, para ella el tejer es un Hobby, además le resulta rentable, es por eso que quiere crecer su negocio. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de lana al por mayor.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old. She lives along with her children in their own house. She has been knitting for more than 20 years. She has also worked in social programs, teaching many women how to knit. Her good reputation for knitting has helped her in opening her own store where she sells wool [yarn], which she sells by the skein. She also offers to teach people how to knit, which is her sales strategy for obtaining more customers. She has been doing this work independently for 5 months and she enjoys every day. For her, knitting is a hobby that is also profitable, so she hopes to grow her business. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support because she has always been very responsible with her payments. She also likes being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible people and are very supportive. She is grateful to the people who will contribute to the loan that she is requesting and it will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy wool yarn at wholesale price.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of colors of wool yarn

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Elvie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Cosmos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “COSMOS” y está ubicado en Toluca Estado D. México, este grupo se integra D. 11 clientas; el nombre del grupo lo tomaron del equipo D. Fut-Bol, donD. las clientas se reúnen todos los fines D. semana en dicha comunidad. 
En este grupo se encuentra L. Sra. Rosa Amelia A. L., mejor conocida en el grupo como “Rosi” elL. era tesorera del grupo hace un tiempo, nos comenta que tiene cuatro hijos D. 7, 6, 2 y 3 meses D. edad, además  su esposo desD. hace dos años trabaja D. chofer en L. línea D. transporte que va D. L. terminal D. Toluca al Municipio D. Xonacatlan, L. señora ha ocupado el crédito para invertirlo en L. venta D. cosméticos con sus familiares y conocidas, el crédito le ha servido para tener una mejor calidad D. vida, a pesar D. haber estudiado solamente L. primaria, su fin es que sus hijos puedan algún día estudiar y ser  profesionistas y no dejar D. estudiar, ya que, es muy común en dicha zona.

   En este mismo grupo se encuentra L. señora Rosa María Vázquez G. quien se dedica igualmente a L. venta D. cosméticos, L. clienta tiene 4 hijos solamente uno depenD. D. elL. y su hija es L. señora Rosa Amelia Vázquez  G., el crédito que L. clienta ocupa es para surtir su negocio D. cosméticos, los cuales venD. con sus conocidas pero su mayor ganancia L. obtiene  en L. empresa donD. labora, con sus compañeras D. trabajo cuya empresa se denomina “Mundo Dulce”, su giro es L. producción D. dulces.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA: 
María Dolores C. S.

TESORERA:    
Mariana N. N.

INTEGRANTES: 
Rosa María Vázquez G.
Azucena Méndez S.
PrisciL. I. C.
Arisbel D. L. O. V.
Rosa Amelia A. V.
Edith A. V.
María S. S.
Leonor C. S.
Gloria P. G.
texts.en:
This group is called 'COSMOS' and is located in the Toluca state in Mexico. There are 11 members of the group; they took the name from a football team in their community where all the members meet each weekend. One of the members of this group is Señora Rosa Amelia A. L, better known in the group as 'Rosi'. She was the group's treasurer for some time. Rosi tells us that she has 4 children - 7, 6, 2, and 3 months old. Her husband has worked as a chauffeur for 2 years in a transport company, where he drives from the Toluca terminal to the municipality of Xonocatlan. Rosi will use this loan to invest in the sale of cosmetics to her family and acquaintances. These loans allow her to obtain a better quality of life. As she has only studied up to primary school, her goal is that her children can one day study and be professionals and not have to abandon their studies, which is very common in this zone. Another member of this group is Señora Rosa María Vázquez G, who also works selling cosmetics. She has 4 children, only one of whom depends on her, and her daughter is señora Rosa Amelia Vázquez G. She is seeking a loan to stock her business with cosmetics, which she sells to her acquaintances. Her major source of income is obtained in the company where she works, working with colleagues for a company called 'Mundo Dulce' (Sweet World), producing sweets. The other members of the group are: PRESIDENT: María Dolores C. S. TREASURER: Mariana N. N. INTEGRANTES: Rosa María Vázquez G. Azucena Méndez S. PrisciL. I. C. Arisbel D. L. O. V. Rosa Amelia A. V. Edith A. V. María S. S. Leonor C. S. Gloria P. G.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to stock the business

loans.name: Cerilina

texts.en:
Cerilina A. is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Disud, a part of Sindangan municipality in Zamboanga del Norte province in the western Mindanao islands. Cerilina runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Cerilina joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cerilina is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 33 years old, married with five children who are 1, 4, 7, 9 and 12 years old.  Etienne is a self-employed businessman who owns a grinding machine in his village.  With this machine, he grinds a variety of foodstuffs such as sorghum, cassava, soy, wheat, etc.  Etienne has owned this machine for about five years and his business hours are from 7 am until late in the evening. 

Etienne needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will hopefully buy another mill which will be used somewhere else so as to create another source of income.  With this additional mill, he hopes that his daily income will increase and in addition to that, he will create another source of income.  If successful, Etienne will improve the lifestyle of his family and in addition to that, he will start saving for a better future for his family.

loans.use: buy another mill

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria M. C. tiene 28 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 3 hijos.

Luz pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Luz  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar terrenos.
Le gusta  visitar a la familia y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Luz Maria M. C. is 28 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She has three children.

Luz is a member of the Guantucoto Communal Bank, which is located a half hour from Guaranda. This group engages in farming and ranching, especially corn and potato production in the mountainous areas as well as in the coastal region where rice is grown. The Communal Bank has 25 members.

Luz has been farming for several years, growing potatoes and corn. She also raises and sells livestock animals. Luz buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and potatoes. With the help of this loan, she will have the financial resources to acquire necessities for her family. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that can impact her crops. Her dreams include purchasing a vehicle and buying more farmland.

Luz enjoys visiting her family and celebrating carnival.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing potatoes & corn

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. productos plásticos, es casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 14 y 24 años D. edad, este negocio tiene ya 6 años D. existir ella ofrece a los clientes, artículos plásticos, gorras, carteras y su esposo le ayuda a brindar un buen servicio y atención a los clientes.
Hoy ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería ya que los clientes le están solicitando artículos que ella no tiene y para no perderlos piensa comprar lo que le solicitan, su objetivo es brindarles lo necesario aumentando el inventario para tener disponibilidad.
 Ella sueña con mejorar el negocio, satisfacer  a los clientes, y generar más ganancias para el hogar y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maritza lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She works selling plastic products.  Maritza is married and lives with her two children aged 14 and 24.  She has had her business for 6 years.  She offers her customers plastic articles, caps and purses.  Her husband helps her to proviD. her customers with good service.

Maritza is requesting a loan to buy merchandise since her customers are asking her for articles which she doesn't have.  In order not to lose her customers she would like to buy what they are requesting.  Her goal is to proviD. them with what they need, increasing her inventory so as to have more goods available.

Martiza dreams of improving her business, satisfying her customers, making more profits for her household and supporting her children in their studies.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (plastic articles)

loans.name: Pedro Klever

texts.es:
Pedro Klever B. A. tiene 50 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN MIGUELITO se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, platano, naranja, mangos y naranja, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, platano, naranja, mangos y naranja . Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas para los cultivos y abonos y fertilizantes para las semillas cultivadas, platano, naranja, mangos y naranja. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

Le gusta pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro Klever B. A. is 50 years old. He lives in Unión Libre in the canton of Chillanes, Bolívar Province, with his partner and their children. He has 3 children.

The members of the San Miguelito Cooperative Rural Bank are located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office (of Cooperativa San Jose) in Chillanes canton. The members of this rural bank are dedicated to short cycle farming, planting, corn, bananas, oranges, and mangos. They have been in this business a long time.

Pedro is engaged in farming and planting corn, bananas, oranges, and mangos. He purchases products he needs in Matilde Esther and sells his crops in the market in Chillanes, in the same area.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase seed for his crops and fertilizer for the cultivation of bananas, oranges, and mangos. The loan will help him meet his economic needs.

He confronts challenges such as pests, diseases, and changes in climate. His dream is to continue working for the education of his children. He likes spending time with his children.

loans.use: Seed for his crops and fertilizer.

loans.name: Georgines

texts.fr:
Femme de 63 ans,veuve,mère de 3 enfants , pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille , elle ouvre un restaurant de spécialité Africaine  ou elle vend du poisson d'eau douce en bouillon et a l'étouffe dans des feuille,  depuis bientôt 20 ans.
Le prêt passé a contribuer a renforcer son stock de poisson d'eau douce comme les carpes, silures, lamproie, anguilles et   à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vente, elle  a entre autre palier  aux différentes intempéries en ajoutant des tôles, quelques ustensiles de cuisines et a fait un stock en  provisions. 

Avec le prêt actuel, elle va renforcer son stock en faisant des provisions de poisson de toutes qualités que les clients demandent souvent.Ses ventes et sa clientèle  ont augmentes, ses recettes journalières sont de 50.000 a 125.000frs par jour.
Tres entreprenante , elle tient a aller au bout de ses ambitions,et ouvrir un grand resto pour ses enfants qu'elle pourra leur laisser le jour ou elle ne sera plus la.
texts.en:
Sixty-three-old widow, mother of 3 children. To meet her family's needs, about 20 years ago she opened a restaurant specializing in African cuisine where she sells freshwater fish in stock and braised in leaves. Her previous loan was used to buy more freshwater fish such as carp, catfish, lampreys, and eel, along with the improvement of her selling conditions, she wants to buy among other things, landings to protect from bad weather, sheet metal, some cooking utensils, and provisions.

With the current loan, she will buy more fish of various kinds that her clients often ask for. Her sales and client base have increased. Her daily receipts range from 50,000 to 125,000 francs.
She is a true entrepreneur, she wants to make the most of her ambitions and open a large restaurant that she will be able to leave to her children when she passes away.

loans.use: Purchase of freshwater fish: catfish, lampreys, carp; seasonings, oil

loans.name: Antonia Romana

texts.es:
La señora  Antonia Romana R. es originaria de la localidad de Ahuehueyo municipio de CD. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Tiene 41 años no concluyo la educación básica por falta de recursos pues desde pequeña tuvo que trabajar  para ayudar en el sostenimiento de su familia, ella se dedica a las ventas por cátalo, ella va a utilizar su crédito para comprar perfumería y cosméticos por catalogo (Jafra, Avon, Fuller). Ella vende de casa en casa sus productos, los artículos que más desplaza son: perfumes, cremas, trastes, set de maquillaje, labiales, delineadores, rubor, etc. Ella tiene en el negocio desde hace  10 años, el inicio de su negocio fue difícil pues tenía que complementar su ingreso lavando ajeno o vendiendo otro tipo de productos como verdura o fruta, pues inicialmente sus ingresos de la venta por catalogo eran muy bajos, pero poco a poco fue aumentando sus clientes y se fue dedicando únicamente  a la venta de perfumería y artículos por catalogo. También nos comentó como al principio la necesidad la obligó a aumentar sus ventas pues se quedo sola con sus hijos y tuvo que ganar más para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente sigue vendiendo casa por casa, pero ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes y su ingreso es seguro cada semana. Únicamente trabaja dentro de su localidad camina de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos. Esta actividad es muy importante para ella porque de ahi obtiene los ingresos para sostener a su familia.
La parte que más disfruta de su negocio es mostrar sus catálogos y convencer a sus clientes para que le compren sus productos y se siente orgullosa de tener los ingresos que actualmente tiene gracias a su negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos sin descuidarlos. Ella atiende personalmente a sus clientes que son personas jóvenes y adultas que buscan sus productos y le da gusto que su negocio es reconocido por las personas de su comunidad a veces sus hijos le ayudan a entregar los pedidos. Algunos de los problemas que ha enfrentado su negocio es que a veces las personas la piden fiado y se atrasan en sus pagos cuando son las clausura de terminación de clases o el día de muertos y se atrasan porque usan el dinero para otros gastos, pero poco a poco le van pagando y así recupera lo que invierte. Algunos de los desafíos que ha enfrentado en su negocio es la competencia de otras personas que venden por catalogo pero ella ya tiene su clientela por la atención y el trato al cliente, normalmente lo que gana es para la alimentación de su familia y gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. A futuro pretende instalar una vitrina y exhibir sus productos en su casa.
La señora Antonia es soltera tiene 4 hijos que son: Constantino de 19 años  y trabaja, Agustín de 16 años trabaja, Leonardo de 13 años estudia la secundaria y Patricia de 22 años es casada, ellos también participan del negocio le ayudan a entregar los pedidos. Ella quiere con las ganancias de su negocio y de los prestamos de KIVA ponerle techo de colado a su casa y ampliarla haciendo dos cuartos mas. Su sueño es que su negocio permanezca estable y poder incrementarlo hasta hacerlo un negocio bien establecido. Se siente contenta de recibir el préstamo porque de esta manera va poder cumplir sus metas e incrementar sus ventas. La señora Antonia quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por la confianza y espero no defraudarlos y que sigan ayudando a más personas que lo soliciten”
texts.en:
Antonia Romana R. is from Ahuehueyo, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 41 years old and didn't finish her basic education through lack of financial resources as she had to work from a young age to help support her family.  Antonia sells products through catalogs.  She will use her loan to buy perfumes and cosmetics from catalogs (Jafra, Avon, Fuller).  She sells her products from house to house.  The products she sells most of are: perfumes, creams, utensils, make-up sets, lipsticks, eye liners, blusher, etc.  She has been in her business for 10 years.  At the beginning, her business was difficult because she had to supplement her income washing for other people or selling other types of products such as fruit and vegetables since initially her catalog sales were very low.  However, she gradually increased her number of customers and started committing herself solely to selling perfume and other items through catalogs.  She tells us that at the beginning necessity forced her to increase her sales as she was left alone with her children and she had to earn more to get them ahead in life.

Antonia currently continues to make her sales from house to house but she has a good customer base and her income is secure each week.  She only works within her neighborhood.  She walks from house to house offering her products for sale.  This business activity is very important for her because it is how she makes her income to support her family.  The part of her work she enjoys the most is showing her catalogs to her customers and persuading them to buy her products.  She feels proud to be making the income she currently makes.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to get her children ahead in life without neglecting them.  She personally serves her customers who are young people and adults who buy her products and she is pleased that her business is well known by the people in her community.  Sometimes her children help her to deliver her orders.  One of the problems that Antonia has faced in her business is people who ask to buy on credit and then don't make their repayments on time.  For example, when there are graduation ceremonies or people are celebrating 'Día de los Muertos' (Day of the Dead), they delay their payments because they use the money for other expenses.  However, they pay her back bit by bit and she recovers the money she has invested.    Another challenge she has faced in her business is the competition from other people who make catalog sales but she already has a customer base tnanks to her good customer service.  She normally uses the money she makes to feed her family and to cover her children's school expenses.  In the future, she plans to set up a display window and display her products in her home.

Antonia is single and has 4 children: 19 year-old Constantino who works, 16 year-old Agustín who works, 13 year-old Leonardo who is in high school and 22 year-old Patricia who is married.  Her children also help her in her business, delivering her orders.  Antonia would like to use the profits from her business and her Kiva loans to put a new roof on her house and to extend it, building two more rooms.  Her dream is for her business to remain stable and to increase it so that she has a well-established business.  She feels happy to be receiving this loan because it will enable her to achieve her goals and increase her sales.  Antonia would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thank you for putting your trust in me and I hope not to let you down.  I hope that you will continue helping more people who need it".

loans.use: To buy Jafra, Avon and Fuller products and Estrella perfumes

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. is a single parent taking care of one child. She cooks yams for sale at Abura, which she has been doing for two years. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase extra yams and other ingredients to cook for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to add the cooking of other foods.

In her right hand she is showing a sample of the cooked cocoyam she sells.

loans.use: purchase extra yams and other ingredients to cook for resale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre de familia, tiene de 34 años de edad, reside junto a su esposo e hijos  en el caserío  San Martín en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Jenny tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio; ella ofrece en venta  de articulos de primera necesidad a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito.Con los ingresos que el obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea  incrementar su negocio debido a la creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, . Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jenny es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Jenny is a mother, is 34 years old, and lives with her children in the country house at San Martín in the agricultural district of of Tambogrande located in the Piura region which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Jenny has a small shop in her home. She sells groceries to neighbors and townspeople of the district. She is able to provide for her family with this business.

She wishes to grow her business. Due to growing demand she has been experiencing she has thought of acquiring more products. She wants to request Edpyme Alternative a 1500 Peruvian Soles loan.

Jenny is a hardworking person, active, and very responsible. She also works in agriculture. People who know her consider her to be calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to increase her business.

loans.name: Buen Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Buen Camino está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Fátima Aduray de 25 años quien vende de ropa más de 5 años. Ella inicio su negocio con unos préstamos que hiso el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
Ella tiene la meta de terminar su carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas y salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Jamileth Pavón de 40 años quien vende ropa, comida y frescos y Ana Beatriz O. Suazo tiene una panadería desde hace 18 años.
texts.en:
The “Buen Camino” (Good Path) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  One of them is Fátima Aduray, 25, who has sold clothes for over five years.  She started her business with some loans she took out and has been growing little by little.  Her goal is to finish her Law degree and get ahead.

The other group members are Jamileth Pavón, 40, who sells clothes, food and fruit drinks and Ana Beatriz O. Suazo who has had a bakery for the last 18 years.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Josefina; La socia tiene 58 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo independiente; la socia tiene su agencia de viajes y turismo llamada Haes, esta agencia queda en la av. Sol, la socia trabaja administrando su agencia y viendo directamente todo el manejo de la misma, la socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de útiles de escritorio, y en la agencia de viajes, ella hará unos prepagos y una vez que le giren el dinero ella cancelara los tickets. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su agencia de viajes y turismo.

 La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the "PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Josefina is 58 years old, married, and has one child who lives independently.  She owns a travel and tourism agency called Haes which is located in Avenida Sol.  She runs her agency and directly oversees its management.  She will invest her loan in buying stationery supplies.  In her travel agency she will make some prepayments and once they send her the money she will cancel the tickets.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her travel and tourism agency.

Josefina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in her travel and tourism agency.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. produces palm oil for distribution to her customers. She is divorced and has been through senior high school. Abena also makes dough nuts at Abura. She has been doing multible businesses for 20 years. She is asking to use the loan to expand her palm oil business. She uses her income to take care of her family. She hopes to reinvest the new profits. Abena is showing the palm fruits she uses for the palm oil.

loans.use: to expand her palm oil business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a 42-year-old fish seller living in Baclayon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman and Estela helps operate their fishing business. She sells her husband's catch to the community. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets, which will help them have more fish to sell. Estela has 11 children. She works hard to support them.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Safiro Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Safiro: Doña herlinda A.  es Comerciante desde Hace 26 años ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza como jabon,shampoo,desinfectantes etc, ella solicita este credito para la compra de mas producto de limpieza ya que nos dice que nececita capital para aumentar su negocio.
Doña Marta casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas ella posee su propia tortilleria en su domicilio desde hace 6 años gracias a su negocio pudo darle estudio a sus hijos,ella solicita este credito para la compra de maiz por mayor y asi aumentar su ventas y de la misma manera aumentar sus ganancias.
Doña Blanca se dedica a la venta de zapatos para Dama Caballero y niños, ella nos cuenta que gracias a este negocio a podido darles a sus hijos lo necesario para su educacion,en esta ocacion ella solicita este credito para la compra de zapatos ya  que por esta epoca es cuando mas demanda tiene de sus clientes, las tres señoras le dan gracias a Dios por el apoyo que fape les a dado por medio de los creditos.
texts.en:
Sapphire Solidarity Group

Doña Herlinda A. is a 26-year-old merchant who sells cleaning products such as soap, shampoo, disinfectants, and other items. She is requesting a loan to buy more cleaning products. Herlinda says she needs capital to expand her business.

Doña Marta is married and has three children. She sells tortillas and has a shop in her home where she has been in business for six years. Thanks to her business, Marta has been able to provide for her children’s education. She is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk so that she can increase her sales and generate more income.

Doña Blanca sells shoes for women, men, and children. She says she is thankful for her business because it has enabled her to provide everything her children need for their education. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy shoes for this season since there is more demand from her customers.

These three women thank God for the support FAPE has given by granting them loans.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products.

loans.name: Duo Monte Oreb Group

texts.es: Duo Monte Oreb: Doña Cristy Carolina se dedica a la venta y confeccion de tejidos nos cuenta que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace años, y que le ha hido bien porque a logrado abtener munchos clientes a base de su calidad porque es nuy buena en su area ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para seguir confeccionando tejidos,por su parte la señora Ruth tambien se dedica a la venta y confeccion de tejidos ella nos solicita este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos el sueño de ellas es poder tener mas capital para trabajar y agrandar mas su negocio para poder esta bien economicamente.
texts.en: The loan group “Duo Mount Horeb’: Ms Cristy Carolina works making and selling fabrics which she has been doing for years.  It has gone well for her as she has obtained many customers based on her quality, which is very good in her area. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials to continue making fabrics.  As for Mrs. Ruth, she also makes a living selling manufactured fabrics. She requests a loan for the purchase of raw materials for clothing fabrics with the dream of having more working cash flow to expand her business and improve her personal financial stability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make fabrics

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es casada con el señor Sergio, con quien procreo  cuatro hijos  quienes ya están casados y a su responsabilidad  tiene  dos nietos que  estudian en el colegió : Sergio Rodulfo  de catorce años y José Daniel  de doce años de edad.

    El préstamo que ella solicito  lo invertía en  la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, como son: harina, huevo, aceite, queso, royal, entre otros, en esta actividad lleva  tres años y nueve meses en donde le va bien ya que con ello a estado teniendo ingresos en su hogar.

    Se inspiro en esta actividad  para que con ello pueda trabajar para tener ingresos y así poder apoyar a sus dos nietos que están estudiando, como también de las ganancias obtener para cubrir los gastos pequeños que se generan en su hogar.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda estar trabajando  así lograr ahorrar y de ellos aportar para que sus nietos sigan estudiando  y terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Señora Luisa is married to Señor Sergio with whom she engendered four children who are now married. She is responsible now for two grandchildren who are attending high school: Sergio Rodulfo who is 14 and José Daniel who is 12 years old. 

She will invest the loan she is seeking in the purchase of ingredients for making breads and pastries, such as flour, eggs, oil, cheese, and baking powder among others. She has had this business for three years and nine months and it is going well, since she has been bringing in profits for her household. 

She was inspired to start this business so she could work for profits with which to support her two grandchildren who are in school, as well as have money from the earnings to cover the small costs generated by her household. 

What she most wishes for is that with this business she would be able work and thus save money to contribute to her grandchildren's continued studies so that they may complete professional education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making breads and pastries.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 16 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has no children. Jane has a tailoring business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her access to more capital, which has improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 62 años, tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, ella cuenta con una buena clientela, que siempre llega a su vivienda pues saben que ofrecer mercadería en general. Maria se dedica a esto desde hace más de 12 años ella trabaja todos los días y desde muy joven a prendió a ganarse la vida y sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo que no es su primera experiencia con financiamientos, pues han sido necesarios para su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar perfumes, ropa interior, ropa en general y tratamientos para el cabello y la piel.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 62 years old and has two children who both work independently.  Maria has good customers who are always coming to her home as they know that she sells general merchandise.

Maria has been in this business for more than 12 years.  She works every day.  When she was very young she learned to earn a living and cover her household expenses.  This is not Maria's first experience with loans as they have been necessary for her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy perfume, underwear, clothes, and hair and skin treatments.

loans.use: to buy perfume, underwear, clothes, and hair and skin treatments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old single lady. She has rental houses and also sells second-hand clothes, a business she has been running for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000, which she puts back in her business.

Mary has been loaned KES 35,000 by KADET LTD. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to add more stock of second-hand children clothing.   She plans to use the profit from her business to buy a plot and build more rental houses.  In the future, she hopes to have five plots of rental houses.

loans.use: buy second-hand children clothing

loans.name: Bëgg Cheikh Moustapha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bëgg Cheikh Moustapha du Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla est créé depuis le 21 septembre 2010, il est composé de neuf femmes qui sont unies par affinité et par des liens de voisinage elles s'activent dans le petit commerce.


Madame Mame Diarra la responsable est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée avec trois enfants en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce et a une bonne expérience. Elle est à droite debout à l'extrême sur la photo habillée en robe multicolore.


Elle achéte ses pagnes, draps et colliers dans une grande ville proche et revend dans son quartier et au marché du village.



Son prêt lui servira à acheter plus de marchandises pour satisfaire la clientèle mais aussi pour se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec les bénéfices attendus soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille en nourriture et santé et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: The solidarity group Bëgg Cheikh Moustapha, belonging to the Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla, was created on September 21, 2010. It is composed of nine women who are united by ties of friendship and neighborhood. They are active in small trade. Mrs Mame Diarra, the president of the group, is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children, all in her care. She is a small merchant with good experience. She is the first person standing at the right-hand side of the photo and wearing a multicolored dress. She buys pagnes (colored West African cloths), linen and necklaces in a nearby large city and resells them in her neighborhood and at the village market. She will use her loan to buy more goods to satisfy her customers and also to earn more money. Thanks to the expected profit, she wants to support her husband with household expenditures (food and healthcare) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, linen and necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Rina Mirian

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Rina y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 49 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la crianza de pollos y cuyes”. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities are producing coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.

In the town of Quillabamba we visit the "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” community bank and meet Rina who tells us:

"I was born in the town of Quillabamba and I am 49 years old.  I live in the town in which I was born and my main business activity is raising chickens and guinea pigs".

On this occasion, Rina needs a loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Rosa Ilda

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con una hija y tres nietos, es viuda, propietaria de una venta de ropa, este negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa comenzó con ropa americana ahora vende ropa nueva, todos los días de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.
Ella, solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y más mercadería, esta compra le ayudara para surtir el negocio y ofrecerles más mercadería a sus clientes.
Su más grande sueño es trabajar con fondos propios y recibir mejores ganancias para tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with a daughter and three grandchildren. She is a widow and the owner of a clothing sales business which came about through her own initiative. She began with American clothing and now sells new clothing, every day from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m.

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of shirts, pants, skirts and more merchandise. This purchase will allow her to stock the business and offer more merchandise to her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to work with her own funds and to obtain better earnings so she could have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts and more merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия не замужем. Она сама воспитывает сына подростка. Наталия проживает в Никополе. Там она торгует детской обувью. Занимается этим она уже 15 лет и говорит, что торговать обувью для детей хорошо тем, что мало конкурентов. Однако  в этом бизнесе есть и свои сложности, например, часто часть товара остается  невостребованной и нереализованной. Тем не менее, Наталия не опускает руки и не ленится развивать свой бизнес. На данный момент сумма в товаре у нее составляет больше 100 000 гривен. 

У Наталии есть качественный товар на любой кошелек и вкус, а, значит, всегда есть и спрос на товар и постоянные покупатели. Наталии необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести осеннюю детскую обувь и получить новый ассортимент для бизнеса, что, в свою очередь даст продолжение ее бизнесу. У Наталии многолетний опыт работы, ее можно охарактеризовать как очень прилежного предпринимателя. Она умеет выбрать закупаемый товар.    

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nataliya is single. She is raising a teenage son on her own. Nataliya lives in Nikopol. She sells children’s shoes. She has been in this business for 15 years. She says selling children’s shoes is good because there is not much competition. However, this business too has its difficulties; for example, often part of her stock remains unclaimed and unsold. Nevertheless, Nataliya does not give up and spares no effort in developing her business. At the moment she has  stocked goods worth over 100,000  UAH.

Nataliya offers quality wares for every budget and taste, which means her wares are in demand  and she has loyal customers. Nataliya needs a loan of 15,000  UAH in order to buy children’s shoes for the fall season and expand her stock, which will allow her to grow her business. Nataliya has many years of work  experience and may be described as a very steadfast entrepreneur. She knows how to select wares for resale.

Note: the lender profile is in Russian

loans.use: to buy children’s shoes for the fall season and expand her stock

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela, vive con su madre y cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos y además tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas que se lo administra su hermano, lleva 13 años en el taller, y un año vendiendo mariscos; Actualmente quiere un préstamo para invertirlo en pescado, camarones, langostas, churrias para el negocio, con esta compra quiere estar siempre atenta a las necesidades de los clientes.
El préstamo será su apoyo para crecer con el inventario, mejorando sus ganancias y ofreciendo un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Adela lives with her mother and five children.  Her business is selling seafood and she also has a metal shop which her brother runs.  She has been in the metal shop business for 13 years and has been selling seafood for one year.  She would currently like a loan to invest in fish, shrimp, lobster and 'churria' for her business.  This purchase will allow her to always respond to the needs of her customers.

This loan will be a support to Adela.  It will allow her to increase her stock, improve her profits and offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, lobster and 'churria' for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old. She is married to Martin and they are blessed with children that go to school. She sells chickens in the area of Mathare Kasoro;Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 4,000 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to purchase more chicken. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Jennifer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business by purchasing more fish for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her children are living separately. Her husband is currently unemployed and is hospitalized after injuring himself at the construction site. She started her business in 2002 by buying animals from the countryside and selling them in the city and local town. She has managed this business for 9 years and she gained lots of work and business experience. She has a car and collects livestock with her car. After collecting several animals, she sells them in the city once or twice a month. Her husband also helps her to manage the business. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says "I want to live in the countryside. There, I want to have several animals to herd." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy 20 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Edubiges

texts.es:
Edubiges de 42 años es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años, con el que sueña verlo convertido en un profesional exitosos. Para ello diariamente se dedica a producir en su negocio ingresos para aportarle al bienestar de su hogar. Sus ideas emprendedoras nacieron hace 15 años cuando empezó a comprar mercancía para luego ofrecerla a vecinas amigas y familiares, su actividad poco a poco creció y así trabajó durante 4 años. Posteriormente le pareció de mayor oportunidad vender queso y vísceras,  pues trabajaba con estos productos en la modalidad de contado,  y así estuvo durante 6 años más. Cuando su esposo empezó a trabajar en una empresa su padre continuó  el negocio y  en el momento en que su cónyuge dejó de trabajar como empleado, retomó su antiguo negocio, pero agregaron arepas asadas, invirtiendo la liquidación que recibió de su empleo, en herramientas, equipos e implementos para desarrollar con éxito esta actividad, como en la actualidad lo hace, aprovechando su cercanía con colegios que son su mayor mercado. 
Su sueño de negocio es tener varios puntos comerciales y por eso   requiere capital de trabajo para comprar un nuevo carro de  arepas que pueda ubicar en un sitio estratégico y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un nuevo carro de arepas, con el cual generará nuevos ingresos pues ha identificado un potencial mercado en el cual puede extender su jornada de trabajo hasta las horas de la noche, y tendrá éxito pues aplicará toda su experiencia que convertirá en nuevas utilidades.
texts.en:
Edubiges, 42, is a married woman and she has a 14-year-old son who she dreams will become a successful professional.  To accomplish this she focuses on producing income from her business to provide wellbeing for her home.  Her enterprising ideas arose fifteen years ago when she started to buy merchandise to then sell among her friends, neighbors and relatives.  

Her business gradually grew and she worked that way for four years.  Later, she thought selling cheese and offal was a better opportunity since she already sold such items for cash.   She worked that way for six more years.  When her husband started to work for a firm her father continued with the business but when her husband stopped working as a salaried employee she retook her old business but added grilled arepas [A griddle-cake made of soaked corn ground into a paste or dough] investing his severance pay into the business: tools, equipment and implements to successfully carry out this activity.  She’s still in this business taking advantage of being near schools which are her main market.

Her business dream is to have several sales points and this is why she needs working capital to buy a new arepa cart to position strategically and this is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy a new arepa cart to generate new income since she’s identified a potential market where she can extend her working hours into the night.  She will be successful because she will apply all her experience to create new profits.

loans.use: to buy a new arepas cart.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 21-year-old Lebanese engaged woman living with one parent and three siblings. She has been working as a nurse since 2008 healing patients wherever they are located. In parallel, she started to work in a local hospital in 2009. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on her car which will facilitate her transportation towards patients. In the future, she plans to take another Kiva loan in order to strengthen her business and earn more income as she intends to get married soon and needs to support her fiancé with the wedding expenses.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on her car which will facilitate her transportation towards patients

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40-years-old . She is married with 3 children.
 
Maribel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Maribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Carmita De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmita es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, es una zona que se encuentra rodeada de montañas y vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Carmita tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido una niña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar de manera independiente.
 
La Señora. Carmita se dedica al cuidado de su hija y su mayor tiempo pasa en casa en donde se dedica a la cría de pollos y a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las que son para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un calefón para mantenerles a los pollos a una temperatura adecuada para que no se le enfermen ni mueran.
 
Su meta es agrandar su galpón para criar más pollos.
texts.en:
Carmita is a member of the community bank El Paraíso.  She lives in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca.  This place has a cold climate; it's in a zone that finds itself surrounded by mountains and vegetation.  Its people work at raising animals, agriculture and many also work in different trades in the city, maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

Doña Carmita is 23 years old, lives in a common law marriage and through the fruit of that union, has conceived a girl who is now 3 years old.  Her husband works in the branch of construction as a bricklayer.  They don't have their own home but they live independently in the house of a relative.  
 
Carmita works taking care of her daughter and spends most of her time at home where she works raising chickens and in agriculture.  She plants vegetables that are for consumption in her home as well as for sale.
 
She has been a member of the community bank for 4 years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of a boiler in order to maintain the chickens at an adequate temperature so that they don't become sick or die.  

Her goal is to enlarge her chicken coop in order to raise more chickens.

loans.use: to purchase a boiler.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Daniel;  El socio tiene 34 años de edad, El socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 3 hijos de 12, 11, 1 año de edad; el socio trabaja en una empresa de saneamiento básico, y también tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas, el socio produce quiwicha, quinua, maíz; El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar quiwicha.


El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Daniel, 34, belongs to the “San Antonio de San Salvador” communal bank located in San Salvador District in Pisac Province and Cusco Department.  He has a spouse and three children who are 12, 11 and 1 year old.  He works for a basic sanitation firm and also owns farmland.  He grows amaranth, quinoa and corn.  He requests the loan to buy amaranth seeds.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy amaranth seeds.

loans.name: Nzungwa

texts.en:
Nzungwa, 37, is a single mother of two children who both attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (Sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Danilo tiene 20 años edad y es soltero, él trabaja como cheff en uno de los restaurantes más visitados por los turistas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya es un año que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien.  Danilo y su mama tiene un negocio familiar de venta de productos de primera necesidad en un local alquilado. En esta oportunidad Danilo requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Danilo es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Danilo was born in the city of Ollantaytambo (an Incan archaeological site in the capital of the district of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba) located in southern Peru 90 kilometers northeast of Cusco.  

Danilo is 20 years old and single.  He works as a chef in one of the restaurants most visited by tourists in Ollantaytambo.  He has been working here for a year and doing well.  Danilo and his mother have a small family business selling basic foodstuffs in a shop they rent.  For this opportunity, Danilo requests the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and other things. 

Danilo is a member of the group “Always Moving Forward” which consists of 12 partners from the city of Ollantaytambo where they work.

loans.use: buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is  46 years old and mother of 3 children.  She rears poultry for sale in her locality Mshomoroni- Mombasa, She has been in business for the past six months with great success.  

She is requesting for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicken for rearing and resale.  She will use the proceeds to expand her business and to repay her loan. 
 Her hopes and dreams are to venture into large scale commercial poultry farming and to have a happy and prosperous family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nora Elena

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor manera como se puede calificar y reconocer a Nora Elena. La esposa de un hermano le enseñó a elaborar dulces de chocolate y Nora Elena vio una gran oportunidad de negocio, por lo que empezó a elaborar los chocolates y a buscar venderlo por las tiendas de su sector. Al principio Nora Elena tuvo que superar grandes adversidades como la de conseguir un proveedor de calidad y de buenos precios, pero a Nora Elena no la aplacó nada y consiguió un excelente proveedor con excelentes precios. Ahora, Nora Elena comercializa sus productos por las tiendas de su sector y a algunos particulares les vende unas cantidades pequeñas, a tal punto que a Nora Elena le hacen más pedidos de los que puede producir. Es por esto que Nora Elena comprará más moldes y más materia prima para la producción de sus chocolates, sin embargo, actualmente no tiene el capital disponible para ello puesto que sus clientes le pagan a crédito, por lo que Nora Elena aspira a que con un préstamo pueda adquirir los moldes y la materia prima que necesita y su negocio siga creciendo para que genere mas ingresos. 

Nora Elena tiene un gran sueño y es el de tener una gran fábrica de dulces, y que su hijo de 10 años pueda heredar todo lo que ella con tanto esfuerzo ha buscado. Además, Nora Elena aspira a generar empleo muy pronto, y contratar a personas de bajos recursos que requieran de unos ingresos, así le mejorará la calidad de vida tanto a su hijo como a las demás personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
The best way to describe Nora Elena is "entrepreneur." Her sister-in-law taught her to make chocolate candies and Nora Elena saw a great business opportunity, so she began to make chocolates and found stores in her area where she could sell them. 

In the beginning, Nora Elena had to overcome great adversities, such as finding a supplier with quality goods and good prices, but Nora Elena refused to give up, and found an excellent supplier with excellent prices. Now Nora Elena markets her products in the local stores and sells a few to individuals, to the point where Nora Elena has more orders than she can fill. This is why Nora Elena wants to purchase more molds and raw materials for producing her chocolates, however right now she doesn't have the necessary capital for this since her customers pay her on credit. 

With this loan, Nora Elena's goal is to acquire the molds and raw materials she needs, and to continue the growth of her business in order to generate more income. Nora Elena's grand dream is to have a large chocolate factory, and for her 10 year old son to be able to inherit everything she has built through so much effort. In addition, Nora Elena hopes very soon to create jobs, and to hire people of little means who need some income. In this way she will improve her son's quality of life, as well as that of other people who need it.

loans.use: to purchase molds and raw materials for making chocolates

loans.name: Takku Liggey Ikagel Group

texts.fr:
Elles travaillent toute dans une usine de poissonnerie et c’est d’ailleurs comme cela, qu’elles  ont formé leur groupe de crédit et l’ont nommé : Takku Liggey IKAGEL. 
Leur présidente, la dame Aminata âgée de 48 ans qui se trouve accroupi sur la photo, a une expérience de 20 ans dans l’usine. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfant. Parallèlement à cette activité, Aminata fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques et le crédit lui permettra d’acheter du parfum, et du lait pour le corps destinés à la revente. Elle travaille de 7h à 8h du soir. 
C’est son époux qui s’occupent des charges familiales, et donc, elle appuie sa maman dans ses besoins personnels.
 Dans l’avenir, elle désirerait ouvrir sa propre boutique.

loans.use: acheter des produits cosmétiques pour revendre( parfum, lait pour le corps)

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en: Tracy is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Chiredzi District. She sells clothing from her stand at the local flea market and uses her profits to pay her children’s school fees. Tracy is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more stock to increase her business. She plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business and build a boutique. Tracy volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide leading life skills sessions and teaching her students about effective communication. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Qandi Gul

texts.en:
Qandi Gul is a 39 year old widow with 3 of her children living in Distrit 15 of Kabul City, her original place is the North of Afghanistan where the place was extremely damaged during the 5 years of Taliban Gov, she lost her Husband and the whole house 7 years ago.

She got AFSG first loan to make more hand embroidery and peral sewing to design women and girls dresses for wedding and other special occasions.

loans.use: To buy the sewing supplies, Fabric and peral to make dresses

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 32 years and a single mother of 3 children. She had basic education. She is presently engaged in the food distribution chain.

Mercy purchases maize, beans, and groundnuts from Techiman, a major cereal market in the middle part of the country, for resale in Takoradi. The market appears very promising, looking at her sales records over the last 6 months.

Mercy anticipates using the KIVA loan to increase the number of sacks that she brings back per trip. In this way, she hopes to meet the needs of her clients better.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elzamin

texts.en: Elzamin M. is a very successful businessman- he sells textiles and bed accessories in the central bazaar in Sabirabad. He likes his job very much and does everything he can to improve it. “More improvements needs more money,” notes Elzamin. He borrowed a $1200 USD loan for successful improvements, and he plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make his business even better.

loans.use: Mr. Musayev would like to broaden his textiles store.

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en: Shuhratjon S. is 24 years old and is single.  He lives in Qurgan-tube and has a secondary school education.  Shuhratjon grew up in a big family so he supports his needs by himself. Two years ago he rented a store-front in a Qurgan-tube market and sold coverlets. It was a very profitable business, especially in a wedding season.  As a school starts soon, he has decided to buy school uniforms and equipment.  With a loan of$1000, he is going to buy school uniforms and footwear for low prices. This loan helps to diversify his range of products and locals will be ableto buy school uniforms for a low price.   Shuhratjon plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and footwear for sale

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a fighter who to this day manages to provide the best for his family through his effort, early mornings, and constant work. For this reason he leaves home very early and leads his small animals toward his farmland where he works all day. His self-sacrificing wife stays at home taking care of their young sons and the pigs that they raise in order to supplement their family income. Teofila, Victor’s wife, lives in fear for her persistent husband's health. Three months ago they found a tumor in his stomach, but due to a lack of money it still has not been removed. In order to operate soon, his worried wife has made the special request for collaboration with her family for the well-being of the man of the house. With that goal in mind, she is asking for $175 dollars in order to sow a large quantity of potatoes that after being marketed will give Victor admittance into the operating room of a local hospital. Let’s not be indifferent toward this family’s misfortune. Let’s give them our support.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor es un hombre luchador que hasta el día de hoy procura darle lo mejor a su familia a base de esfuerzo y muchas madrugadas de constante trabajo, razón por la que abandona su hogar muy temprano y sale con sus animalitos rumbo a sus campos de cultivo en el que permanece trabajando todo el día. Su abnegada esposa se queda en casa cuidando de sus pequeños hijos y los cerditos que crían para incrementar el ingreso familiar.Teofila esposa de Víctor, vive angustiada por la salud de su obstinado esposo debido a que hace tres meses le detectaron un tumor en el estómago y que por falta de dinero aún no ha podido ser extirpado.Con el propósito de operarlo pronto su preocupada esposa nos hace la especial petición de colaborar con su familia para el bienestar del jefe de su hogar.Teniendo en cuenta este propósito solicita la suma de 175 dólares para sembrar una gran cantidad de papa que luego de ser comercializada posibilitará el ingreso de Víctor al quirófano en un nosocomio de su localidad. No seamos indiferentes ante esta desgracia familiar y brindémosles nuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Guillermina Patricia

texts.es:
Guillermina Patricia currently runs a small stall inside the central market in León where she sells popular household products and foods that are staples in Nicaragua such as rice, oil, beans, etc. She acquires these products through distributors who sell wholesale.

She is married and with her husband she tends to this business in which she has worked for more than 13 years. When she was left unemployed, she looked for an alternative way to earn her income, and began selling clothing and beauty items such as rings, earrings and hair accessories in the street. She started her business with 33 USD.

Guillermina has been working for two years with the loans extended by CEPRODEL. The 8 loans she has received have helped her stock her business, rent a stall in the market and add variety to her inventory in order to offer her clients a little bit of everything. Her goal is to buy her stall in the market in order to free herself from the expense of rent and improve the structure of the stall.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Guillermina Patricia actualmente tiene un pequeño módulo dentro del mercado Central en León donde vende productos populares para el hogar y productos de la canasta básica de los Nicaragüenses como el Arroz, Azucar, Aceite, Frijoles etc. Estos productos los obtienes por medio de Distribuidores que venden al por mayor (a precios accesibles).

Ella esta casada y junto con su esposo atienden el negocio que lleva mas de 13 años de trabajar en él. Al quedarse desempleada buscó otra alternativa, inició vendiendo ropa en la calle, articulos de belleza como anillos, aretes, y adornos para el cabello. Inició con U$33(treinta y tres dolares)

Lleva dos años trabajando con los créditos que otorga la organización (CEPRODEL), y los 8 créditos que ha tenido le ayudaron a surtir el negocio, alquilar un módulo del Mercado y variar su mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes de todo un poco. Tiene como meta comprar su modulo para no seguir alquilando y mejorar la infraestructura.

loans.use: Buy food staples (rice, beans, sugar, oil) and other products to sell to her clients

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en: Taumaia is a 45 year-old mother, married with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer who has dedicated his time to work everyday.
