Throughout the years, they have had a hard time cleaning and clearing the area for the plantation. With her first loan, she managed to buy pesticides and it made the work easier and quicker. She is very thankful for such a great opportunity to develop her plantation and to improve her family's lives.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is a young woman who is making great efforts to succeed in life. For more than three years, she has been selling perfumes and women’s clothing in order to support her university studies. María explains that her inventory is still limited but she plans on expanding the business with the loan she has requested.

María studies Education Sciences at a university in Santo Domingo, the capital, and has to go outside her community thrice a week to attend the classes. María hopes she will have the requested funds soon so that she can be one step closer to get professional and have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to move forward a small business so that the entrepreneur can continue with her university studies.

loans.name: Lukoto East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Monica M.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of matooke. Monica is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 2 children, age 25 to 26. Each week, Monica makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to support the family and invest more in her business. Monica has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Monica is joined in her small group by Hasifa S., Monica N., Florence K., and Aisha Z.. Hasifa S. has a business selling bananas and wants to add more capital. Monica N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Florence K. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase a fridge. Aisha Z. is currently in the business of selling sponges and is requesting a loan to add capital and boost business.

loans.use: To expand matooke business and increase profits

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village C(V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Becca N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Becca is 25 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from ages 7 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Becca makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Becca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Becca is joined in her small group by Lucy T. and Fauzia N.. Lucy T. has a business running a kiosk and wants to add more stock. Fauzia N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 38 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 16,12 and 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, 3 months. Ester is clothes (khanga) seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloths (khanga) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga) for her business.

loans.name: Resmiati

texts.id:
Resmiati (27 year old) sells snacks such as fish chips and cakes and also beverages, soaps, instant noodles, cigarettes and phone cards. Her business, located at Jl.Dewi Madri Renon Denpasar, is very promising because of its strategic place, off an arterial road in Denpasar. She opens her kiosk from 08:00 AM untill 10:00 PM . Since her kiosk is always busy, she often can not take rest. Resmiati works really hard since she wants to save for her four year old child's education. Now she is asking a loan to expand her kiosk. She really hopes that DINARI can help make her wish comes true.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Resmiati (27 tahun) sehari-harinya berjualan makanan ringan seperti krupuk, jajan dan kue serta juga menjual minuan, sabun, mie instan, rokok dan juga pulsa. Usaha jualannya yang terletak di Jl.Dewi Madri Renon Denpasar cukup menjanjikan karena berada ditempat yang strategis karena merupakan jalan penghubung ke Kota Denpasar. Setiap harinya dia membuka kiosnya dari jam 08.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam. Karena pelanggannya sangat ramai, dia kadang tidak sempat istirahat. Resmiati cukup ulet dalam bekerja, karena dia berkeinginan nantinya dari hasil usahanya dia bisa menabung untuk pendidikan anaknya yang saat ini berusia 4 tahun. Saat ini dia mengajukan pinjaman untuk modal membesarkan kiosnya. Dia sangat berharap DINARI bisa mewujudkan keinginannya.

loans.use: To expand her kiosk

loans.name: Maksharali

texts.en: U. Maksharali was born in 1961 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Maksharali is involved in the commercial services and livestock trading sectors in which he has ten years of experience. In addition, he works in the collective farm. Maksharali currently needs a business development loan of US$625 for a 6-month term.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji, the wife of F. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a four room brick house and is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her sons finished their education at the 10th standard (grade) while her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now is applying for a loan to buy more shoes to resell in her husband’s shoe shop.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Anwar baji wants to buy garments to resell locally; Rashda baji seeks a loan for her grocery shop; Nadia baji wants a loan for her stove to make and sell nan (bread), while Majeedan baji wishes to buy oil to cook her Punjabi food (samosas, pakodas, etc.), which she then sells.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun N., age 32, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2002, she has been working on her rice paddy field to earn a living and is able to earn around $1.50 each day. Her husband, Khum Oeun, age 36, is a construction worker who builds houses, and he also raises ducks for extra profit. On average, he makes around $2 of profit each day. This couple has two children and both of them are students.

Mrs. Oun N. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. The remainder will be used to purchase more ducks. (Mrs. Oun N. is pictured with her husband.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. The remaining amount will be used to purchase more ducks.

loans.name: Maryam's Tusife Moyo Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 34 years old, married, and has three children, all between 3 and 10 years old. Since 2006, Maryam has been working as a food and clothing seller. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$90 from the sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more food items and clothes for her sales business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Mwanajuma, who also has a clothing sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of food items and clothes for sale

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio es de las personas que pone como prioridad la palabra de Dios, viaja a diversos lugares como misionero, enseñando la Biblia, hace esto sin descuidar su actividad como agricultor y gracias a la ayuda de su esposa puede realizar sus múltiples tareas.  Demetrio viaja constantemente, pero la gran mayoría de días en el mes lo pasa junto a su familia en sus terrenos de cultivo, lo encontramos en las afueras de su hogar  extendiendo la cosecha de café, tiene la esperanza que los precios del café mejoren para que pueda obtener mejores ganancias.  De igual manera, espera incrementar su producción y para ello, para ellos solicita este préstamo, inversión que hará en sus plantaciones de café, para que con la mejora de sus ingresos pueda tener la posibilidad de brindar educación superior a sus tres hijas y también continuar viajando llevando la palabra de Dios a las personas.  Esperamos que usted pueda brindarle el apoyo  necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Demetrio is one of those people that puts a priority on the word of God. He travels to diverse places like a missionary, teaching the Bible. He does this without neglecting his activities as a farmer and, thanks to the aid of his wife, he can carry out his multiple tasks. Demetrio travels constantly, but the great majority of the days of the month he spends with his family in his fields. We find them on the outskirts of his home, extending the coffee crop. He hopes that the prices of coffee will improve so that he can obtain better profits. Similarly, he hopes to increase his production and for this, he requests this loan. He will invest in his coffee plantations, so that, with the improvement of his income, he can have the opportunity to offer higher education to his three daughters and also to continue travelling carrying the word of God to the people. We hope that you can offer him the necessary support to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jigignouma (Sûre Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Spécialisées dans le commerce d’articles divers tel que les pagnes wax, bazins moins riche(tissus très prisés en Afrique), chaussures, porte monnaies, bois de chauffe, sucre, lait, spaghetti et tissus brodés, les cinq (5) femmes du groupe Jigignouma (toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et de 4 enfants) vivent dans des grandes familles traditionneles à Sanoubougou II, le centre ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).

Les femmes de ce groupe Jigignouma de l’association Soleil de Sanoubougou II sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. Elles sollicitent ce troisième prêt pour pouvoir acheter, 1 sac de sucre, 3 cartons de lait, 1 carton de spaghetti, 3 cartons de savon, 3 pièces de tissus brodés, 2 pièces de bazin, 3 pièces de pagne wax, 1 chargement de camion “10 Tonnes” en  bois de chauffe, 10 paires de chaussures et 10 portes monnaies.
Les villes de Bobo Dioulasso en Burkina Faso, de Bamako et de Sikasso au Mali sont les principales sources d’approvisionnent de ces femmes. Elles vendent leurs marchandises au marché de la ville de Sikasso (et queques fois de façon ambulante dans les quartiers) en gros, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  Certaines femmes envoient leurs marchadises à Abidjan(république de la Côte d’Ivoire) où elles seront vendues.          
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce troisième prêt un bénéfice moyen de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
Specialized in the commerce of various goods, such as Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), 'moins riche' damasks (highly prized fabrics in Africa), shoes, wallets, firewood, sugar, milk, spaghetti, and embroidered fabrics, the five women of the group Jigignouma live in large traditional families in Sanoubougou II, the downtown area of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are married and average 31 years of age and four children. The women of this group, of the association Soleil de Sanoubougou II, are on their third solidarity loan (group loan) with Soro Yiriwaso. All of the preceding loans have been repaid. They are requesting this loan to be able to buy: 1 sack of sugar, 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of spaghetti, 3 boxes of soap, 3 lengths of embroidered fabrics, 2 lengths of damask, 3 lengths of Wax pagnes, 1 ten-tonne truckload of firewood, 10 pairs of shoes, and 10 wallets. The cities of Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso and Bamako and Sikasso in Mali are the principal sources of supplies for these women, who sell their merchandise at the marketplace of the city of Sikasso (and sometimes door-to-door in the districts) either wholesale or retail, cash and credit accepted. Some women send their merchandise to Abidjan (Republic of Côte d'Ivoire), where they are sold. With this third loan, they each hope to realize an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per month, which will be used to cover the loan interest, provide for their families, and to invest the remainder in their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods (Was pagnes, damask, shoes, wallets, firewood, sugar, milk, spaghetti, embroidered fabrics

loans.name: Tujumuike Group

texts.en:
Sabina T. is a 34-year-old single woman. She has 3 children (ages 11, 8, and 4), but she also cares for another dependent. She has not one but two businesses: she sells milk (she owns 3 cows), and she has a “Mama Lishe” (a small outdoor café where she sells drinks and hot snacks). She started these businesses 8 years ago, and she works on a daily basis from 7 am until 8 pm. By doing so, she is able to earn approximately $224 per month from her milk-selling business and $120 per month from her Mama Lishe.

Sabina has already received one prior loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand and improve her businesses, and she promptly repaid that particular loan. Now, she is applying for another loan in order to buy items such as oil and rice for her café, as well as cow feed for her three cows. Notably, Sabina will share the loan proceeds with her loan group, Tujumuike, which totals 15 members. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. In the picture, Sabina is standing on the left.

loans.use: To further expand her businesses by purchasing oil and rice (for her café) and cow feed (for her milk-selling business).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Sokchearn A. is a farmer who lives in Chi Paing village in Kampong Cham province. Mrs. Sokchearn A. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old. Sokchearn rents a plot of land where she grows vegetables. She now wants to grow potatoes so she has decided to ask for a loan of $500 to rent a plot of land to cultivate potatoes. Her husband, Mr. Sor Kimra, helps her on the plantation. He is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a plot of land to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Rohatoy

texts.en:
Rohatoy S. is 36 years old. She is married with five children. For 10 years already, Rohatoy is running a catering business where she is providing meals consisting of the national cuisine. Her catering room is located near her house and she has many customers, considering that there are many offices located there. Every day she purchases the freshest foodstuffs and cooks delicious dishes.

Over time she has expanded her business, and now Rohatoy has two assistants who help her with the business. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of 3200 Somoni with a term of 12 months in order to expand her business further so as to earn enough in order in future to send her children to the university. She will use the loan for purchasing foodstuffs for her canteen. She thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs for her canteen

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 25 años y vive  con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa de su suegra. Mary tiene un local donde ofrece el servicio de Internet desde hace 3 años, empezó solo con 4 computadoras y hoy tiene más de 10, brinda este servicio a sus vecinos, sobre todo a los escolares que buscan los temas de sus tareas por este medio, por lo que la mejor época de ingresos es durante el año escolar. En tiempo de vacaciones suele bajar la demanda, que sin embargo no es  perjudicial ya que  de todas maneras  compensa  lo invertido. Mary tiene planes de mejorar su negocio y estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología con sus computadoras por la cual está ahorrando sus  ganancias cada vez más. Es la segunda vez que Mary solicita un préstamo en MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de continuar adelante por el bienestar de su banco comunal. La cantidad solicitada es para invertirla en el  mantenimiento y reparación de sus computadoras, además hará el cambio de otras que ya están inservibles.
texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and lives with her two children and her husband in her mother-in-law's house. Mary has had a business offering internet access for 3 years. She began with only 4 computers and today has more than 10. She offers this service to her neighbors, mainly to the students who use the internet for their assignments. For this reason her highest earnings come during the school year. During the breaks demand is normally down, which is not too harmful since she still makes back what she has invested. Mary has plans to improve her business and has been increasing her savings to have her computers at the cutting edge of technology. This is the second time Mary has asked for a loan through MFP, and she has a strong desire to continue improving for the well-being of her communal bank. The requested money will be invested in computer maintenance and repair, and will provide for the replacement of others that are no longer able to be fixed.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and repair

loans.name: Jafelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26 year old Jafelina K. from Mwanza. She is single. Jafelina has been running a shop  since 2007. Our client’s business is to sell women’s cosmetics. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. 
Jafalina currently earns about 340USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more cosmetics to resell them. 
In the future, she plans to expand her business. 
Jafelina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and resell them

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La socia MARGOTH; nació hace 32 años en la provincia de Urubamba, exactamente en ayllupampa, ubicado a 10 minutos de la provincia.

Ella tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos (12 y 4), años, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante, el cual ella misma lo administra, ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de productos propios del restaurante e implementar un poco más su pequeño negocio. 

Nuestra socia esta muy feliz con el préstamo que le otorgaran mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member, MARGOTH, was born 32 years ago in the province of Urubamba, in Ayllupampa to be exact, located 10 minutes from the province.

She is 32 years old, married, with 2 children, 12 and 4 of age. Our member has a small restaurant, which she administers herself. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying products for the restaurant and implement her small business.

Our member is very happy with the loan she will receive through these means and she is commited to repay the total amount of the loan within the deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for a restaurant.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
K. Mahmud is 24-years old. He is married with two kids. Over the years he has tried various types of activities. Finally, two years ago, he started his business selling cell phones. Mahmud finds this business to be profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. However, Mahmud thinks that it is overly expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it would cut expenses considerably if the goods were purchased in China. With this in mind, Mahmud requests a loan of $800 US with a term of nine months. This is his first loan and Mahmud is grateful to all for supporting him. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and prominent at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cell phones from China for retail

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is a trader. She runs a provisions store on one of the main streets in her community. She also sells vegetables on a small tabletop in front of her store. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Janet is 35-years old and married with two daughters. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates palm nuts. Both of her children are in primary school. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school demands.

Janet has been in business for 15 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Mukhtaran Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran baji is the leader of this group with four other female members.  All of these women run their own businesses and use the earnings to pay off their home utility bills.  Mukhtaran baji plans to use the loan to buy another buffalo for her milk sales business. Nasreen baji will buy scrap for her scrap business and Bashiran baji will buy shoes to resell.  Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy mason tools and Hina baji will buy some creams, cosmetics, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

As a group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually agree to guarantee the entire loan, that is, if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Ahmadkul

texts.en:
G. Ahmadkul, 46, is married and has five children. He lives in Tursunzade and works in the agricultural industry. Six years ago he started to cultivate land that he owned to generate more income to support his family.

Ahmadkul grows wheat, corn and vegetables. He will use the loan to improve his yield. Ahmadkul enjoys his job and he will continue to use loans to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

--------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina K. is married and has four dependents. She has no formal education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Angelina sells Silva plates, groceries, fabrics and buckets at Zion in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2000. Angelina uses her income to pay for school fees for the children, clothing, utility bills and other family expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more Silva plates, fabrics and buckets for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to put up for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more Silva plates, fabrics and buckets to sell

loans.name: Matda

texts.en:
Wanting to save for the education of her children, Matda manages a general store business at Rang-Ay, San Agustin, Isabela.  She wants to request a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva for her to have additional capital. With that, she will be able to produce more products for her store, which may result in a higher income.

She is blessed with three children: Zynah Mary, who is 8 years old and currently enrolled in elementary school; Lyzah Mae, who is 3 years old; and John Lloyd, who is 6 months old. Matda is very grateful for having a happy and loving family.

loans.use: Business capital to produce more products.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria vive con su esposo e hijos en anticretico en la calle Atahuallpa de la zona de San Sebastian de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como enfermera en el hospital, con estos ingresos ella mantiene a su familia; el crédito que solicita es para un chequeo de su salud, ya que el seguro en nuestro País es muy deficiente y es necesario ser atendido en clínicas particulares

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria lives with her husband and children in a rental property on Atahuallpa Street in the San Sebastian area of the city of La Paz. She works as a nurse at a hospital and is able to support her family with her earnings.

She is requesting a loan to pay for a health checkup because the national insurance is not adequate and she wants to be seen at a private clinic.

Sra. Ana Maria was a previous IMPRO client with a good payment history, so she is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a health checkup

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es: Rosa Gladys R. L. de 35 años de edad  vive en el departamento de La Paz con su tres hijos Fabricio de 11 años, José de 8 años y María de 4 años de edad. Rosa posee una gran experiencia en las ventas ya que ha mantenido su negocio a flote por quince año,  los cuales le han permitido ganar experiencia y ser reconocida en la zona, Rosa ha surtido su pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal de Zacatecoluca  con la venta de verduras como tomates, chile, zanahorias, entre otros. Rosa solicita un crédito en esta oportunidad ya que desea aumentar su inventario, y solo la ayuda de tu préstamo Gladys podría generar mayores ingresos que son de gran apoyo para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Gladys R. L. is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the department of La Paz with her three children—Fabricio, age 11, José, age 8, and María, age 4. Rosa has vast experience in sales because she has kept her business afloat for 15 years, during which time she has gained recognition in the area. Rosa sells vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, carrots, and others in her small stand at the Zacatecoluca Municipal Market. At this time, she is requesting a loan because she wishes to increase inventory. Only with the help of your loan will she be able to generate bigger profits that will support her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive con sus cinco hijos en el sector Atusparias, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años tiene un pequeño puesto en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de   Chiclayo (el principal mercado de la ciudad) en donde vende ropa interior, ella compra su mercancía en las tiendas de la ciudad que ofrecen estos productos al por mayor y los vende todos los dias durante las mañanas y las tardes e incluso por las noches.

Este negocio le ha servido para sustentar a su familia durante este tiempo, actuamente, gracias al esfuerzo con el que trabaja, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando carrerás técnicas, mientras que los últimos siguen estudiando en un colegio secundario de la zona; ella da lo mejor de sí para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que es consciente de que su futuro depende de la educación que les pueda brindar.

Dora está solicitando a nuestra Institución un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercancía para mantener su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.

Su más grande sueño es lograr obtener un puesto en los interiores del mercado en el que pueda seguir ofreciendo sus productos, ya que el actual no le ofrece la seguridad necesaria para trabajar tranquilamente.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente, demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad  en sus pagos, por lo que es considerada una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Dora is a 41 year old single mother, who lives with her five children in the Atusparias sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz district 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 15 years she has had a small place on the exterior of the Model Market of Chiclayo (the main city market) where she sells under garments. She buys her goods in the city shops that offer these products to her wholesale and sells them every day during the mornings, afternoons, and even at night. This business has served to support her family during this time. Thanks to her work effort, her first three children are studying technical careers, while the youngest continues studying at a secondary school. She gives the best to mover her children forward as she is aware that their future depends on the education she can provide them. Dora is requesting a 2000 nuevos soles loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of more goods to keep her business and continue to support her children. Her biggest dream is to obtain a place in the interior of the market so that she can continue offering her products because the current place does not offer her the security she needs to work peacefully. She has already worked with us previously, showing responsibility and timeliness in her payments, so is considered a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods to maintain her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Lord of Cachuy village bank. 
Rosa is a single mother that has two children who are 19 and 9. Her oldest child studies in an institute and the youngest goes to public school. 
Rosa worked as a secretary for a business for 15 years. She quit because she wanted to be bear her children and she wanted to be independent. She bought cabinets and a showcase to start a convenience store in her house. With FINCA Peru, Rosa has learned to save, invest, and the loans have been of great help because she is both mother and father to her children. 
Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy groceries, rice, sugar, and beer. Her dream is to grow her business and be a wholesaler.

loans.use: buy groceries, rice, sugar, and beer

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song S., 41, is a farm worker who lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She has been farming since 1989 to earn a living and is able to make US $2 every day, while her husband is a construction worker building houses. He typically makes US $3 per day. This couple has three children living at home to support.

Song has an idea to earn more profit to help raise her standard of living. She would like to take out a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a stock of rice. She needs to take off the husk, with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon S. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in  Phnom Penh. Since 2006, she has been selling sugar cane juice to earn a living and is able to make about US$5 in revenue each day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver who is able to make US$3.50 per day. Chuon S. is asking for a loan of US$1000  to invest in a new business. She will purchase phones  and provide service to those who need to make phone calls.

loans.use: Service phone calls.

loans.name: Noel Adali

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua el señor Noel F. ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción los que serán invertidos en su vivienda porque ha estado en lamas condiciones y es de mucha importancia que el señor Noel la mejore para así brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

Con la confianza en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente, él espera confiadamente en que al recibir dicho crédito comprará a lo inmediato los materiales y así iniciará la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ofreciendo mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Noel has turned to the organization Ceprodel for the purpose of requesting a loan to buy construction materials that will be invested in his home because it has been in bad condition. It is of great importance that Noel improves his house so that he can offer better living conditions to his family.

With confidence that this loan will be granted, he confidently expects to receive the credit and will immediately buy the construction materials and start the reconstruction of his home, in this way offering better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina F. is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Penina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Penina has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Penina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Penina is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Penina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S., 46, is married with three school-aged children. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with his wife and children.

S. and his wife are engaged in growing morning glories (a kind of vegetable), earning an income of approximately US$13 each per day. This income helps cover the family expenses, especially the children's future education.

S. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase morning glory seeds and wooden poles to grow more morning glories to meet his customers’ demands.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds and wooden poles

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena P. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has four adult children. Elena owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mohamad has been working in construction for two years now. Mohamad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a van which will allow him to commute everyday to work and carry his tools. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. 
Mohamad is talented in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mohamad decided to work in this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a van for his work.

loans.name: Marlene Antonia

texts.es: Marlene Antonia tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue una necesidad primordial ya que tenía que alimentar a sus 2 hijos, por lo que no tenia ingresos suficientes para salir adelante. Por lo que decide iniciar a este negocio, porque fue por la ayuda de una amiga que le ayudo con este negocio, ya que en su comarca se volvió muy popular con este negocio. Ella solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos.  Su deseo es proporcionarles estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlene Antonia is 48 years old and is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She makes a living buying and selling pigs and has been dedicated to this business for more than five years. She started because it was an absolute necessity to feed her two children and she didn't have sufficient funds to make headway. So she decided to start this work and did it with the help of a friend because this kind of business has become very popular in her region. Marlene is requesting working capital to purchase pigs, and her wish is to provide for her children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: A. Angèle est née en 1981 à Abomey-Calavi au Bénin. Mariée à KAKPO Appolinaire, un agent de sécurité, Angèle est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Angèle vit depuis 7 ans environs, avec sa famille au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Angèle n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Angèle mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (riz, huile végétale, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Angèle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Angèle a déjà 8 ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé. Elle a envie de diversifier ses activités.  C'est pour ca, qu'elle demande un autre crédit d'Alidé.
texts.en:
Angèle A. was born in 1981 in Abomey-Calavi, in Bénin. Married to Appolinaire Kakpo, a safety officer, Angèle is the mother of two children who attend school. Angèle has lived for about 7 years with her family in the district of Zogbo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Together, the couple takes care of the family. Angèle did not attend school. To fulfill her different responsibilities, Angèle sells various products (rice, vegetable oil, pasta, etc.) from her home and door to door. Angèle gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Angèle already has 8 years of experience with this type of work and has already benefited from two loans through ALIDé. She would like to diversify her work. This is why she is requesting another loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, rice, pasta

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. is from the village of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has 11 adult and school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns a fishing boat which is operated by her husband. Emily has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

This year, Emily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing boat. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing boat

loans.name: Gloria  Noemi

texts.es:
La Sra Gloria Noemí C. de C. tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 11 años, no tiene hijos.
Desde hace 4 años atrás empezó junto a su marido el negocio de la venta de carnes en un Supermercado, poco a poco fue creciendo, ya que el mismo tiene cliente recurrentes.
Con el crédito obtenido de la fundación compro una congeladora, para la conservar los embutidos para la ventas ya que uno de sus congeladoras tuvo un desperfecto y solo con la compra de uno nuevo podría seguir conservando dichas mercaderías.
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Noemí C. de C. is 31 and has been married for 11 years. She doesn’t have any children. 4 years ago she started a business along with her husband of selling meat in a supermarket. Little by little the business grew because of returning customers. With the loan that she obtained from the foundation she bought a freezer to keep the cold meats for sale. One of her freezers had a flaw and only when she bought a new one could she keep selling this merchandise. She thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the support offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 27 years old and is married to Mr.N.. They have four children who go to a nearby school. She makes bricks, with the help of her husband, and also practices small scale farming.

She was introduced to Kadet by a friend who is also a member of Kadet. She has applied for her first loan with Kadet which she intends to use to buy more materials for making bricks as there is a high demand for bricks in her area. She will also buy seeds to plant in her farm.

Her future plans are to supply bricks to new markets away from her local area. She will, therefore, increase her income and be able to educate all her children and build a bigger house.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making bricks and seeds for planting

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
Mariatu B. (on the right in the photo) is the leader of this group. She is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, with her husband and three children. Fatu has been selling fish, pepper, onions, magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste, like boullion cubes), tomatoes, etc. for many years now.  

She has requested a loan of SLL 500,000 from SMT, a Kiva field partner, to expand her business by buying fish, pepper, onions, magi and tomatoes in wholesale quantities to add to her current ones. This is the first loan that members of the "Wan Word" group have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy fish, pepper, onions, magi and tomatoes in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Thinh's Group

texts.en:
Thinh T. T. is 45 years old. She lives in Co Duong village. She has two children who are going to school. She and her husband are farmers who grow vegetables and breed pigs. They have a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. With such a low income, they find it very difficult to raise their children. Mrs Thinh has participated in SEDA's microfinancing program since 2007 and has repaid punctually. She is very happy because she can save money each week. She is the group leader of a 6-member SEDA group loan. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy 50 chickens. Hopefully, this plan will turn a profit so that her family may afford to buy more household appliances.

About the other borrowers in her group: Lien T. T. is 40 years old. She sells chickens in the market. She wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to expand her business. Dong T. T. T. is 32 years old. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop. Trong T. T. is 46 years old. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to breed chickens. Bac T. T. is 55 years old. She wants to borrow 2,398,000 VND to breed pigs. Tham T. T. is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años trabaja en su tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en su casa. Labora todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo, paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la atención en su panadería, que es propia. Y su  esposo es el encargado de elaborar los panes para repartirlos durante  las mañanas  a todas las tiendas pequeñas de su localidad. Estos negocios le ha permitido tener una economía  sólida, en pleno progreso, por las buenas  rentas económicas que le generan. Para el futuro desea instalar una tienda mas abarrotada de productos de primera necesidad, y ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.Es la octava oportunidad que  Gladys tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas; además agradece  a las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su  tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old and lives with her husband and six children in her own home. She’s been running a small grocery store out of her home for the past five years and works every day with the help of her husband and children. She also has a small bakery and her husband is in charge of baking the different types of bread and delivering it every morning to all the small stores in her neighborhood. These businesses have allowed them to generate income and establish a solid economic base. In the future she would like to open a larger store that also sells primary need items in order to better serve her customers. This will be Gladys’ eighth loan through MFP and she promises to be responsible with her payments. She is grateful to those who made this loan possible. It will be very useful for her business. She will use the money to buy larger quantities of products in order to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es: Edilberta tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 4 y 5 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en la selva tropical cuzqueña, ubicada en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. A los 20 años, sabía las técnicas de cultivo y el cuidado respectivo de sus plantaciones de cacao, sin embargo pasaron momentos difíciles ella y su familia, al no encontrar compradores en su comunidad, debido a los constantes derrumbes por su zona, por tal motivo se echó a perder toda la inversión. Durante los 2 años siguientes se dedicó a pagar las deudas con sus proveedores y trabajadores, con el tiempo se recuperó y volvió a trabajar en la agricultura, pero esta vez implantando el café. Desde ese momento sus ventas aumentaron, más que otros años y ya tiene compromisos por adelantado por parte de sus clientes, de esa manera se exige al máximo en el trabajo para que pueda cumplir de manera eficiente. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en tiempo de cosecha necesita de operarios para que agilicen la extracción de sus productos. Normalmente sus productos agrícolas lo vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad y sus planes a futuro es comprar terrenos de cultivos para producir frutas cítricas, con el propósito de ampliar su mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está seguro que con su grupo comunal llegara muy lejos, ya que le trae muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita le dará un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café respectivamente, para ello comprará insumos y abono de primera calidad.
texts.en:
44-year old Edilberta is married and has two small children aged 4 and 5. They live in their own wooden house located in the tropical rainforest in the community of Sirenachayocc in the Cusco area. At the age of 20, Edilberta was already a skilled farmer and knew how to care for her cocoa plantations. Nevertheless, there were difficult times for her and her family as there were no buyers in her community because of the constant landslides in the area. As a result she lost her investment. The following two years were spent paying back the money she owed to suppliers and workers. Over time she got her life back on track and returned to farming, but this time she planted coffee. From this moment on, her sales increased, more than in other years, and she already has future orders from her customers. As a result much is demanded of her if she is to fill the orders efficiently. Generally she and her husband do the work, but at harvest time she needs extra hands to speed things up. Normally her products are sold to warehouses in her community. In the future Edilberta plans to buy more land on which to grow citrus fruits and broaden her product base. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to make the repayments. She is also confident that she will get far with her communal group because it offers many benefits. With the loan she will buy quality supplies and fertilizer so she can provide appropriate care for her fields of cocoa and coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer for her cocoa and coffee fields

loans.name: Yulita's Group

texts.en:
Yulita E. is from the village of Sibutad. She is 56 years old. Yulita is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Yulita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Yulita grows and sells rice. Yulita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Yulita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yulita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14500 PHP from PMPC. Yulita is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This will be Yulita's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz A., from the village of Nilabo, Rizal, is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 16 years, she earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Beatriz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: United Brothers And Sisters. Group

texts.en:
Patrick K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Brothers and Sisters.

He is 33 years old, married and has one child who is nine years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 14 years, he has been selling ladies' blouses, slippers and dresses in Joe Bar Market, Old road, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more ladies' blouses, slippers and dresses.

He describes himself as hard working. His goal is to improve his business, build a house and continue to educate his child.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loans.name: G. S Maria Elena Cuadra Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Maria Elena Cuadra está integrado por 3 personas que se conocen desde hace muchos años atrás, Las señoras son personas que tienen sus propios negocios, cada una tiene amplia experiencia en la administración de su negocio, a continuación se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan. Ana Fabiola se dedica a la venta de piñatas y adornos, ella inicio por una amiga que le enseño y más tarde ella decide establecer su propio negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, con las ganancias que obtiene mantiene a su familia y para comprar utilidades necesarias motivo por el cual está solicitando el crédito. La Señora Reyna se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en la administración del mismo. Ella tiene 2 hijos junto a su esposo los cuales tres dependen del matrimonio a los cuales les brindan todos los gastos de alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación. Y la última integrante del grupo es Yadira Del Carmen que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que juntas se han unido para realizar financiamientos y comprar lo necesario para su negocio.
texts.en:
The group named Solidario Maria Elena Cuadra is made up of 3 women who have known each other for many years. The women each have their own business, and each one has extensive experience managing her business. Following below is more detailed information on the different work that each of them do. Ana Fabiola makes her living selling piñatas (decorative containers hung up during festivities and hit with a stick to release candy from inside) and decorations. She was introduced to the work by a friend, who taught it to her, and later she decided to establish her own business in the house where she is living. With the profits that she earns she supports her family and purchases the necessary tools for her business, which is the reason she is requesting the loan. Señora Reyna makes her living selling general merchandise. She has over 5 years experience managing her business. She has 2 dependent children and a husband. They provide their children with food, clothing, health care and education. And the last member of the group is Yadira Del Carmen, who also makes her living selling general merchandise. These women have come together to obtain financing and purchase the necessary goods for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A., from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela, is 57 years old and single. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, she is now requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used for the same purposes. This will be Fe's sixth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Nuris Mercedes

texts.es:
Nuris Mercedes, en su actividad como estilista de belleza, ha logrado ampliar su oferta de servicios, asesorando a sus clientes y  comercializando productos de belleza y de peluquería que realzan la imagen y belleza femenina masculina e infantil. Ella es una mujer que vive  en Malambo con su cónyuge y sus  tres hijos de 20 a 25 años.
Desde hace 25 años cuando vivió en Santa Marta, aprendió todo lo relacionado con la belleza femenina y  por eso cuando se traslado a Barranquilla,  pensó inmediatamente, en crear una alternativa de ingresos, haciendo lo que a ella mas le gusta ;  así fue como hace 15 años inicio su negocio de realzar la imagen de belleza, comenzando con clientela de Soledad, Barranquilla y Malambo,  ofreciendo como productos a domicilio , el corte de cabello, tinturado, alicer y peinados, gradualmente sus clientes,  le pedían asesoría respecto a los productos que deberian usar para conservar el cabello hermoso,  tal como Nuris se los dejaba, y fue entonces que se le ocurrió la idea de venderle a su clientela,  productos de belleza logrando ingresos adicionales importantes y también ofreciendo el servicio de aplicación de los mismos. Gracias a sus esfuerzos en el negocio  y el de su esposo, hombre también muy trabajador,  han logrado educar a nivel profesional a sus hijos y ahora están bien empleados.
Este es el tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva comprará productos de belleza como shampoo, desrisados, aliser, masajes y protectores de brillo; con las anteriores  financiaciones ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos, mejorar su vivienda  y sobre todo  incrementar sus oferta de servicios. Su sueño se enfoca en  el reacondicionamiento del local y mejoramiento de su vivienda;  su mayor desafío actualmente es la lluvia, porque le dificulta  el servicio a domicilio, porque  con los fuertes aguaceros que están ocurriendo diariamente, los arroyos se crecen,  paralizando toda la ciudad porque resulta peligroso salir de casa a responder a los clientes.
texts.en:
Nuris Mercedes is a beautician. She has increased the services she is able to offer, including assessing clients and selling beauty products and providing hair cuts to compliment the appearance of women, men and children. She is a woman that lives in Malambo with her three children aged 20 and 25 years old. When she was 25 years old and still living in Santa Maria she learned to provide beauty services to women, so when she moved to Barranquilla she immediately thought about setting a business to generate an income, a business doing something she enjoys. Fifteen years ago she set up her business selling beauty products, door to door, giving hair cuts, dying hair, hair styling for events et. Gradually her clients sought out her advice on the products they should be using to have healthy hair, keeping it the same way as when they left Nuris' shop. She started selling to her clientele beauty products, engaging another source of income. She continued to offer her beauty services. Thanks to the efforts she invested in her business and her husband's efforts, a very hard working person too, she has granted her children to have higher education. They are all enjoying careers now. This is the third loan accessed through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase beauty products such as shampoo, streaks, massage oils, conditioners etc. With previous loans invested she has seen improvement in her profits, and she has improved the quality of their house. She has also increased the services she is able to offer. Her dream is to remodel her beauty shop and carry out some home improvements. Her greatest challenge now is facing rainy days because it becomes difficult for her to provide her services at their clients' homes. The rains come in terrible storms that come almost daily. The rivers swell and the entire city is paralyzed because it is dangerous to go out of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shampoos, conditioners, massage oils etc.

loans.name: Flura

texts.en: Flura P. is currently in the business of selling beer, fish and flat bread ("mandasi") at Logobero and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Flura is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is employed as unspecified staff. She has two children but her children do not go to school yet.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a business selling clothes.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Winnie Namusa is 18 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Winnie has a fish selling business, which she has had for less than a year. To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase another retail shop. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own two businesses. Winnie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself.

loans.use: To purchase another retail shop.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis Gonzalo M. M. tiene 25 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Luis pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.
.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Gonzalo M. M. is 25 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. They live in the Guaranda subdivision in the Bolivar province. He has 3 children.

Luis belongs to the solidarity group Guantucoto which is located half an hour from Guaranda. The solidarity group is dedicated to agriculture and livestock especially growing corn and potatoes in the highland area and rice in the coastal area. The group has 25 members. 

Luis has been farming for several years growing corn and potatoes. He also raises livestock and cattle and then sells it. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and also makes his sales at the wholesame market in that same city. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies to plant corn and potatoes. This loan will help him financially to meet his family's needs. He faces challenges such as pests and crop diseases. His dream is to buy car and a home.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to grow corn and potatoes.

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
María Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia D. Azángaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad, D. estado civil  casada y tiene 05 hijos (04 dependientes), la señora no estudió en ningún centro D. educación.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 18 meses, nos cuenta que su  préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. venta D. animales menores especialmente ovejas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá  para comprar ovejas.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
María Natividad is a member of the community bank "Punta Sahaucasi", located in the Azángaro district in the Azángaro province in the department of Puno.  She is 55 yeas old, married, and has five children (four dependent on her).  She has never been to school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 18 months.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her business that sells animals, especially sheep.

She is asking for a new loan for 500 nuevos soles which she will use to purchase sheep. 

Her dream for the future is to improve her business.  The thing she likes best about her community bank is the training.

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Marsel

texts.es: Marsel tiene 34 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Marsel, con su bolso bajo el hombro, recorre las calles de su distrito, vendiendo sus prendas para niños, señoritas y personas adultas; cumpliendo con los pedidos que le hacen. Es así que sube y baja los cerros empinados de su distrito, ya que en ese lugar viven la mayoría de sus clientes, dejándoles a precios un poco más elevados, siendo vendidos a crédito la mercadería que lleva, y cuando transcurre un tiempo, realiza las cobranzas, aprovechar para ofrecer otras nuevas prendas. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y menciona que el es muy rentable, ya que le gusta ser muy cumplida en la entrega de sus pedidos, de esa manera no pierde la confianza que depositaron sus clientes en ella. Por lo pronto continuará con la construcción de su casa para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su 2do crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, para contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más prendas de vestir y así incrementará su stock de ropa para la temporada de verano.
texts.en: Marsel is 34 years old and a hard working wife and mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 2 children. Marsel, with her bag on her shoulder, travels the streets of her districts selling clothing for children, young women and adults. She fills orders that people make with her.  Thus she goes up and down the steep hills of her district, since that is where most of her customers live.  She charges them a little more because she sells the merchandise to them on credit. After time, she makes her collections and offers them more articles of clothing.  He has had this business for 3 years and she reports that it is very profitable, since she likes to be very punctual when delivering orders. That way she doesn't lose the trust her customers have put in her. In the meantime, she will continue with the construction of her home to offer her family a better quality of life. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she is committed making her payments on time, to be able to count on help later. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy more articles of clothing and in this way increase her clothing stock for the summer season.

loans.use: To acquire more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Kasenge Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
N. Justine, 46, has been a businesswoman for the last 10 years in Mbalala-Mukono. Over the course of these years, she has been managing her grocery store business. This has, to a certain degree, been a satisfactory means of subsistence for her and her family. The happily married mother of 6 says self-interest and efficiency are what spawned her business. 

Before she embarked on this business journey, she was mostly involved in a modest old clothes sales business. The business is still in existence though it is second fiddle as of now. The grocery store business has been doing well, judging by the 600,000 shilling profits she makes monthly. With this loan, Justine says she is going to revamp her grocery business and also buy more bales of old clothes for resale. 

Justine belongs to Kasenge Women's group-Mukono.

loans.use: revamping her grocery store and purchasing more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Baba

texts.ru:
Baba B. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 1 rebonka. Baba jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. Semya u Babi bila bednoy i poetomu on s malix let nachal rabotat. 
Baba uje 9 let rabotayet taxistom, Ranshe on rabotal prodavcom v magazine. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyye mashini.
texts.en:
Baba B. is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. Baba lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and child. Baba's family was poor and this is why he started working since a very young age.

Baba has been working as a taxi driver for nine years. Before that he was working as a sales person in a store. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Mian Channu, a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in an area called Kothi Nan Singh in a single-room brick house for over 12 years. Perveen is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household tasks. She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  

Her husband's name is M. F. A. and he is involved in a construction supply sales business. He operates a shop in the market where he sells construction supplies such as sand, bricks, cement etc. to his customers and earns income for the family. He has been in this business for over 8 years and manages to have a good number of clients. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase construction supplies in bulk quantities to fill larger orders on time and to earn good income. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will bring more profit for her husband’s business and she will be able to provide better educational and living facilities to her children. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
