loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies sales business

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: El señor Juan Pedro P. D. se dedica a manejar su propio automovil lo cual lo adquirio hace cinco meses, gracias a su tabajo y esfuerzo . El solicitante es soltero no tiene carga familiar por tal mótivo ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares. está solicitando el crédito para  mantenimiento de su auto y gastos personales , se propone otorgarle el crédito por que en la evalución se enocntró con buena experiencia acrediticia y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Juan Pedro P. D. works managing his own vehicle which he acquired five months ago through hard work and commitment. He is single and doesn't have any family members in his care but helps his parents with their family expenses.  He is requesting a loan to have maintenance work done on his car and to cover some personal expenses.  He is being granted a loan because the assessment carried out showed him to have a good credit history and good personal references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young ambitious man from Nablus. He runs a school cafeteria in one of Nablus's schools. Mahmoud has been saving and looking for opportunities to start a bigger business. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a large amount of goods that are sold in grocery shops to start supplying small shops.

Mahmoud appears in the picture here in FATEN's office in Nablus.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of goods to sell to small shops

loans.name: Hosanna Jabneel

texts.es: La Sra. Hosanna y su esposo, radican en una colonia muy retirada de la ciudad , como los dos trabajan  dejan sola la casa donde habitan y aunque confían en los vecinos  no descartan la idea de que los ladrones puedan atacar su hogar en cualquier momento, es por eso que ellos han decidido construir una barda al frente del domicilio para mayor  seguridad y así tener confianza al momento en que ellos se retiran a su trabajo además de  que pronto recibirán la llegada  de  su  bebe para  el  cual  quieren  la  mayor  protección y seguridad,  para que  en un futuro  el  pueda  salir  a jugar  al patio sin ningún problema es por ello que este  crédito representa su segundo refinanciamiento y están muy contentos con esta institución ya que se sienten apoyados para poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Señora Hosanna and her husband live in a suburb far from the city.  They both work from home and even though they trust their neighbors, they don't dismiss the idea that thieves could break into their home at any time.  For this reason they have decided to build a fence in front of their house so that  they can feel safer when they are working.  They are also expecting a baby soon and they want to protect and keep their child safe and, in the future, be able to play on the patio without any problems.  

This is their second loan and they are very happy with the institution and the support that they provide to help them carry out their projects.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina es productora lechera y también elabora quesos; su esposo es profesor en el área rural, el crédito lo requiere para comprar un terreno para forraje de sus vacas lecheras. Las actividades mencionadas son las fuentes de ingresos de su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Martina is a milk producer and also makes cheeses.  Her husband is a teacher in a rural area.  The loan is needed to buy land where the dairy cows can forage.  The activities mentioned are the income sources for her family.  They own their own home which is located in Achacachi in the department of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is her first time working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy land for dairy cows to pasture

loans.name: Zafiross Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ ZAFIROSS”,  ubicado en el estado de México. Está integrado por 10 personas, en este grupo se encuentra la señora ANABEL R. A. de 42 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 15 Y 18 años, ella comenta que estudió hasta la secundaria y  hace aproximadamente 7 años decidió poner su negocio de PAPELERÍA que inició en la casa de sus padres, este negocio le ayuda a apoyar el gasto familiar. Sus planes a futuro son abrir un negocio de CIBER CAFÉ y terminar la construcción de su casa.  Desea el préstamo para invertir en mercancía para el negocio y así poder contribuir en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos, así como brindarles educación y una carrera profesional a sus hijos para que logren sus sueños.
texts.en: The ZAFIROSS community bank is located in the state of Mexico.  The bank's 10 members include ANABEL R. A..  Anabel, 42, has 3 children who are 14-, 15- and 18-years old, respectively.  She tells us that she studied up to high school level.  She decided to set up a PAPELERIA--a paper supply store--in her parent's house, 7 years ago, to help with family expenses.  Her future projects include setting up a CIBER CAFE and finishing construction on her house.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her retail business, a business that she expects to contribute to improving her and her family's quality of life.  She wants to provide good educations for her children because she dreams of seeing them all in well-paid careers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail business

loans.name: Jeffrey A.

texts.en:
Jeffrey L. owns NuVision Properties LLC, a real estate management company.  He and his wife entered the real estate business in February 2008, during the middle of the housing crisis. With real estate affordable, they jumped at the opportunity to build long-term financial stability.  Initially, they bought and sold foreclosed houses, but subsequently they moved into apartment management because of its efficiency (more tenants in one location) and financial stability.  They currently own one apartment building, and their goal for 2011 is to acquire two additional apartment buildings, each with a capacity of twenty-four or more units.  If they succeed, Jeffrey’s wife will begin managing the properties full-time at the beginning of 2012. 

 Jeffrey and his wife balance expanding NuVision Properties with their full-time careers.  Jeffrey works with a software engineering company, and his wife is a director for an outpatient medical center.  Jeffrey says that he and his wife manage their workload by working long hours and “burning the midnight oil.” He handles the finances and looks for prospective deals, and his wife manages the apartment building. 

With this loan, Jeffrey and his wife are implementing a mail-out marketing campaign that will promote their business to real estate agencies, as well as to prospective apartment complex owners looking to sell.  This campaign will focus on New Orleans, Baton Rouge, and select markets around Louisiana and adjoining states.  This loan also helps them build their business credit, which will help them receive financing for later acquisitions.

loans.use: to pay for marketing campaign.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. verduras, vive con sus hijos D. 30 y 25 años D. edad, hace 9 años tiene el negocio D. verduras y trabaja todos los días D. la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. verduras: papas, yuca, pipián, ejotes, plátanos, esta compra  le servirá para aumentar el inventario D. su negocio, disponer D. variedad para ofrecer a los clientes productos frescos.
Su aspiración es aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos, para estabilizar la condición económica D. su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen resides in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. She sells vegetables for a living and lives with her children ages 30 and 25. She has been running this vegetable business for 9 years, working every day of the week.

She is currently requesting this loan in order to purchase produce such as potatoes, cassava, squash, green beans, and plantains. This purchase will help her to increase her inventory and offer a greater variety of fresh produce to her customers.

Her aspiration is to boost sales and profits so that her family can have a stable financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, cassava, squash, green beans, and plantains.

loans.name: Las Piñitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia tiene 28 años D. edad ella es originaria D. la localidad llamada Lindero, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 13 años y dice que la puso para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos del hogar ya que son muy grandes D. edad y para que no trabajen ella les ayuda por que su mama es un gran apoyo para ella ya que Cecilia es madre soltera y sus mama le ayuda a cuidar a su hija D. 7 años D. edad la cual estudia el segundo año D. primaria. Ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra D. artículos para surtir su negocio como jabón, azúcar, aceite, fríjol, sardinas, chiles, atún etc. ella surte sus productos en la población D. Zitacuaro en diferentes tiendas para que al venderlos ella le queD. algo D. ganancia. Ella esta muy agradecida por el préstamo ya que su tienda la tendrá muy bien surtida, la meta que tiene para el negocio es tener muy bien surtido para que la gente no se traslaD. a otras localidades a comprar y que le compren a ella los artículos D. primera necesidad.
Los otros tres integrantes del grupo son Ma Ignacia, Artura y Cintya ellos invertiran sus prestamos uno D. ellos en la compra D. un becerro para criarlo y ponerlo en engorda para el trabajo en el campo, y los otros dos integrantes compraran borregos para criarlos y despues venderlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Señora Cecilia, 28, is from the town called Lindero. She has had a grocery store for thirteen years and says that she started it to be able to help her mom and dad with household expenses since they are now quite old, and so they will not have to work, she helps them, since her mother is a great support to her. Cecilia is a single mother and her mom helps her care for her seven-year-old daughter who is in the second graD.. She is asking for a loan from the financial institution in order to stock her business with soap, sugar, oil, beans, sardines, chile peppers, tuna fish, etc. She acquires her products in the population center of Zitacuaro in various shops so that, upon selling them, she may keep a bit of profit. She is very grateful for the loan since she will have a very well-stocked store. Her goal for her shop is to have it very well-stocked so that people may not switch to other locations to shop and that they would buy from her their basic staples. 

The other three group members are Ma Ignacia, Arturo and Cintya. One of them will invest his/her loan in the purchase of a sheep to raise and fatten to work in the fields, and the other two members will buy sheep to raise for sale in their town.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with soap, sugar, oil, beans, sardines, chile peppers, tuna fish, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Amina has a stone quarrying business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stones for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to become a doctor.
Amina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stones for resale.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Simona tiene su propio negocio, en la venta de ropa con más de veinte cuatro años en las ventas, hoy en día comienza a invertir en la pulpería ya que durante todos estos años ha viajado a los departamentos a vender parte de su mercadería lo cual desea establecerse solo en la pulpería, pues anteriormente vendía golosinas, pero ahora le introdujo parte de su capital.
El cual ha logrado atreves de su trabajo, esfuerzo y financiamiento que Afodenic le ha dado en catorce ciclos, en donde ha venido pagando en tiempo y forma para obtener este beneficio ya que son a plazos accesible, lo cual, cubre sus gastos personales.
Simona con este nuevo préstamo comprara: tres bidones de aceite, tres quintales de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, coca cola, productos lácteos, ya que son de mucha demanda. Sus planes es lograr la clientela, para que su negocio pueda ir creciendo en productos.
texts.en:
Simona owns her own business.  For more than twenty-four years she has sold clothes.  She is currently investing in a grocery store because over all these years, she has traveled to other departments to sell part of her merchandise and she would like to concentrate her business solely in her grocery store.  In the past, she used to sell candies but she has now put some of her capital in the store.

Simona has achieved everything through her own hard work and effort and loans which she has received from Afodenic over fourteen loan cycles.  She has always repaid her loans on time and in full since the instalments are affordable.  She has been able to cover her personal expenses.

Simona will use this new loan to buy three containers of oil, three 100lb bags of rice, sugar, beans, candies, Coca Cola and dairy products since she has a lot of demand for them.  Her plans are to obtain customers so that her business can continue growing and offering more products.

loans.use: to invest in buying basic grains, dairy products and candies to improve her sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, canned goods & breads to sell.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, canned goods & breads

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: El señor Patricio es chofer y trabaja con un minibús de transporte de pasajeros junto a su esposa. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad (cambio de aceites y fluidos, chequeo del motor y la caja de cambios, chequeo de frenos y pastillas). Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado   y tiene cinco hijos. Patricio es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Sr. Patricio is a driver who works with his wife transporting passengers in a minibus. The loan he is requesting will be used for maintenance of his vehicle (oil and fluid change, engine tune-up, and a check-up of the brakes and pads). Patricio lives in his own home in the District of Villa Ingenio in the city of El Alto. He is married and has five children.

Patricio has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and his payment history is very good.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his minibus.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Flordelina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & cooked snack dishes like rice cakes. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to cook snacks to sell.

Flordelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Flordelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking snacks to sell

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, es casada, administra un molino, una venta de frutas y verduras y cultiva maíz, frijoles y hortalizas, estos negocios surgieron por iniciativa propia y de su esposo, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella, solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para sus siembras y compra de  manzanas, naranjas, plátanos y más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, esta compra le permitirá tener un mejor cultivo y ampliar el negocio.
Su mayor sueño es crecer en su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta terminar la carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
María is married, and lives with her husband and four children. She runs a mill, sells fruits and vegetables  and grows corn, beans, and vegetables. These businesses came about through her own initiative and that of her husband.  She doesn't have fixed hours for serving her customers.  

She is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her crops and to buy apples, oranges, plantains and more merchandise to offer her customers. This purchase will allow her to have a better crop and to expand her business. Her greatest dream is to grow her business so she can help her children get ahead in their studies, and eventually complete university.

loans.use: To buy crop fertilizer and to buy fruit such as apples, oranges, and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah, age 24 (shown here with her husband), is a creative and focused individual. She is a dressmaker and also earns a small additional income by keeping livestock, a venture made possible by her involvement with Faulu Kenya. She and her husband have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school.

Milkah has been making and selling dresses for the last six years. Her goal is to expand her business over the next five years and to create employment opportunities for other people. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kenya shillings so as to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ginyer Belen

texts.es:
Ginyer Belen tiene 19 años de edad vive en unión libre, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 1 año de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR 28 de Enero  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El retorno, Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Ginyer Belen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial del Cantón Puerto Pechiche y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder agrandar el negocio para obtener mayores utilidades y juntar dinero para poderse coprar una casa y vivir con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar cada día junto a su familia y dedicarse al trabajo.
texts.en:
Ginyer Belen is 19 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and one-year-old son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '28 de Enero' community bank is located in El Retorno, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture growing corn and rice.

Ginyer Belen is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in the shopping center in Puerto Pechiche and makes her sales in the same town and also in Ventanas.

Ginyer Belen is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests and illnesses.  Her dream is to be able to expand her business so that she can make more profits and put together some money to buy a house where she can live with her family.

In her spare time, Ginyer Belen enjoys spending time with her family and working.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Akhmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмаджон женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Ахмаджон по профессии является таксистам и одновременно занимается купля продажей полиэтиленовыми (одноразовыми) пакетами. Более 8 лет он самостоятельно привозит товар из других рынка городов Таджикистана, а потом продает на местном рынке.  Его супруга домохозяйка, и она присматривать за своими детьми. Ахмаджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 2600$ США для расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. Он очень надеется, что Кива и Кива кредиторы будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Akhmadjon is married and is a loving father of three children. He is a smart and purposeful man. Akhmadjon is a taxi driver and also buys and sells single use plastic bags. He has been bringing in the product himself from other town markets of Tajikistan for more than eight years and then selling it on the local market. His wife is a homemaker and she looks after the children. Akhmadjon wants to get a loan in the amount of $2,600USD to expand his business and increase the working capital. He is very hopeful that Kiva and its lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags.

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru: Изатулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 50 лет. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Изатулло зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он уже 19 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Izatullo lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 50 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Izatullo earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for 19 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Vannet

texts.en:
Vannet (in the photo) is 32 years old and her husband Yat is 39 years old. They have been married since 1994 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One is in school and other three are still young. The family lives in a village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vannet sells grocery items at home, while her husband is a construction worker. Vannet wants to generate income by investing with her mother to buy sugar cane under contract for sale. 

Hence Vannet is asking for her fist loan of $550 to help her capital.

loans.use: To invest with her mother to purchase sugar cane for sale.

loans.name: Ng'oli Associates Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ng'oli Associates Group in Western Kenya, Samwel being the facilitator of the Ng'oli Associates group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samwel takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to the firm's best services offered to farmers and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samwel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Samwel was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samwel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Samwel will invest in livestock rearing and will use the same for loan repayment. 

In 2012, the members of Ng'oli Associates group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture:  
Samwel is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and blessed with 2 young children, both of which are currently enrolled in school. For the past 3 years, Mariam has run her own general store and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is oil. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Mariam will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy oil, sugar, cereals and soap for her store. Mariam aspires to open another shop in town in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, cereals and soap for her store.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children.

Ofelia has a shop that sells candies, snacks, beverages, and breads. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more candies, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Ofelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ofelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy candies, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Cinthia Gladis

texts.es:
Cinthia vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

Cinthia, es una mujer casada de 26 años de edad,  tiene un hijo de menor edad el cual cursa el nivel inicial, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, eligio este tipo de trabajo por vocación ya que desde muy pequeña su madre lo venia realizando, y porque le sale muy rentable.
Cinthia es una  mujer empeñosa, responsable y muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a  su familia, Cinthia tiene este negocio desde el año 2008, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 350 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo  invertirá  para la compra de mercadería ( leche, azúcar, sal, etc) para que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y ofrecerles toda variedad de productos de buena calidad . El  sueño de la señora Cinthia es tener su propia casa y que su hijo llegue a ser un gran profesional para que así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, la señora Cinthia  esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cinthia lives and works in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú.  However, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. The  upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to set up their own microbusiness, like the one this client is running today.

Cinthia is a 26-year-old married woman.  She has one dependent child who is in elementary school.  Cinthia sells groceries.  This type of work was her vocation as her mother had been in the same business since she was a little girl and it is very profitable.

Cinthia is a determined, responsible and very hard-working woman who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life.  She has been in this business since 2008 and earns, on average, 350 soles a week.  She will invest this loan, which she will receive thanks to Kiva, in buying merchandise (milk, sugar, salt, etc.) so that her business can continue growing and so that she can offer her customers a variety of good-quality products.  Cinthia's dreams are to own her own home and for her son to become a great professional so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.  Cinthia is very grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  Her loan officer believes her to be a good client and believes that she will make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (milk, noodles, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: C 9297 Abiyubashye Group

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 47 years old and has six children, between 3 and 16 years old. He sells beans and tea. His store is open from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. He currently employs three people to help him. He is the leader of the group, which is called "C 9297 Abiyubashye" in the local language. 

Jean Bosco has five years of experience in this business. He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more beans and tea for sale. With this profit, he will pay his children's school fees and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and tea to sell.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a grocery business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, Cornelius wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Cinthia Katerine

texts.es:
Cinthia nació en la ciudad de Lima pero vive en la  ciudad de Ollantaytambo (La ciudad es un sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Cinthia tiene 23 años edad y es soltera, ella tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de dulces, gaseosas, agua mineral, artesanía y otras cosas más, ella tiene un puesto de venta en la calle principal donde se encuentra la estación de trenes que se dirigen a la ciudadela de Machupicchu. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

En esta oportunidad Cinthia requiere el préstamo para comprar artesanía como por ejemplo chompas de lana de alpaca, sombreros, mochilas, carteras y otras cosas más.    

Cinthia es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Cinthia was born in the city of Lima but lives in Ollantaytambo (an Inca archaeological site and capital of the district of Ollantaytambo, province of Urubamba, in the south of Perú, about 90 kms. northwest of the city of Cuzco).

Cinthia is 23, single and runs a small family business which consists of selling sweets, sodas, mineral water, crafts and other items.  She has a stand on the main street where the train station for trains to Machupicchu is located.  She has been in the business for several years now and it is going very well because of her hard work.

Cinthia is requesting a loan to buy crafts such as alpaca wool sweaters, hats, backpacks, satchels and other items.  She is a member of the communal bank "Siempre Adelante" which is comprised of 12 members who live in Ollantaytambo and have different business activities.

loans.use: To buy crafts such as alpaca wool sweaters, hats, backpacks, satchels and other items.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: A sus 40 años, la señora Dora Maria es madre de tres hijos de 22, 16 y 5 años de edad por quienes trabaja día a día con el objetivo de poder brindarles lo que necesitan, dedicándose a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad con la cual puede conseguir los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia desde hace 10 años. Con el ánimo de aumentar su inventario para tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos, la señora Dora Maria necesita de la compra de mercancía tal como jeans, camisetas y ropa de niño que le permita cumplir su objetivo y a futuro poder tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora Maria, age 40, has three children; ages 22, 16, and 5.  It is for her children that she works day to day.  Her objective is to be able to give them what they need.

She sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothes.  It is through this business activity that for the last ten years she has been able to get the income that is needed to support her family.

She intends to increase her inventory in order to have the possibility of increasing her sales and her income.  Dora Maria needs to buy merchandise like jeans, t-shirts, and children’s clothes, which will allow her to reach her objective.

In the future she would like to have her own clothing store and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Genesis 1, 2 &3 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is one of the members of the Genesis 1, 2 & 3. The members are micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothing, shoes, fruits, vegetables, crafts and bread. Some members also have businesses such as a beauty salon or a grocery store. The businesses are located mainly in the city of El Seybo, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Luisa makes her home in a simple structure with her two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children and educate them, even while she is working and taking income home. Her children are attending school while she is walking around in different communities selling her products. She enjoys being at her home. She sells miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, underwear and cosmetics. This loan, her 5th, will be used to buy more of these items to sell. 

Luisa has repaid her previous four loans satisfactorily and is taking an important step towards her business’s growth. At the beginning she thought this loan could be good for capital, and now she loves the program and likes to share with all the members. She will continue using her business profits to cover her family's expenses and to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

In this loan, we are adding three pictures, they were taken in their community. The three pictures complete the group of 15 members.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Poshey

texts.en:
Poshey is a 3-year-old single woman. She has a son who is 5 years old. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. 

Poshey operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a commercial market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Poshey will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy second-hand clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique in her home town within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to educate her children up to the graduate level with the profits she will have generated.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widowed  woman  and has been blessed with four  children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a  farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. He dreams of adding more dairy cows and expand to a motorcycle business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: A mother of three children, Mrs. Rose O. lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She owns a store, and has been in business for five years.  Rose sells provisions and food items to the public. She is looking forward to getting a loan to improve her business by purchasing more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods for expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salydia would like to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en: Mushvig is an IDP from Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 2000, and borrowed five Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $3250. He would now like to borrow another $1200 in order to increase the variety of good he can offer.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
N. Florence is married to N. Peter and is a mother of eight children. Given the heavy responsibility of her unemployed husband to provide for the basic needs of her family, she decided to sell foodstuff which was a failure due to lack of capital. She then decided to become a GHAPE member and was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline.

Now she is requesting a loan of $100 with which she plans to invest in her former business so she can raise money to pay school fees and buy food for her children. ‘’Buyam Sellam’’ business is a lucrative one as she buys from villages where the prices are lower and sells in urban areas with much profit. She plans to pay off the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, vegetables

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Being one of the first members of TYM fund in the village of Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district, Ms Lê Thị Đãng invested all the loans that she received in her metal waste recycling business and chicken farm. Her daily revenue from the waste recycling business brought in 4-5 USD. Her husband and 5 children took care of the chicken farm. When she was approaching the age of 50, the hard labor of the metal waste recycling business started to take its toll on Ms Đãng's health. So she and her husband had decided to abandon this waste recycling business and concentrate their effort on exploiting a farm. In 2000, she bought 1 acre of land for cultivation and fish farming. About 6/10 of the acre is used to grow jasmine shrubs. Jasmine flowers are very fragrant, they are used to make perfume, soft and tea. The rest of her land is made up of 3 fish ponds. She also has a flock of 100 chickens. The revenue from her farm is about 375 USD a month. She is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy 100 chickens and more jasmine shrubs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Là một trong những hội viên đầu tiên của xã Tiên Dược, huyện Sóc Sơn tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, qua 13 năm tham gia chị Lê Thị Đãng luôn vay mức vốn cao dùng vào việc chăn nuôi gà, buôn bán phế liệu. Mỗi một ngày thu mua phế liệu mang lại cho chị khoảng 4-5USD, trong khi đó ở nhà, chồng và 5 người con thay nhau giúp đỡ vợ, mẹ trông nom đàn gà. Khi gần 50 tuổi, cảm thấy sức khỏe không còn thích hợp với việc đi lại, thu mua sắt thép, chị bàn với chồng chuyển sang mô hình làm trang trại vào. Đầu năm 2000, chị thầu hơn một mẫu đất về để trồng hoa, cây ăn quả và nuôi cá. Chị có khoảng 6 sào đất trồng hoa nhài, một loại hoa có mùi thơm dùng làm nước hoa, xà phòng và để ướp trà, và 3 sào ao thả cá. Bên cạnh đó chị tiếp tục duy trì việc chăn nuôi gà. Trang trại của chị hiện nay có khoảng hơn 100 con gà thịt. Thu nhập mỗi tháng từ trang trại là 375 USD/tháng. Chị đang dự định xin vay 950 USD để tăng đàn gà của mình lên khoảng 200 con và mua thêm cây giống.

loans.use: buy chicken and tree

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a young woman of twenty-six years of age and has one child. She owns a block at the flea market in town, where she sells her products to the public, especially tourists. The competition is tough, but she has a strong heart because of the help she gets from S.P.B.D. for lending her the money to assist with her business's financial needs. Sofia makes a good profit from her sales every week, and from there she paid her loan and was able to help out with some of her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her flea market stall

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a married mother of 43 years of age with 4 children. Faavae and her family are very poor and live in a very small open Samoan fale (traditional housing unit). Her husband works for our local coconut factory, but his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Faavae chose to do something else to earn extra money. She heard of SPBD through her friends and she decided to join. With her first loan, she started her business and with her second loan she was able to improve her business and earn good money. Faavae is planning to run a canteen once she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pork bun business

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.ru:
Gulraftor J. is 34 years old, she has a high school diploma, is married and has 3 children. Gulraftor sells food at "Dekhon" market in Tursun-zoda city. Her primary goods are cookies and other sweets.

With the loan that she hopes to receive, she will purchase more goods. She buys her goods in Dushanbe. This loan will give local buyers an opportunity to buy cookies and sweets during holidays and other days without having to leave their city.

The client plans to repay the loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Джураева Гулрафтор, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Гулрафтор имеет торговую точку по торговле продуктами питания на рынке города Турсунзаде под названием «Дехкон». Основным её товаром, которым она торгует это печенье и другие сладости. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать печенье, сладости в праздники и в другие в дни, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 4 месяцев.

loans.use: приобретение продуктов питания для продажи

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of four, Massan A. is 33 years old and has been a retailer of ready-to-wear outfits for five year at the big market in Kpalimé. Given that her husband lost his job over ten months ago, she covers nearly all household expenses and the cost of schooling her children thanks to the income from her business. She wants to use these funds to buy five bails of clothing to expand her business, to meet customer demand, and to clear more of a profit for the survival of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, madame Massan A. est âgée de 33 ans et est revendeuse des tenues prêts à porter au grand marché de Kpalimé depuis 05 ans. Elle subvient presque à toutes les dépenses du foyer et les charges scolaires de ses enfants grâce aux revenus provenant de son activité étant donné que son mari a perdu son emploi depuis plus de 10 mois. Madame Massan veut, par ces fonds acheter 05 balles d’habits pour élargir la taille de son commerce, satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et dégager plus de bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy five bails of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru:
Ashur I. lives in Qurgan-Tube, Tajikistan. He is 49, married, and has three children. Ashur I. is a tractor operator, by occupation, but he also sells spare auto parts. He brings the parts from Dushanbe and sells them at the central market of his town. Ashur I. has been in business for three years. Since auto parts sales is Ashur’s primary income, he asks for a loan to expand his business. He will use the money to increase the variety and the volume of goods he sells. Ashur I. plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ишмуродов ашур житель города Курга-Тюбе. Возраст 49 лет ,женат имеет троих детей. Образование среднее , по специальности тракторист. Кроме того занимается торговлей запчастей.Завозит товар из города Душанбе и продает у себя в городе.На центральном рынке города крган-тюбе имеет торговую точку по продаже запчастей для тракторов и другой техники. Знимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года. Так как данная деятельность является основным источником дохода его семьи клиенту требуется дополнительное финансирование. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. Кроме того увеличив товарооборот , клиент увеличит ассортимент товара, а это поможет населению покупать необходимые вещи не выезжая за приделы города.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma sells perfume, cosmetics, and jewelry in offices, markets, and stores. She leaves her merchandise on credit and collects daily, weekly, biweekly and monthly in some cases. Her home is located in the Alto San Pedro area in the western part of La Paz. This is the second time that she seeks a loan from Impro, her history qualifies her as an “1 Client”, meaning she has repaid her previous loan in good standing. The loan will be used to buy perfume, cosmetics, and jewelry and will be able to stock up on merchandise for Mother’s Day as that holiday is approaching (it is May 27 here in Bolivia). Her work and experience permits her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Norma vende perfumes, cosméticos y joyas en las oficinas, mercados y tiendas. Les deja a crédito y cobra cada día, a la semana, quincenal y mensualmente en algunos casos. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro zona peri urbana Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. El crédito será destinado para la compra de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas y poder estocarse de mercadería para el día de la madre que ya se aproxima (es el 27 de Mayo aquí en Bolivia). Su trabajo y la experiencia que tiene como promotora le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy perfume, jewelry, and cosmetics in order to have more merchandise ready for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr:
Mariama Siré C., age 45, is married and has been a loyal member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara, in Vélingara, for five years. She wants to bolster her catering business by buying rice, oil, meat, and other ingredients for her restaurant. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. Mariama is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mariama Siré C., 45 ans, mariée est une fidèle membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration en achetant du riz, de l’huile, de la viande et autres ingrédients pour son restaurant . Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Mariama sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Supply of rice, oil, meat, and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Asadov

texts.en: Asadov A. is 47 years old, married, and has three sons. He earns income keeping cows for milk production and breeding sheep. Asadov has more than 20 years of experience in this field and is currently trying to further develop both of his businesses. Therefore, he has applied for a loan of US$1,200 which he will use to purchase ten sheep for US$60 each and a cow for US$600.

loans.use: Purchase of ten sheep and a cow

loans.name: Joyce Mwambene's Peacock Group

texts.en:
Joyce M., age 47, is married with three children (ages 26, 23 and 5). She has had cattle business since 1995. She has also opened a salon in 2002. She works from 7AM to 9PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $520.

Joyce hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to expand both businesses. She will share this loan with her group, Peacock, which totals 17 members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Joyce is second from right in the back row.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Vy

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Nguyễn Thị Vy 36 tuôi. Trước khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn vì nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào mấy sào ruộng. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn. Vòng vốn đầu tiện gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ chị đã đầu tư vốn vào đi chợ bán chiếu, từ khi có vốn đi chợ kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn và bớt đi khó khăn. Trong quá trình đi chợ anh chị đã nhận thấy sản xuất dây chun đang là một nghề mới và trên thị trường đang có nhu cầu. Với suy nghĩ đó gia đình chị đã Quyết định chuyển hướng kinh doanh. Sử dụng đồng vốn sẵn có của gia đình kết hợp cùng vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã mua được một chiếc máy cắt dây chun. Hiện tại công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị diễn ra rất tôt. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000/ tháng .
texts.en:
A member of TYM fund since 2006, Ms. N. Thi Vy is 36 years old. Before joining the fund, her family's financial situation was difficult because the main source of their income came totally from farming. The first loan with TYM was for 180.00 USD and she invested in her business of selling mats. Since then, the family's income has improved. In the process of shopping, she and her husband notice the production of rubber bands as a new craft, and there is a demand for them in the market. With that thought, they decided to change direction of their business. With the money they have saved combined with a loan from TYM fund, they were able to purchase a rubber band cutting machine. Presently the business is doing very well, with average daily income of 12.00 USD. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550.00 USD. Average monthly income is 360.00 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Grace Esi

texts.en: Grace Esi T. sells groceries like biscuits, milk, milo and other things at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina. Grace Esi has received senior high school education. She is a widow and has 3 children. Grace Esi has been selling groceries since 1991. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help improve the standard of living of the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es madre soltera, tiene una hija de un añito de edad, quien es su mayor inspiración de seguir surgiendo, vive con su hermana y su mamá quienes la apoyan mucho.  Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, plátanos, leche , etc) y bebidas heladas, desde hace 4 años en un pequeño local construido al costado de su vivienda, atiende todo el día, y lo que le gusta más de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente con las cuales intercambia ideas, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y tiene mucha concurrencia, lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado, con ambientes necesarios para dar una buena acogida a sus clientes. Trabaja para dar lo mejor a su pequeña hija y sobre todo para respaldar sus gastos diarios.  
Gloria quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio de abarrotes, así como también quiere mandar a construir un kiosco, donde pueda vender cómodamente su bebidas heladas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother with a one-year-old daughter who is her greatest inspiration to continue surging ahead. She lives with her sister and her mother, who support her efforts greatly. For the past four years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of groceries (rice, bananas, milk, etc.) as well as cold beverages in a small location built next to her home. She tends to her store all day, and she enjoys her work because it allows her to interact with different people with whom she exchanges ideas since her store is well-situated and experiences a good amount of traffic. What is difficult for her is not having an adequately-outfitted location, with the atmosphere necessary to give her customers a comfortable experience. She works to provide the best for her daughter and to cover her daily living expenses.

Gloria would like to expand and improve her grocery business, and she would also like to have a kiosk built where she could comfortably sell her cold beverages.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her grocery store and also build a kiosk for selling cold beverages.

loans.name: Bilquis Aziz Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is the wife of Mr. A. and resides in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great Punjabi Sufi poet, Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are auto-rickshaw drivers (the local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bilquis baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy another rickshaw for her eldest son, so that he able to increase his profits as a transit driver.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. Kaneez baji wants a loan to buy a mirror and chair for her beauty salon. Zafran baji also wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. Mukhtayar baji wants a loan to buy tools for her vehicle repair workshop. Saima baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes for her cigarette selling business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica se dedica a la comercialización de ropa mas que todo de cholita ( Blusas, enaguas, chompas y camisones)
Tiene un puesto en la zona El Rosario y su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto chijini ambos ubicados en la Ciudad de La Paz
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería para su puesto y poder ofrecer una diversidad de ropa.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Veronica sells clothing, most of all of cholita (blouses, petticoats, sweaters and nightgowns). She has a stand in the El Rosario area and her home is in High Chijini, both of which are located in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise for her stand and to offer a variety of clothes. This is the third time she has applied for credit with Impro, and the second time she has sought the support of Kiva. Based on her loan history, she is customer #1 because she completes her loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more blouses, petticoats, sweaters and nightgowns for her clothing business.

loans.name: Damaschin

texts.en: Damaschin S. lives in Opaci village in the district of Causeni. Since July 2005, he has worked under contract with “Dimitradze Djumber Bilalovici“ in Moscow, Russia, as a driver. He has not previously taken out a loan with Microinvest. Damaschin always had a dream, and his dream is to procure a BMW car, but this car is not cheap. The price of a car is $9000, and he needs a loan because he does not have enough money. He hopes that this loan from Microinvest will make his dream a reality and the car will belong to him, and hopefully his future will get better.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Zabiullah

texts.en:
Zabiullah is the son of S.. He lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has three children. He works in government and the whole family benefits from the income he generates.

However, Zabiullah's salary cannot fulfill all the needs of his family members. Therefore, he is applying for an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to start a general store. He hopes that having a small business will enable him to supply the basic needs of his family. He would like to say that, from his point of view, the loan process is the best one because it supports all the ways of life.

loans.use: To open a new shop

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es: Mencia tiene 36 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a vender comida al paso, un platillo típico de su tierra llamado “anticuchos” que son brochetas de pedazos de corazón de res y papa a la parrilla, y los vende en la puerta de su casa todos los días desde hace 2 años incluyendo los fines de semana. Su horario de trabajo es en horas de la tarde y la noche, para Mencia fue una buena opción de desarrollo que la ayudó en tiempos de necesidad económica y que actualmente la ayuda a sostener a sus hijos. Lo bueno es que siempre termina de vender todas sus porciones, que son alrededor de 50  anticuchos y por esa razón va a  adquirir nuevos implementos que la ayudarán a vender con mayor frecuencia y cantidad sus platillos. Es la primera vez que Mencia tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es nueva integrante de su banco comunal y tuvo esa voluntad de integrarse porque simpatiza con la dinámica de trabajo. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en la compra de una parrilla más moderna y nueva.
texts.en:
Mencia is 36 years old. She lives with her 4 children in a rented house. She sells a typical dish called “anticuchos” which is a grilled brocheta of potato and beef heart to people passing by. She has been selling them in the afternoons and evenings, 7 days a week, in front of her house for the last two years. This has been a good option that helped her in difficult times and still helps her to support her children. She is fortunate to sell the 50 “anticuchos” she prepares every day. Mencia would like to purchase new equipment, which would allow her to increase her hours of work and the number of dishes to sell. This is the first time for Mencia to request a loan from MFP. She is a new member of her community bank and wanted to join because she agrees with the work dynamics. The money, she is requesting, is to buy a new and more efficient grill.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new grill

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús L., de 51 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, vive junto a su hijo de 18 años, estudiante de tercer años de bachillerato y su hija de 17 años de edad la cuál estudia segundo año de bachillerato. Manuel tiene más de ocho años de poseer un despacho contable y también tiene una tienda en la cuál vende productos de primera necesidad. El de deseo de Manuel es poder obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar los productos de su negocio y así mismo comprar papelería para su despacho. Manuel desea mejorar sus ingresos a través de sus negocios ya que son estos lo que le permiten brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos como lo es la alimentación, vestuario, hogar y estudios. Manuel goza de una excelente reputación en su lugar de vivienda, ya que se esfuerza a diario por sus hijos, para brindarle un mejor estilo de vida y un mejor futuro para ellos.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús L., 51 years old, lives in Cojutepeque with his 17 year old daughter and 18 year old son who are in their second and third years of high school, respectively. For eight years Manuel has owned an accounting office and also owns a shop that sells basic necessities. Manuel wants to take out a loan with which he can buy office supplies and more products for his shop. He wants to increase the income he receives from his businesses because they allow him to provide his children everything they need such as food, clothing, housing and education. Manuel has an excellent reputation where he lives as he works daily for his children to provide them with a better quality of life and a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more material for his business

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Rhéma Plus Group

texts.fr: Miryam K. vend le maїs en détail. Son capital actuel est de $600. Elle a commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $250 qui lui avait permis d’acheter 15 sacs de manioc en 1978. De 1978 à 1991, son affaire a prospéré en augmentant le nombre de sacs à 30 totalisant un capital de $700. En 1991, elle subit une intervention chirurgicale qui ralentit ses activités qui diminua sensiblement son capital à $150. Elle reprit ses activités en 1992 en achetant 10 sacs de manioc. De 1992 à 2003, Miryam réussit à totaliser un capital de $800 avec 22 sacs dont $300 furent malheureusement volés. De 2004 à 2008, elle diversifia son affaire en ajoutant 12 sacs de maїs porta son capital à $720. Le divorce avec son mari causé par le décès de son enfant en 2005, la déséquilibra et provoqua une baisse dans son affaire. C’est ainsi qu’en août 2008, elle se décida d'integrer une des banques communautaires de l’IMF Hope dénommée « Rhema ».  Miryam a 49 ans, divorcée et mère de 7 enfants âgés de 14 à 30 ans dont quatre sont déjà indépendants. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une pharmacie et une boutique. C’est le bénéfice généré de ses activités qui nourrit et supporte sa famille. Ses activités sont localisées dans la partie nord-est de Kinshasa. Miryam et son groupe ont remboursement totalement et à temps les crédits recus en novembre dernier.
texts.en:
Miryam K. sells corn at the retail level. She currently has $600 in capital. She started her business with $250 in initial capital that had enabled her to buy 15 sacks of cassava in 1978. From then until 1991, her business prospered by increasing the number of sacks to 30, totaling $700 in capital. In 1991, she underwent surgery which slowed her down and which noticeably diminished her capital to $150. She started up again in 1992 by buying 10 sacks of cassava. From 1992 to 2003, she succeeded in totaling $800 in capital with 22 sacks, of which $300 was unfortunately stolen. From 2004 to 2008, she diversified her business by adding 12 sacks of corn, which brought her capital to $720.

The divorce from her husband, caused by the death of her son in 2005, threw her off balance and resulted in a drop in business. This is why, in 2008, she decided to join one of IMF HOPE community banks called "Rhema".

Miryam is 49 years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children, ages 14 to 30, four of whom are already independent. Her ambition is to open a pharmacy and a shop. The profits generated from her work are what feed and support her family. Her businesses are localized in the northeastern part of Kinshasa. She and her group have totally repaid on time the loans received last November.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster the stock of merchandise by buying 15 sacks of corn

loans.name: Ablavi Délali

texts.fr: Madame AMAGATSE ablavi exerce la profession de sage femme d’Etat, elle a eu son diplôme  et a commencé par exercer en 1986. Pour aider les malades n'ayant pas assez de moyens à se procurer des médicaments, elle a commencé à vendre des produits pharmaceutiques. Ne disposant pas actuellement de certains produits pharmaceutiques, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 boîtes du produit Artéméther, 50 plaquettes de Novagin injectable et d’autres produits pharmaceutiques. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle habite avec sa famille le quartier de cacavéli à Lomé
texts.en:
Ms. AMAGATSE Ablavi is a midwife by profession. She obtained her certificate and started practicing in 1986. To help the sick who lack enough money to acquire medicines, she started to sell pharmaceutical products. Currently lacking certain of these products, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 containers of Artéméther (a modern anti-malarial drug), 50 blister packs of injectable Novagin, and other pharmaceuticals. She is married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in the Cacavéli district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmceutical products

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mr. Hin K., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Aun Doem, 46, who live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. One of their children is disabled, two are garment factory workers, one son works in a brick kiln and two other children are in school.

Hin and his wife have been growing rice for four years. And after harvest season, they also grow cucumbers to supplement their business. Hin is applying for his first loan of $200 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Victoria es casada, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Victoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
El sueño de Victoria es descansar.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Ollantay community bank. She is 65, married, and has four children. She has a stand in the 12 de abril market where she sells root vegetables. She does this every day with help from her husband. Victoria also has a grocery store in her house. Victoria needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy soft drinks. Victoria’s dream is to rest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks

loans.name: Aterei F Asire Christine Group

texts.en:
A. Christine is a 28-year-old single businesswoman with three children of whom one is in school. She has owned a restaurant and sold fish for, so far, two years.

Christine is using the loan to purchase smoked fish to sell and food for her restaurant such as sweet potatoes, cassava, millet flour, beans, meat, etc. She is a hardworking businesswoman who encourages others to work. Her dream is to obtain livestock.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Obasi

texts.en: U. has a big depot where she sells drinks; she gets her supply directly from the manufacturing company. She started this business a year ago; before that she sold sarongs. U. is 46 years old, married and has five children.  She needs a loan of N120,000 to purchase more drinks. She promises to pay back the loan and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Thât (1815071320), a 45-year-old married mother of three adult-aged children, lives in the town of Đô Lương where she owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in this business for over 10 years, Mrs. Thât earns approximately 2000000 VND a month.

In 2008, she joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, Mrs. Thât is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Doña Marlene está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de un pantri), trabaja como  conserje en el INTA  desde hace 12 años, tiene una hijo de 14 años de edad la cual esta estudiando su primer año  de Educación secundaria,  a pesar que doña Marlene a cuidado de su hijo sola sin la ayuda del padre de su hijo, ella ha luchado para que no le falte nada, ella se caracteriza por ser honesta, servivicial  con el que lo necesita y muy trabajadora,  vive en un barrio de la zona urbana , su sueño es tener mucha salud para trabajar y luchar por un porvenir mejor para ver a su hijo estudiar y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Doña Marlene is requesting her 7th loan to be used for home improvements (construction of a kitchen). She has worked as a janitor at INTA for 12 years. She has a 14 year old son who in his first year of high school. Despite the fact that she has raised her child without the help of his father, Doña Marlene has not lacked anything even though she has had to struggle at times. She is characterized by her honesty, willingness to help, and hard work. She lives in an urban neighborhood. Her dream is to have good health so that she can work, fight for a better future for her child, and succeed in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kitchen

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy M. is married and has two children. She has a senior high school education. Dorothy sells second-hand clothing and also operates a unit transfer in Elmina, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a commercial driver. Dorothy uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of their home.

Dorothy will use this loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorothy plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing for resale at the market.

loans.name: Saloaloa

texts.en:
Saloaloa M., a 59-year-old woman living in the town of Tafua Tai, is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Saloaloa runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. Saloaloa has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2007, Saloaloa (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering, Saloaloa is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST. This loan will be invested in expanding the business. It will be Saloaloa's third loan from SPBD. Saloaloa plans to save the additional revenue as a reserve for future emergencies.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a general store

loans.name: Akpeedzene

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans un commerce d’un genre particulier : la vente de perles traditionnelles. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 2005 dans son quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet entres autres de subvenir à tous ses besoins. Elle sillonne plusieurs villages et localités du Togo à la recherche de ces perles traditionnelles, rares de nos jours. Elle s’approvisionne aussi au Ghana, au Mali, au Niger et au Burkina faso. Elle vend le plus souvent à des touristes européens et américains en visite au Togo ; elle a des contrats avec des jeunes démarcheurs qui amènent ces touristes à son domicile ; elle achète les perles et assure elle-même le montage. Elle a besoin d’effectuer certains achats nécessaires ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des fils et commander d’autres perles en quantité. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This woman specializes in an unusual business: the sale of traditional pearls. She began this business in 2005 in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. This business allows her, among other things, to provide for her family. She criss-crosses through many villages and areas in Togo searching for these traditional pearls, which are rare these days. She also supplies herself in Ghana, Mali, Niger, and Burkina Faso. She sells her goods most often to European and American tourists visiting Togo; she has contracts with young salesmen who bring these tourists to her house; she buys the pearls and sets them herself. She currently needs to purchase certain items; it is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy thread and to order more pearls in bulk. She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional pearls

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum T. is 28 years old and resides with his wife and four young children in the Takeo province. Since 2007, he has been performing as a musician to earn a living and is able to make about US$5 each day, while his wife makes and sells cake, making approximately US$5 per day as well. Two of the children are in school and two others are too young to attend. Chum Thom is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase musical instruments.

loans.use: Musical instruments.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza S. is from the village of Manticao , Misamis oriental. She is 31 years old. Riza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Riza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Riza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Riza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Valentin Pedro

texts.es: Don Valentín R. de 34 años de edad, vive en un barrio que se llama Pablo Úbeda, casado, con una bonita Nina de 1 año de edad, que su esposa tiene, ella trabaja como docente y se ayudan a cubrir ambos los gastos ya que la canasta esta súper elevada de costo debido a la sequía de este año. El se desempeña como guarda de seguridad desde hace seis años, gana poco pero no se encuentra trabajo es por eso que esta siempre en la seguridad, su dificultad que se le presenta es cuando roban algo y tiene que pagarlo de su salario y desajusta para los gastos de su familia. Con este préstamo quiere reparar un cuarto el zinc qué esta viejo y se le pasa el agua cuando llueve y desea que su familia este bien para que no sufran ninguna enfermedad. Para esto comprara zinc nuevo.  Sus planes a futuro es poder tener su propio negocio, de granos básicos, y venta de ropa que espera lograrlo para un futuro mejor y con el financiamiento que es una fuente de inversión el cual da las gracias.
texts.en:
Valentín R., 34, lives in the Pablo Úbeda neighborhood. He is married and has a beautiful one year old daughter. His wife works as a teacher, and they both help cover the expenses. Basic grocery costs are extremely high due to the drought this year. He has worked as a security guard for six years. He earns little, but he cannot find other work. That is why he is always working security. The difficulty he encounters is that when something is stolen, he has to pay for it out of his salary. This has an ill effect on the family expenses. With this loan he wants to repair a room. The zinc is old and leaks when it rains. He wants his family to be fine so that they do not get sick. He will buy zinc to do this. His future plan is to have his own business with basic grains and selling clothes. He hopes to achieve a better future. He is grateful for the loan, which is an investment source.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new zinz to change the roof of his house so it will not leak anymore

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita V. is from the village of D'BAN, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a 57-year-old widow with four adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a retail store selling seafood products like fish and shrimp. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.  Clarita has joined GDMPC in hopes of gaining access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam M. is currently in the business of selling rice, sugar, etc. in a shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice and sugar to sell. Mariam is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her shop.
