BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mrs. Rin C. is 39 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey province, where she makes a living farming a variety of vegetables. Beside farm work, she also sells small snack foods to other villagers, for extra income. Another source of family income is from her husband’s work. He carves marble and sells his creations for a profit. The couple now has two teenage children who have finished school and are employed. Rin C. is taking out her loan to buy fertilizers and onion seeds to begin growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and onion seeds to begin growing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the thirty-three-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community.

Mary works to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from nearby fishing communities, smokes them, and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community.

Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Slmb Maroc Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the S.L.M.B Maroc Primary School, Magburaka. S.L.M.B Primary school Maroc was built primarily for the purpose of Quranic reading, but later was transformed into English and Arabic learning. Presently, there are 20 teachers in the school and 705 pupils. S.L.M.B always makes good grades in public exams (The National Primary School Examinations-NPSE) and does well in sports. The school has produced a lot of highly qualified and trained professionals in all walks of life who are living and working in and outside of Sierra Leone.

This is the second loan S.L.M.B is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-seven-year-old Alimany K. (first row, second from right) is the head teacher at the school. He was born in Rochen, eight miles from Magburaka town. He is married with 9 children – 1 in college, 3 in secondary school and 5 in primary school. Alimany will use his loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda E. is from the city of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Esmeralda is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Esmeralda owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Esmeralda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Esmeralda's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora V. is 48 years old and married with six children. She is from Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns a sari-sari store and her husband is a farmer. She has managed her business for almost three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Her husband also supports their daily basic needs.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be engaged in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. As of now, she has a new loan of 3,000 PHP taken from PMPC, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosa Erminda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Erminda B. se le otorgo un crédito para compra de terneros de desarrollo ya que ella y su familia tienen una finca la cual esta ubicada carretera Jiquilillo y trabajan en el rubro ganadero.
La Sra. B. es madre de un niño y a la ves dice estar muy agradecida con Ceprodel, por la ayuda que le otorgaron al darle el crédito para engrandecer la ganadería tanto para patrimonio de su familia como de su hijo.
Ella es segundo crédito el que se le ha otorgado pero da gracias a la Institución y espera que mas adelante la sigamos apoyando.
texts.en:
Rosa Erminda B. has been approved for a loan in order to buy calves to raise on her family's farm located on the Jiquilillo highway. Her family works in the livestock sector. Señora B. is the mother of one child, and she says she is very grateful to Ceprodel for the help they provide by granting this loan that will increase her herd of livestock as well as for their patronage of her family, which includes her son. This is the second loan she has been given, and she thanks the lending institution and hopes that they can continue to give her future support.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves to raise on her farm

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Barón E., tiene 61 años y es una mujer emprendedora que maneja simultáneamente a  2 negocios, por un lado vende mercancías variadas como ropa, accesorios cubre lechos, sobrecamas  y por otro lado  pescado especialmente bocachico, pargo, y mojarra.
 
Desde los 25 años llegó a Barranquilla desde  su natal San Onofre en el departamento de  Sucre,  cuando nació su primera hija sintió la necesidad de obtener mas ingresos extras y con el producto de su trabajo  de 5 años como  empleada doméstica y en restaurantes,  se dedicó a vender mercancía traída desde Valledupar en el Cesar y también desde Maicao  en la Guajira.  Así fue como empezó a comercializar juegos de sabanas,  toallas, labor que realizó durante 10 años. Ya en el  año 1998,  empezó a vender pescado  que le compraba a su hermana  y construyó una clientela fija,  con más de 25 a 30 clientes de diferentes barrios como El Recreo, Las Delicias, Boston  y actualmente combina perfectamente sus dos actividades  las cuales les generan ingresos a crédito y de contado, como en el caso del pescado.

Este es el cuarto crédito con la Fundación, ellos han cambiado positivamente su entorno comercial, pues así puede hacer compras en mayor volumen y también puede responde a nuevos clientes con los que ellos necesiten.
Su sueño es lograr montar un pequeño almacén donde pueda ofrecer sus mercancías ella quiere una  especie de boutique, porque su negocio marcha bien y tiene una clientela exclusiva que ha ido escogiendo a través de los años, ellos  son profesores y empleados a quienes les acredita y ellos le pagan cada quince días.
texts.en:
Juana Barón E. is 61 years old. She is an entreprenuerial woman who manages two businesses simultaneously: selling various merchandise like clothes, quilts, and bedspreads on one end and selling fish like bocachico, snapper, and tilapia on the other. At age 25 she came to Barranquilla from her hometown San Onofre in the department of Sucre. When her first daughter was born she felt the need to make more money. As a result of her five years working as a maid and in restaurants, she was able to begin selling merchandise brought from Valledupar in Cesar and from Maicao in Guajira. This is how she began selling sets of sheets and towels, which she did over ten years. In 1998, she began selling fish that her sister bought for her. She built up a solid customer base with more than 25 to 30 clients from different neighborhoods like El Recreo, Las Delicias, and Boston. Her two businesses complement each other well, generating income through credit and cash, as is the case with the fish. This is her fourth loan with the Foundation. The loans have impacted her business environment positively, by allowing her to make higher-volume purchases and respond to the needs of new customers. Her dream is to be able to have a small store where she can sell her merchandise. She wants a boutique since her business has been going well and she has an exclusive customer base that she has chosen over the years. They are professors and employees who she gives credit to and they pay her every fifteen days.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise like towels, sheets, dresses, and fish

loans.name: Lucia Esmeralda

texts.es: Lucia es una joven esforzada, de edad de 25 años, vive en el bario Villa Reconciliación, junto a sus  cuatro hijos y esposo,  el trabaja en una vulcanización reparando las llantas de los vehículos. Lucia trabaja en zona franca de operaria, también vende ropa entre sus mismos compañero le hacen los encargos lo cual le deja un margen de ganancia en donde se ayuda para dar a sus hijos una buena educación ya que los cuatro estudian como lo necesario. A mucha dificultad ha logrado hacer su casa ya que todo esta caro, ante su casa era de madera y  ha logrado hacerla de concreto, con este financiamiento lograra comprar soldadura para poner verjas en ventana y puertas para lograr una mejor seguridad de su familia. Sus planes es seguir haciendo las divisiones, repello de paredes, pintura que espera lograrlo a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking young person who is 25 years old. She lives in the “Villa Reconciliacíon” neighborhood with her four children and her husband. Her husband works at a tire store repairing vehicle tires. Lucia works in the duty-free zone. She also sells clothes to her friends. She sells her clothes at a price that allows her to make a profit. She uses the profit to provide her children with a good education. They are all studying. It is very difficult to maintain her house, as everything is very expensive. Her house used to be made of wood. Now she is trying to make the house out of concrete. With this loan she will buy welding materials for the window and door grates in order to provide her family with better security. Her plans are to continue adding the grates, cementing the walls and painting in order to have a good home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy welding material and security grates for the windows and doors

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35-year-old father of four children, aged between 4 months and 11 years old. Two of the children are attending school. Joseph practises mixed farming in western Kenya near Kitale town. He has been in this business for two years and employs several employees on a casual basis. He sells his eggs to the local market. He also earns some income from a small kiosk he operates in the same area.
Joseph has requested his first loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 30,000 KES to expand his poultry project. He says the income from this project will enable him to educate his children to higher levels. He says that the main challenge with his business is the common poultry diseases in the area, which has lead to low production. In future, he hopes to expand his poultry farm and eventually venture into dairy farming. He adds that "he appreciates the flexibility in repayment to Juhudi Kilimo, that is, weekly, bi-weekly, and monthly."

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre cien por ciento dedicado a sus labores, tiene 40 años y vive sólo en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Su trabajo consiste en preparar los injertos de palta, mango, cacao y frutas cítricas, para luego cultivarlos, de esa manera ha trabajado durante 8 años en sus propias tierras. Además no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, sin embargo cuando se trata de limpiar, aplicar abono y cosechar contrato operarios. La  agricultura le resulta bastante rentable porque vive cómodamente, además le permite ahorrar para algunos imprevistos y proyectos. Para su futuro, quiere construir su vivienda con material noble, pues a la fecha es rústico con maderas y calaminas, además desea adquirir más terrenos agrícolas que lo beneficien. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y le agrada laborar de manera activa en su grupo comunal, más aún porque mensualmente puede ahorrar. Con el crédito que solicita comprará ladrillos, madera y calaminas, para terminar de construir su casa a base de material noble.
texts.en:
Pedro is a man who is 100% dedicated to his work. He is 40 years old and lives alone in his own house, in the city of Pichanaki. His work consists of preparing grafts for avocado, mango, cocoa and citrus fruit trees, and then cultivating them. He has done this work for 8 years on his own land. He does not receive help from anyone, but when it is time to clear the fields, apply fertilizer or harvest his crops, he contracts hired laborers. Farming is quite profitable for him, and he lives comfortably; his work also allows him to save money for projects and unexpected expenses. For the future, he would like to rebuild his house using higher-quality materials, since it is currently quite rustic, made out of planks and corrugated sheets. He would also like to acquire more farmland, which would be advantageous for him. This is his third loan with MFP, and he enjoys working actively with his communal bank. He especially enjoys it because he is able to save money each month. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy bricks, wood and corrugated metal sheets, so he can finish building his house out of solid materials.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bricks, corrugated metal sheets and wood to finish building his house

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula vende perfumes y cosméticos en las oficinas y mercados de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y su esposo se encarga de la alimentación y vestimenta de sus hijos. Y con esta actividad Paula solventa el pago de sus estudios en la Universidad. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para pago de mensualidades y matricula en la Universidad, (estudios Superiores)
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Paula sells perfumes and cosmetics in office buildings and markets in the city of La Paz. She is married and her husband is in charge of feeding and clothing their children. Through her business activity, Paula is able to pay for her university expenses. She lives in the house of her grandparents in the district of Alto Obrajes in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to pay her monthly tuition and fees at the university. Paula is receiving her third loan from IMPRO and has demonstrated responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for university tuition & fees

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 22 years old, married and has a 1-year-old child. To make a living, Farrah owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Farrah joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Farrah is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. This will be the first loan taken out by Farrah from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen people who live in Sdau Kanlaeng village, located in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes which will improve their standard of living. 

Mrs. Srey Mom S. is 30 years old and she is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a housewife who makes delicious food for her family while her husband, Mr. Roeurn Sim, is a construction worker who earns some money to support their family. Their problem is that their home is in need of repair, but they do not have the money to fix it.  To solve this problem, Mrs. Srey Mom S. is seeking a loan to repair her home. She is a mother of two children; one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local public school. 

All the members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To fix her home

loans.name: God’S Wonders Group

texts.en:
Meakel D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Wonders. She is 62 years old, married and has five children aged from 27 to 39 years old. She did not have the privilege of attending school due to poverty. For the past ten years, she has been selling dried fish in Thinkers Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.
Meakel plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more fish. She describes herself as a caring woman. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Erick Nyaribo

texts.en:
Eric is a businessman who runs a retail shop. He opened his shop in Naivasha town in January this year.  He is 26 years old, married to Peris Kemunto, and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and he has no history with any other micro-finance institutions. This will be his first loan.  He plans to add a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell.

In the future, Erick hopes he will be able to open up a wholesale store, still in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Sonia María

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia María E. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió,  reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador.  Cuenca es una ciudad encantadora por sus iglesias, su parque histórico y su gente.
 
Doña Sonia María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar y también a la venta de productos YANBAL, lleva 9 años en este negocio, se dedica a la venta  en su tiempo libre. Lleva 12 años trabajando con su bankito, es una de las socias fundadoras y  nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en el incremento de su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos YANBAL.

La Señora. Sonia tiene 37 años,  es casada, y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia en la universidad y su hijo menor en el colegio, su esposo es chofer y maneja su propio taxi, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Su  sueño es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia María E. is a member of the Las Caleras Communal Bank. She lives in the Las Caleras area of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, and it is know for being the third most important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is a charming city because of its churches, its historical park, and its people. Sonia María devotes herself to the household chores, and she also sells Yanbal products. She has been in this business for nine years. She sells during her free time. She has been working with her communal bank for 12 years. She is one of the founding members, and she tells us that the loans have been very helpful in increasing her business. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy Yanbal products. Sonia is 37 years old, and she is married. She has two children, ages 19 and 13. Her oldest daughter is attending the university. Her youngest child goes to school. Her husband is a driver, and he drives his own taxi. The house where they live is their own. Her dream is to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, jewelry, and Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: Lil Joy

texts.en:
Lil Joy V. is from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lil Joy sells frozen chicken, pork, and fish in the local community. Lil Joy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lil Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lil Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50000 PHP from ASKI and now requests her 8th loan, for 50000 PHP, to buy more products to sell.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy chicken, pork, and fish to sell.

loans.name: 08.03.01 Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Minh N. T. (1) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Minh is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.03.01 Dong Ve (08.03.01 Dong Ve).


Minh is married and has no children.  To make a living, Minh works in a family member's business making and selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Minh has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Minh is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Minh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Nga (2) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


2.  B. T. Hang (3) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Minh N. T. (1) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố thanh hoa.  Minh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08.03.01 Dong Ve (08.03.01 Dong Ve).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Minh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Minh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Minh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Minh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Nga (2) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  B. T. Hang (3) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 59ans marié et mère de 2 enfants agée de 39ans à 18ans dont 1 enfant est scolarisé.Elle se lance dans le commerce d'habillement en 1975 avec un capital de 60000 frs cfa. Ses revenus journaliers varient de 5000 à 30000frs.
Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son commerce en achetant des robes fillette,des sous-vêtement,des sandales enfants filles comme hommes.
Elle a pour strategie de reserver un bon acceuil à ses clients, présenter un bon éttallage et faire la variation des produit ainsi que des couleurs sur son étallages.
Elle aimerait être grossiste et bien situé ses enfants surtout celui de 18ans.
Dans le quartier elle est la maman de tous les enfants.
texts.en:
This businesswoman is a 59-year-old, married mother of two children, ages 39 and18, one of whom has attended school. She started selling clothing in 1975 with a capital of 60,000FCFA. Her daily income varies from 5,000 to 30,000 francs.

With this loan, she plans to strengthen her business by buying dresses for girls, underwear, and children’s sandals.

Her strategy includes a warm greeting to her customers, a nice display of her merchandise, and variety in the types and colors of products she offers.

She would like to become a wholesaler and provide a good future for her children, especially the 18-year-old. In the neighborhood, she is a mother to all children.

loans.use: To buy clothes, underwear, and sandals

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas K. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. All of her children are currently in school. Cleophas has a business of a textile business, which she has had for 7 years.         

To help expand her business, Cleophas has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Cleophas hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Cleophas hopes to own a shop and expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eliceo;   él tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba en transporte el socio trabaja como chofer de la empresa de transporte de pasajeros en la ruta Cusco Ocongate, el socio sale diario cubriendo esta ruta por las mañanas; el socio en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar, el socio pagará sus cuotas con el pago de sus salarios de poco a poco. El socio solicita el préstamo para compra de víveres.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The parnter belogs to the “PACHA ILLAIRY" loan group, located in the disctrict of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Eliceo is 32 years old. He lives with his partner and has 3 children. He is originally from Ocongate. He works in transportation, as driver of a people carrier in the Cusco-Ocongate route. Every day he covers the route, leaving early in the morning. He requests the loan to buy supplies for his home. He is planning to repay it gradually through his wages. He requests the loan to buy groceries. 

The partner appreciates and values the loan and is committed to repaying it on time under the terms agreed.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd. She runs a small business selling bedding, linens and sheets in the central market of her home town. She has been in the trade for a while. Currently, she has about 50,000 UAH in turnover capital.   

Irina is seeking a loan of 6,000 UAH to diversify the merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is a determined and focused hard-worker. She works long hours and knows the value of money. She has a grown son who has his own small startup business. She is actively helping him learn some of the tricks of the trade and provides much needed financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: José Gabriel

texts.es:
José Gabriel V. C. tiene 43 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una vivienda en Chillanes y dar la educación a los hijos.


Le gusta practicar toda clase de deporte.
texts.en:
José Gabriel V. C., 43, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) members are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional activities.  It has 17 members.

José is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  He buys his supplies in Chillanes and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for the loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to have a house in Chillanes and to provide an education for his children.

He enjoys playing all kinds of sports.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 57 years old and married to Beatrice, who contributes to the family income. They have four children aged 27, 23, 20 and 20 years. Samson has been growing crops for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of 6000 Kenya shillings.

This will be his second loan with KADET LTD after having repaid the previous one. Samson hopes to be a leading horticulture farmer and give his children a quality education and improve their living standards

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores L. H. vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con tres hijas a su responsabilidad y son: Tania Guadalupe de 12 años, gloria Melisa de cuatro años  y el más pequeño es Jesús Abey de tres años.

        Ella esta se dedica a vender la mercancía de topear ware en donde lleva  diez años y desde entonces le va muy bien ya que ha obtenido mucha clientela del cual le compra a mayoreo, ya que s  mercancía de buena calidad y  la apetecen.

        De todo lo que va obteniendo del diario lo ahorra, pues su inspiración es que logre ser una gerentes de ventas en  los artículos  delo que ella vende y así salir adelante con su familia.

      Su más grande sueño es que con el tiempo logre su meta de ser una ejecutiva de ventas y poner  su propio negocio del cual se siente muy orgullosa de ellos pues le ha dejado muy buen resultado.
   
      Para solicitar el préstamo busco informacion del programa, le pareció muy bueno y es así como hoy es parte del crédito que otorga fundación realidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores L. H. lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, México.  She’s married and has three children in her care.  They are: Tania Guadalupe, 12, Gloria Melisa, 4, and the youngest, Jesús Abey, 3.

She has been selling Tupperware merchandise for ten years.  She has done very well all this time because she has acquired many customers who buy from her at wholesale because her merchandise is very good quality and well received.

She saves everything she earns daily because her inspiration is to become a Sales Manager for the type of merchandise she sells and thus get ahead with her family.

Her greatest dream is to become a Sales Executive in time and set up her own business of which she can be proud because she’s had good results to date.

To request the loan she sought information about the programs.  She thought it was very good and that’s how today she’s part of the loan Fundación Realidad grants.

loans.use: To buy Tupperware products.

loans.name: Parsaan's Group

texts.en:
Parsaan comes from Mian Chanu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 3-room brick house in the area of Kothi Nand Singh for over 12 years. She is a housewife, stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is the mother of an only son who is illiterate; he couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of the family.

 Her husband's name is G. R. and he has a business selling & repairing car batteries. He owns a shop in the market through which he sells different brands of batteries to his customers and earns income for the family. His son also helps him in his business. 

Parsaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy car batteries to put in his shop for sale. He will also buy some repair tools to provide car battery repair services to his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 8 years, and Parsaan is hopeful that her husband’s business will be improved further after investing loan money into it. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy car batteries and repair tools

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma A.' main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Bacnor East. Wilma has been in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María Gloria M. D. V. D. 44 años D. edad,  resiD. en San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y 5 hijos, todos menores D. 13 años D. edad. María es muy responsable, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos. Día con día se dedica a la elaboración D. tortillas, así mismo elabora chocobananos, los cuales son muy típicos D. este país y que son hechos D. guineos bañados D. chocolate y congelados, esto cuenta con muy buena demanda sobre todo por ser un país con clima caliente razón por la que muchas personas los compran. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar masa, gas y cal para la elaboración y cocción D. las tortillas, y así mismo para comprar chocolate, guineos y palitos D. madera para la elaboración D. los chocobananos. D. esta manera María espera elaborar mayor cantidad D. productos y así mejorar sus ganancias las cuales sean D. mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: María Gloria M. D. V. is 44 years old and lives in San Juan Opico in the Liberty department with her husband and 5 children who are all under 13 years of age. María is very responsible and has many positive recommendations from her neighbors. Day by day she makes tortillas and chocobananas which are typical in the country maD. of guinean bananas soaked in chocolate then frozen. Since the climate is hot there is a high demand for her product. María is requesting the loan to buy masa (a cron-based dough), gas, and lime to make tortillas as well as buy chocolate, guinean bananas, and wooden sticks to make cocobananas. This way she will be able to make more to sell and increase sales which will be very beneficial for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make tortillas and chocobananas.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jehova Jirex Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehova Jirex lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Lorena del Carmen S. de 55 años se dedica a la costura desde hace 3 años. Ella inicio vendiendo verduras y frutas, luego CD y ahora está en la costura.
Ella invertirá el crédito en telas y su mayor sueño es tener un taller de moda con todas las condiciones. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivania Leticia M. quien vende fritanga y María Justina Rocha quien vende comida.
texts.en:
The group “Jehova Jirex” consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Lorena del Carmen S.. She is 55 years old and has worked as a seamstress for three years. Lorena started out selling vegetables and fruits, and later CDs, but now she is a seamstress.

She will invest her loan in fabrics. Her greatest wish is to have a sewing workshop in good condition.

The other members of the group are Ivania Leticia M., who sells fried foods, and María Justina Rocha who sells food.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: El señor Rufino, Chofer asalariado, el crédito lo requiere para el aumento de anticrético ya que el señor vive en la casa de una prima y pero paga alquiler; la casa queda ubicada en la Zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, con los ingresos que obtiene  mantiene a su familia. Es Divorciado  y tiene dos hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rufino is employed as a driver. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase the amount of his anticrético* arrangements, as he is living in a family member’s house to whom he pays rent. The house is located in Llojeta, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is able to provide for his family thanks to his earnings. He is divorced and has two children. This is his first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA

<cite>*Anticrético: a special type of arrangement in which property is pawned to the tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment, and the rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period.</cite>

loans.use: To increase the amount of his anticrético agreement in order to stop paying rent.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George was born in 1969. He is married with three children aged 16, 14 and 12. He earns his living from plumbing. He also runs a grocery store so as to supplement his family’s income. He has learned how to manage his business through the training offered by Faulu Kenya. He hopes to build his clientale in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a pipe-fitting machine.

loans.use: to buy a pipe-fitting machine

loans.name: Nora Helen

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el Km # 5 vía Manta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nora. Tiene 35 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es profesor.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, y accesorios de damas), trabaja de tres a cuatro días  a la semana, sus productos los vende a crédito y realiza los cobros los fines de semana. También se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata al mismo tiempo que ofrece sus otros productos, nos cuenta que este negocio lo empezó con el crédito anterior y que le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para  comprar joyas de plata, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.  Es socia fundadora del Banco Comuna y le gustan los créditos ya que la ayudan mucho para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Loma de Los Vientos community bank meets on the outskirts of Portoviejo, 5km from the city, on the road to Manta.  Most people here farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 35 year-old Nora who is married and has three children.  Two of her children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  Nora's husband is a teacher.

Nora sells Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works three or four days a week.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment on weekends.  Nora also sells silver jewelry at the same time as she sells her other products.  She tells us that she started her business with her previous loan and that it is going very well.

Nora will use this loan to buy silver jewelry, perfume, creams and cosmetics.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes the loans because they help her a lot in getting ahead in life.

Nora's dream is to buy a car so that she can sell her products in other places.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry, perfume, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, reside en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de artesanía y ropa, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 5 años de edad, inicio en el comercio con un hermano, luego se independizo, instalo su propio puesto de venta en el mercado municipal de San Miguel.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de artesanía y prendas de vestir, como blusas y camisas de vestir, también pantalones y vestidos. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la mercadería y tener mayor capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Su objetivo a futuro es tener un negocio auto sostenible, que su familia este en mejores condiciones económicas y sus hijos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
José resides in San Miguel and sells handicrafts and clothing. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 5. José started in this trade with his brother, but he later became independent and established his own vending post at the municipal market in San Miguel.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy handicrafts and articles of clothing such as blouses, dress shirts, trousers, and dresses. This investment will help him expand his inventory of merchandise so that he can increase his capacity to attend to his customers.

His goal for the future is to have a self-sustaining business so that his family will be in a better financial condition and his children will be able to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Asunción Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Carmen  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 39 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras hace 13 años inicio vendiendo cosechas de jocotes, mangos, aguacates según la temporada. En la actualidad ella vende de todo lo que es verduras y frutas en lo que invertirá el crédito  y cuenta con dos trabajadores.

Asunción tiene seis hijos de 20, 18, 15, 11, 4 y 2 años los cuales estudian menos la menor.
texts.en:
Asunción del Carmen is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman of 39 who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 13 years.  She started out selling harvests of jocotes (a native fruit), mangos and avocados, according to the season.  She currently sells all types of fruit and vegetables and this is what she will spend her loan money on.  She has two employees.

Asunción has six children aged 20, 18, 15, 11, 4 and 2.  They are all in school except the youngest.

loans.use: to buy harvests of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
Freddy Gilbert tiene 40 años, vive en union libre vive con la compañera y un hijo de 8 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

freddy se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y frejol en terrenos de propios , las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una maquina desgranadora para el grano.

le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en: Freddy Gilbert is 40 and lives with his wife and son, who is 8, in Ventanas, Rios province.  He is a member of V.R.C. EL RECREO in San Vicente de las Lomas, whose members are farmers growing corn, rice, beans and soy.  Freddy specializes in growing corn and beans on his property, which he sells in local markets, especially on Sundays.  He is seeking this credit to buy crop seed and fertilizer, to meet his needs and help him to overcome challenges such as variable rainfall. His dream is to one day buy a machine to de-husk grain.

loans.use: to buy crop seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Naotala

texts.en:
Naotala is 47 years of age and married with seven children. Naotala owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Naotala needs a loan of WST $2900 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2007, Naotala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Naotala's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Racilyn

texts.en:
Racilyn is 30 and is a married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. They till their own land where they grow rice crops. Racilyn said they earn about 10000 PHP  per month from farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. In the future, she hopes to earn more income and sustain her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Wabulenga Womens Group

texts.en:
Erinah, 37, has been running a used clothing sales business for the past five years in Jinja town. Her experience has taught her much about her client's tastes and preferences and also about the nature of doing business. This insight is something she has used to the advantage of her business. She, for example, knows that her female clients normally prefer long dresses during the cold seasons and her male clients fancy long sleeved shirts. She has learned to take in stride most of the many challenges that come with running a business.

Erinah is happily married with four kids who are all in school. She got the capital to set up this business from savings from her water and soft drinks sales business. Hard work, tenacity and determination are some of the attributes that Erinah has banked on to make inroads in her business. Monthly, this business generates sales profits totaling up to 150,000 Ugandan shillings.

With this Kiva loan, Erinah plans to purchase more bales of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rhodora has a construction shop that sells cement & hollow blocks. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for making hollow blocks.

Rhodora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhodora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making hollow blocks

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz nació en santa cruz de la sierra - tiene una  hija ella es separada hace varios años. La señora se encuentra muy contenta ya que su hija la hará abuela se dedica a la venta de carne hace 25 años en el mercadito de  la zona, también en tiempos atrás ella trabajaba en banco perteneciente a la misma institución pero como todo llego a su final entonces decidieron sacar credito individual,  hace 49 años que  esta viviendo en la localidad de la guardia  hace 5 años que se fue a vivir en la casa de su amiga ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la institución porque gracias a ella lograra comprar otro Frizzer mas grande para almacenar sus productos ya que sera su herramienta de trabajo ya que lo encontró de ocasión, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Beatriz was born in Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She has one daughter and has been separated for many years. Beatriz is very happy because her daughter is about to make her a grandmother.

Beatriz has been selling meat in the local market for 25 years. In the past, she participated in a communal bank with Emprender, but like everything, that came to an end. Then she decided to take out an individual loan.

She has been living in the locality of La Guardia since she went to live at her friend's house five years ago. She is very grateful to the organization because thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy another, bigger freezer for storing her products. This will be very useful in her work and she found it at a bargain price. She is a very hard-working person and is grateful for the support being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy another freezer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a resident of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow, 59 years old. She has three grown children who sometimes help her in the business when not busy. 

She makes ice candy and other snack items to sell in the community and distributes them in some contact areas not too far from her place. Maria came up with this idea for a business venture five years ago.  She makes PHP 8,400 a month, approximately, doing this job.

To have access to financial services, Maria joined GDMPC in the year 2009. All her previous loans were successfully paid back. This year, she is again requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 from the cooperative to purchase highly-needed materials for making ice candy and other refreshments. She usually gets empty boxes or containers at the end of the day - sold out - that pushes her to go on.
 
With this additional investment made, Maria hopes to improve product quality and produce other salable products to sell to lift up the general living condition of the family.

loans.use: To purchase highly-needed materials for making ice candy and other refreshments.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama  est une femme mariée. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle est  âgée  de 49 ans.
 Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis longtemps plus précisément  dans la vente de produits alimentaires. Elle a choisi cette activité dans l’objectif de se procurer des revenus et subvenir a ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de sa famille. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son stock et préparer le ramadan et la korité. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer ses gains financiers et mieux prendre en charge ses besoins sociaux.
  
OUA
texts.en:
Ms. Adama is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She is 49 years old and has been active in commerce, specifically the selling of grocery items, for a long time. She chose this work with the goal of earning an income and meeting her own needs, as well as those of her family. 

She has been a member of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since June 2010. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs with the goal of bolstering her stock of goods in preparing for Ramadan and Korité. This financing will enable her to improve her financial gains and to do better with her living expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Sowanou

texts.fr:
Sowanou est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié. Il a 2 enfants.  
Sowanou  travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010 à domicile. Il achète et revend  pour ses clients composés de toute personne la friperie. Il achète les produits au marché local de hedrzanawoé et d’adawlato. Il travaille avec seul dans son activité
Sowanou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 3 balles de friperies.
texts.en:
Sowanou is 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. Since 2010, he's been buying secondhand clothing that he resells at his home to a wide range of customers.

He gets his supplies at the local market in Hedrzanawoé and Adawlato. He works alone, and is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy three bales of secondhand clothing.

loans.use: to buy three bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Himoyat's Group

texts.en:
Himoyat is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 5,000 soms. Together they have raised two sons and a daughter. The daughter works in Russia, the first son is a constructor and the younger son is a farmer. 

Himoyat is engaged in the cultivation of agricultural products. She has been growing cotton for 12 years. In this way she earns about 6,000 soms per month. At the moment she is applying for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

Some part of the loan she will use to contribute money to her son’s wedding. In the near future she hopes to get a good harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Khom, is a construction worker and rice farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1972 and have seven married children-three sons and four daughters.

Sokhoeun is asking for another loan of $400 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Naumo Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Naumo Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of 11 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Naumo Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 40-year-old married man. Together with his wife Florence, they are blessed with a three-year-old child. For the past 3½ years, Felix has operated his own vegetable kiosk and his primary customers are his neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Felix will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables. Felix aspires to open more kiosks and continue expanding his business in the future. He joined Yehu because they offer a variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 45-years-old and married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong and her husband have been running a food stall for ten years. They primarily sell beef noodles from their stall, which they sell to people in her community.

Huong would like to receive a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and to buy a greater quantity and quality of ingredients to make good food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to attract new customers and increase the income that she earns from her business. She hopes that with the increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and food to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and has six children. Virginia is sixty three years old and presently lives in Calolot, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Virginia works as a food vendor in her barangay (village) to earn a living and has had her business for many years. Each month she earns more than 1,000 PHP in her business. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Virginia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for two years. In the future, Virginia hopes that she can earn more than she needs in her business through the help of PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: La socia Bernardina, continua con su trabajo en el consultorio dental junto a su conyugue, la socia tambien  vende productos naturales, ella vende productos a base de hierbas medicinales naturales, la socia desea a futuro ampliar su consultorio dental e implementar sus productos naturales en vitrinas en el mismo local de su consultorio dental. En esta ocasion la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos naturales para implementar su consultorio.
texts.en: The member, Bernadina, is continuing with her work in the dental office with her husband. The member also sells natural products. She sells natural herbal medicine based products. In the future, the member wants to expand her dental office and show her natural products in display cases, in the same location as the dental office. On this occasion the member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of natural products to supply her office.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of natural products to supply her office.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six month, she has operated a business of selling omena (dry fish) to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of becoming a main (key) supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of omena (dry fish) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of omena (dry fish) for resale.

loans.name: Viviana Marcela

texts.es: La joven Viviana a sus 21 años desea iniciar su propio negocio con el cual pueda apoyar económicamente a sus padres quienes son adultos mayores y les es muy difícil trabajar. La joven Viviana desea tener una tienda ubicada en su casa localizada en la vereda Campo Alegre del municipio de Marinilla al oriente de Antioquia. Requiere para el inicio de la tienda de la compra de surtido tal como abarrotes, gaseosas, dulces y snacks que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes y así cumplir su sueño de ser una empresaria y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en: Young Viviana is 21 years old. She would like to begin her own business. She will use her earnings to support her elderly parents who find it difficult to work. The young Viviana would like to have a store at her house which is located on Campo Alegre Street in the Marinilla Municipality in east Antioquia. In order to start her store she needs to buy a variety of goods such as groceries, sodas, sweets and snacks that she can sell to her customers. This will allow her to reach her dream of being a entrepreneur and to help her parents.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods in order to stock her store in her home.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con las miembros de otro grupo que anteriormente trabajaba con la fundación. El grupo actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Cynthia es integrante del comité,  tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y tiene 2 hijas. Ella  se dedica a la venta de comestible en su domicilio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, puesto que sus vecinos acuden a ella para poder comprar los alimentos que prepara. Ella dice que todo lo que hace es por darles a sus hijas un futuro digno, ya que ella se encuentra sola.
Pide el crédito para la  compra de discos de empanadas, mayonesas, verduras, etc., los cuales son los ingredientes esenciales para los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed by the members of another group that had worked previously with the foundation.  The group currently is in its second loan cycle in Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs, and they want to be able to go all the way to the highest level of the program.

Cynthia is a member of the bank.  She is 21 years old and single, and has two daughters.  She works selling food in her home and she tells us that it is going very well for her because her neighbors come to her to be able to buy the food she prepares.  She says that everything she does is to give her daughters a future of dignity, since she is alone.

She is requesting the loan to buy shells for "empanadas" [small pies] , mayonnaise, vegetables, etc., which are the essential ingredients for the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy pie shells, mayonnaise, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sister Aba

texts.en: Sister Aba is married and has five children. Her husband is an electrician. Aba sells banku and waakye near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for three years. Banku is cooked and fermented cassava or maize dough and waakye is beans and rice mixed together. Aba uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Aba will use the loan to purchase to buy more maize, rice, etc. With the new profits, Aba plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice, etc.

loans.name: Las Araucarias Group

texts.es: Angélica, (que está ubicada al costado izquierdo de la fotografía, hincada con sweater morado pantalón café y bolso negro cruzado)  es una socia del Banco Comunal La Araucarias  que se ubica en Villarrica Región de la Araucanía de Chile, dentro de este Banco Comunal encontramos distintos rubros como lo son venta de ropa nueva y usada, minimarket, venta de perfumes y costuras. Angélica se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, y comenzó desde hace algún tiempo, aunque hace un año y medio que está vendiendo ropa usada de su familia y comprando fardos de ropa usada para vender, ella está necesitando un crédito para empezar en la venta fuerte de ropa nueva. No ha tenido ningún contratiempo ya que con este negocio que ella tiene ayuda a su marido. Ocupará este préstamo en comprar ropa nueva, ya que ha hecho un estudio de mercado en donde vive y a sus cercanos y llego a la conclusión de que vendiendo ropa nueva le iría mucho mejor. Espera que le vaya muy bien respecto a su estudio de mercado. Y lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de estar aprendiendo a poder mejorar su ingreso y está esperando con ansias sus capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Angélica, (located on the left side of the photograph, hunched down with a purple sweater, brown pants and a black bag across her chest), is a member of the Communal Bank Las Araucarias, which is located in the Villarrica Region of Southern Chile. Different work areas can be found within this Communal Bank, such as new and used clothing sales, a minimarket, and perfume and sewing product sales.

Angélica makes a living selling new clothes and she started some time ago, but she has been selling her family's used clothes and buying bales of used clothes to sell for a year and a half. She is in need of a loan to start selling greater amounts of new clothing. She has not had any setbacks because with this business that she has, she is able to help her husband. 

She will use this loan to buy new clothes, since she has done a market study where she lives and those nearby led her to the conclusion that selling new clothing would go much better for her. She hopes that her market study goes very well for her. What she has liked the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that she is learning to be able to improve her income, and she is anxiously awaiting her training.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and sell them

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She runs a small grocery store in Ebubonku (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 18 years. Cecilia is married and has four children. Her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Cecilia wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell more goods. In the long term, Cecilia plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to have more goods to sell.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian, pictured above, has been a farmer for 7 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Chwele District. She is 29 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Lilian likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Lilian plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Lilian’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use as a taxi

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is not married and has two children. She lives in Buza area in Dar es Salaam. Amina owns a small canteen near the Dar es Salaam Harbour. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch to mostly harbour workers. Amina has received entrepreneurship and business training from Hans Said Foundation and Equal Oportunities Trust Fund (EOTF) in Dar es Salaam.

During working hours her business is normally very busy with customers. She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks.

To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD 1000 as a working capital. Amina’s dream is to one day have a professional catering business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. Suong is 45, and her husband is 47 years old. They have 3 children between 2 and 17. They are using their income to support their children's education. They have about 2000 square meters. Tuy, her husband, can only find work in the dry season. Mrs. Suong buys fruits from door to door and then sells it at the small market. This work has increased the family's income by about $1.50/person/month. She has already repaid the third loan in time. Now, Mrs. Suong wants to borrow a loan of $75 again.

loans.use: buys and selling fruits

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 35 year old mother of two children. She is married to a polygamist, Joseph, and has had a problem of sickness that has resulted into two surgeries. Given the fact that her husband has a heavy responsibility providing for all the other wives and their children, she decided to become a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all her loans with which she sold second-hand dresses and she raised money to assist her husband to pay school fees and provide food for her children.

Given a loan of $1000, she plans to sell palm oil and raise money to continue paying her children’s school fees and to increase her business. She will buy palm oil from the villages where they are cheaper and sell in the town so she can make a maximum profit. She will use this profit to pay school fees for her children and to buy food for her family.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. Her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil

loans.name: Oruj

texts.ru:
Oruj S. was born in 1949. He lives in the town of Shamakhe. Oruj is married and has 3 children. In 2004, he took his first NorMicro loan of $200. He used the money to rent a spot on the central market of Aksu, where Oruj sells every Saturday and Sunday. During the week, Oruj has a food service job.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафаров Орудж, 1949 года рождения. Родилься и проживает в городе Шамахы.Семейный, имеет троих детей. Первый раз он взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 2004 году на сумму 200$.Орудж арендовал место на центральном рынке в городе Аксу. Каждую субботу и воскресенье ведет активную торговли.Кроме этого он еще занимаеться общепитом.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Muava

texts.en: Muava is 42-years-old and married with four kids. She is working very hard in her businesses because these are her only source of income. Her loan was used to buy products and tools needed for both businesses. It has been very helpful to the family in different areas such as school fees, food and other family expenses. She hopes to stay long in the loan program.

loans.use: To buy products for her plantation and tools for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Faete

texts.en: Faete is married with 7 children. Her husband has been a taxi driver for ages and although he works seven days a week, due to so many family commitments his taxi income is not sufficient to support their family. Faete has tried to improve her business by renovating the shop to make it look neat and new so people will want to buy from her. Through her loans she has improved and developed many things in her home.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory for her shop

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en: Aflatun A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 46 years old, married and has one son. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He has applied for a loan of $1100, so he can repair his taxi.

loans.use: To repair taxi

loans.name: Mwashabani

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Mwashabani M.. She is married with four children, who are between 22 and 30 years old, and she has one other dependent, her niece. In 2007, Mwashabani established a poultry business, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional chickens to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku.
