You may ask, "who or what are 'kuku'"? Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital, so you can start with one or two and either add to them as the business grows or wait until they multiple naturally! Second, they require little space. Third, they produce eggs when they grow, and the eggs can either be sold (to provide additional income) or eaten (to provide a supplementary source of protein).

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem C., 36, is the mother of three children and works as a tailor. She earns around $1 a day of profit. Her husband owns a plot of farmland growing rice and makes around $1 a day of profit as well. All three of their children are students.

She has requested this loan so that she can begin to raise pigs and earn extra income.

loans.use: To purcahse and raise pigs

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime lives on Killman Street in the Obispo Indaburo neighborhood of La Paz. He lives with his wife, who sells candy at the entrance of a school in their neighborhood, and they have three children. He works repairing and painting cars in his shop which is located beside his home. The loan will be used to buy materials at wholesale prices (paint, parts, etc.) and thereby reduce his expenses. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation of his business qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Jaime vive en la calle Killman de la zona Obispo Indaburo ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa, quien vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio de la zona, tienen tres hijos. Trabaja en el arreglo y pintado de vehículos en su taller que se encuentra en la parte lateral de la casa donde vive. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de trabajo al por mayor (pinturas, repuestos, etc) y así reducir sus gastos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy paint and parts for his car paint and repair shop

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret E. owns a cold storage facility for which she buys fish in large quantities to resell. She is a single parent of three children.

Business is doing very well and she wishes to increase sales to improve her income. A loan will allow her to purchase additional quantities of fish for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for resale

loans.name: Vaney

texts.en:
Mrs. Vaney N. is a subsistence farmer in Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province Cambodia. In her plantation business, Mrs. Vaney N. faces a small obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy a new cow. She needs a second cow to work with her current cow as a draft animal. Thus, Mrs. Vaney N. asked for a loan to buy a cow. Her husband, Mr. Seam Sorn, is a farmer and laborer.

Mrs. Vaney N. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Previously, Mrs. Vaney N. obtained a loan to buy a pig for breeding. Last year, her child got dengue fever and she spent $75 to have her cured. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to work as a draft animal.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita B. lives in Koteshwor, Nepal one of the very busy cities located in the Kathmandu district. She has two daughters and one son. Her daughters got married and live separately and her son is studying in the  BBS level. Most of the people in this region are engaged in their own businesses. Sita  and her husband  Shankar opened their bag manufacturing factory 5 years ago. They manufacture different varieties of bags like school bags, ladies bags and so on. They have a few workers in their factory. They supply the bags to the bag shops in the market at the wholesale rate. 
Now Sita is requesting a loan for $375 to buy different types of raw material which are required for their work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for their business

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura H. is a married Tanzanian woman. She runs a business selling charcoal at Buguruni just beside Dar es Salaam's city center. Charcoal is the main source of energy in Tanzania and the rest of developing countries. She purchases the charcoal bags from the nearby Mkuranga and Kisarawe Districts and sells them retail at Buguruni. Her business dream is to run an alternative business because charcoal destroys the environment. She needs a loan of $550 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Safia's Imani Group

texts.en:
Safia is 46 years old and she is divorced with 1 child aged 25 years old. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and porridge seller since 1998. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Safia now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem S., 47, lives with six of her eight children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has had a business selling rice since 2003 and is able to make $3 per day of profit, while her husband is a farmer and makes less than $1 per day to support the family. Chhem S. would like to ask for a loan of $300 to help increase the amount of rice she sells.

loans.use: To help increase her rice sales

loans.name: Radhia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Radhia I. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 9 and 23. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because they are orphans. Radhia has been running a mama lishe since 2000.

A mama lishe (local restaurant or café) in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

She works at the business 9 to 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $550 in order to expand her business by purchasing ingredients in bulk and making additional menu items. Radhia thanks you for her support!

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy maks a living selling kerosene and engine oil from her house. She is very happy with this arrangement because she does not have to pay rent for a shop. Joy is a 50-year-old widow with three children who lives in Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client, and has applied for a loan for two purposes: to buy more kerosene to sell to her customers, and to go into the business of selling them drinks as well. She says thank you to all the Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy drinks and kerosene to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es casada, su esposo es mecánico de maquinaria pesada en una compañía que fabrica plataformas marinas. Ellos son padres de 3 hijos adolescentes.
Ella inició el negocio porqué deseaba ganar dinero extra, ya que aunque tiene trabajo como enfermera, los ingresos familiares no eran suficientes para costear los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijas.
Empezó vendiendo productos cosméticos en su trabajo y con sus vecinas y como le empezó a ir bien decidió también vender productos de plástico para el hogar, ya que son muy solicitados por las amas de casa. Poco a poco ha ido progresando en su negocio por lo que hace 6 meses también se esta dedicando a la venta de ropa ya que se dio cuenta que también era un buen negocio y gracias a Dios ha tenido también buena aceptación entre mis clientes.
Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía que le  permitirá surtir pedidos de los productos de plástico para el hogar que le han hecho sus clientes además de comprar ropa para frío como suéteres, chamarras, cobertores, etc. para la temporada de invierno que se acerca.
texts.en:
Aurelia is married. Her husband is a heavy machinery mechanic at a factory that manufactures sea platforms. They have 3 teenage children. She started her business because she wanted some extra money, as even though she works as a nurse, family income was not enough to pay for the home expenses and her daughter’s school. She began selling cosmetics at work and her neighbors' but as the business started to grow she decided to sell plastic home items, as they are very popular among house wives. Little by little her business has been making progress. Six months ago, she decided to start selling clothes as she realized this could also be a great deal of business. Her clothes sales have had amazing acceptance among her customers. She needs a $375 loan that will be repaid bi-weekly, over 5 months to purchase merchandise to fulfill her plastic items requests and to purchase winter clothes, such as sweaters, ponchos, coats, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic home products

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Саидова Шарифа жительница района Рудаки. ивет со своей большой семьей. Около 1.5 года занимается шитьем , а так же вышивкой национальных платьев. Вышивки делаются из биссера , а так же из золотых и серебрянных нитей. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет развитию ее дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa S. and her large family live in Rudaki region. For the past 18 months she has been making a living by sewing and embroidering national costumes. For her embroidery, she uses beads and golden and silver threads. Sharifa would like to get a loan for buying more materials and expanding her business. She would be able to pay off her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Karen Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Karen es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos a su cuidado, posee estudios de superior completa (enfermería técnica).
 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, posee un negocio de tienda de abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (gaseosas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, el que pagará en 05 cuotas mensuales; le servirá para poder incrementar la capacidad de su tienda, es decir comprar más azúcar, arroz, golosina, leche, fideos, bebidas, etc. Todo al por mayor; con ello piensa obtener mejores ganancias las que piensa ahorrar para poder comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Ilave o Moquegua para sus hijos. 
 
Ella agradece de sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karen is a member of the “03 de Mayo” Community Bank in the Ilave District of the Collao Province in the Puno Region. She is 31 years old and lives with her two children and their father. She has completed a degree in higher education (vocational nursing).

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year. She has a grocery store. Her first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles with which she was able to buy stock for her store (soda).

She will payback this loan of 1500.00 nuevo soles in 5 monthly installments. It will help her to increase the capacity of her store, meaning buy more sugar, rice, candy, milk, pasta, drinks, etc. all wholesale. She hopes to make a better profit, which she plans on saving to buy a house for her children in the city of Ilave or Moquegua.

She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support of women.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods such as: sugar, rice, candy, milk, pasta, drinks, etc. all wholesale and improve her profits to save for buying a house for her children in Ilave or Moquegua.

loans.name: Isis De La Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Isis tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua sabana grande con dos hijos de 5 y10 años de edad, se dedica ala venta de cócteles el inicio con ayuda de su esposo, con esta solicitud de préstamo quiere comprar mariscos como conchas, camarones, punche y otros para fortalecer las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder poner un cafetín, poder hacer su casa de concreto ya que es de madera y un poco insegura, también poder dar educación a sus dos hijos para que sean personas estudiadas.
texts.en:
Isis is 33 years old. She lives with her two children, ages 5 and 10, in the Sabana Grande neighborhood in Managua. She sells seafood cocktails, a business she started with help from her husband. With this loan she wants to buy seafood like conch, shrimp, crab and more in order to strengthen her sales and increase her income. Her plan is to be able to open a food stand. She then wants to replace the wood structure of her house with concrete because it is not now very sturdy. She would also like to give an education to her two children so that they can be educated people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various seafood items for resale

loans.name: Delanila,

texts.es:
Delanila es una madre de familia joven y dedicada a su negocio. Desde hace dos años se encarga de atender en su propia tienda de abarrotes ubicada en un espacio de su casa. Antes manejaba un negocio de venta de medicina natural. Durante un año estuvo vendiendo diversos productos naturales, hasta que se mudo de vivienda.

No hace mucho que ella ha empezado a desenvolverse como microempresaria, antes dedicaba todo su tiempo al cuidado de su hogar y de sus hijos. Sin embargo, se animó a tener un negocio propio para poder contar con recursos propios también. Ella tiene planes de crecer con su tienda, hasta poder invertir en uno más grande.
texts.en:
Delanila is the mother of a young family and is dedicated to her business. Two years ago she opened her own grocery store located in her home. Before that she managed a business that sold natural medicine. She sold various natural products for one year until she moved to a different place. She has not been a small business owner for that long—she used to dedicate all of her time to caring for her home and her children. However, she was inspired to have her own business so that she could also have her own resources. She has plans to expand her store and even to invest in a larger store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell electronic equipment

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Mr. Ratana C., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Un, 42, were married in 1989 and have five children: two daughters who are still young and three sons. Two of their sons have full-time employment, another one is in college. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ratana and his wife are farmers and they were hired by the villagers to spin thread to earn extra income to support their family. The walls of their house are made from coconut leaf. It is difficult for them to live when the rainy season comes, so Ratana is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase zinc to make new walls for his house.

loans.use: To repair the walls of his house.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en el Jr. Santa Eufrasia Nº 559, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 57 años y es madre de 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lleva años ya dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, con la venta de pollos desviscerados.
Nos cuenta que anteriormente vendía solo en una mesita, balanza y sus pollos, y con su primer prestamo en Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, compro una paragua y una balanza moderna, para brindar mas confianza y mejor servicio a sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad. 

En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00,  comprara  pollos vivos en jabas, además parte del dinero lo invertirá implementando y mejorando su ambiente de trabajo.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien toma sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera.
Lili, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poner en práctica sus habilidades para el negocio y desarrollarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Lili belongs to the Fighting Women Cooperative Bank, and lives on Santa Eufrasia Street in the Tarapoto district of San Martín. She is single, 57 years old, and the mother of 5 children who now live on their own. She has dedicated herself to the sale of butchered chickens for many years now. She tells us that she previously sold her products with only a small table, a scale, and her chickens. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, she bought an umbrella and a modern scale. This allows her to provide better service to her local customers. She is currently continuing in the same type of business located in a rented stall at the Central Market. Here, she sells to the community members and homemakers. With this loan of 2,200 soles, she will buy live chickens in crates. Also, another part of the funds will be invested into implementation and improvement of her workplace. Today, she feels more independent and secure, as she makes her own decisions about her business and the income she generates. Lili expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to put her abilities into practice for the business and to grow as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying chickens in crates.

loans.name: Yabana

texts.en: Yabana G. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to help her to open a bakery.  Yabana is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Sancha

texts.en:
Sancha M. B. owns the only medium-sized shop in her village and she stocks everything imaginable, from rice to running shoes to the red bangles worn by many of the women in Nepal.

Sancha is applying for a Kiva loan of Rs. 10,000 that she will use to purchase more items for her shop. Sancha says that she particularly needs to buy comfortable, affordable sandal-style shoes and more rice, as these are the most popular items in her shop.

Sancha has two daughters, one son and a husband, all of whom help her out in the shop. Sancha says that she and her husband make all of their business decisions together, including the decision to take out a Kiva loan.

In the future Sancha hopes that she can continue to expand her business and begin supplying stock to smaller shops in the area. She would like to be able to provide her children with a very good quality education so that they can pursue whichever career they think will make them happy.

loans.use: more stock for the grocery store including shoes and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow maize

loans.name: Marcela Ramona

texts.es: Marcela Ramona P. tiene 41 años de edad. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la crianza de cerdos. Es casada con 4 hijos a su cargo los niños estudian todavía gracias al esfuerzo de la Señora Marcela. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente el lugar donde ella laboraba no le proporcionaba los ingresos necesarios para ofrecerles a sus hijos el pan de cada día.  Por lo que con esta humilde actividad ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos El mayor desafío que ha tenido es el accidente que uno de sus hijos por lo que ha tenido que gastar demasiado en medicamentos pero a pesar de todo ha sabido sobrellevar sus problemas. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de alimentos para cerdos y compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Marcela is 41 years old. She has a small business that consists of raising pigs. She is married with 4 children in her care. They still study thanks to Marcela’s effort.

For more than 5 years she has been engaged in this business. Previously, the place where she worked did not give her the income necessary to offer bread to her children each day. That’s why, with this humble activity, she has succeeded in getting ahead with her children.

The greatest challenge she has had is the accident of one of her children. She has to spend too much for medicine, but in spite of everything she knows how to endure her problems. The reason for this financing is working capital for the purchase of pigs and feed for pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, wheat flour, salt, cooking oil, soap and rice in bulk

loans.name: Lauristela

texts.es: La señora Lauristela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 56 años.Su fuerza  y anhelo D. sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico D. su familia. DesD. su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,200.00, comprará sacos D. arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Lauristela, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Yabom's Group

texts.en: Yabom B. is 36 years old and has 3 children ages 13, 17, and 19.  She is married to a former sea farer who is now retired leaving her as the sole bread winner for her family.  Yabom owns a general store which sells palm oil, beans, rice, and other food products.  Yabom built her business progressively over 18 years of hard work. Today, in addition to selling to local clients in Dove Court, Yabom has secured a contract to supply food to the military.  She believes that her seriousness has enabled her to expand her store over the years.  Yabom plans to use this loan to restock and add to her inventory and hopes to be able to finance her eldest son's schooling should he gain entrance to the university.  This loan will be her first with the Association for Rural Development.

loans.use: To restock food for her store

loans.name: Thor

texts.en: Thor K. is 35 years old and resides with her husband and four children in the Takeo Province. She and her husband sell groceries in the village and are able to make about US $21 in revenue each day. This couple needs a loan of US $700 from CREDIT to diversify their products to meet their clients' demands.

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Brazil

texts.en:
Brazil U. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Brazil owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling fruits like mangoes. Brazil has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Brazil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This is the first loan that Brazil has requested from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vegaspamba (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vegaspamba se formó  en la ciudad de Cuenca  en la comunidad del mismo nombre,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura principalmente  de maíz y hortalizas; este es un lugar muy famoso por sus coloridas fiestas, la música tradicional y costumbres como el palo encebado entre otras y los fuegos  artificiales son atractivos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Los integrantes de este banco son en su mayoría familiares que se agruparon para buscar nuevas alternativas de producción y generar ingresos económicos para sus familias y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida.

La señora  Flor F. D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, ella  vive en la parroquia de San Joaquín a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad se separó de su esposo hace cuatro años por la incomprensión y falta de comunicación con su cónyuge, es madre de siete hijos de: 17, 12, 10, 9, 8, 6, 3 años, su primera hija trabaja como empleada domestica y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa,  sus otros hijos son estudiantes de primaria y secundaria, solo su hijo de nueve años vive con su abuela en la comunidad Vegaspamba, su casa es propia construida sólo de tablas y hojas de zinc.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura, siembra toda clase de  verduras que luego las vende en la feria libre o en los mercados de Cuenca,  esta actividad la vienen realizando por muchos años hereda de sus padres, sus laborares empiezan a las 4 de la mañana  todos los miércoles y sábado que son días de feria

Este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con la institución y nos asegura que los créditos recibidos han invertido en la compra de semillas para sus cultivos y también ha recibido educación de cómo ahorrar; con el nuevo préstamo solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR va  a comprar semillas de otras legumbres de ciclo rápido como lechuga, tomate, acelga, zanahoria,brócoli, etc.  y para la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos.

Su meta es incrementar sus cultivos y mejorar su situación económica para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

La señora Rosa D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre, tiene 57 años de edad, se encuentra separada hace 18 años que su  esposo la abandono con sus seis hijos, todos quienes ellos son  casados, su casa es propia fruto del duro trabajo de su juventud ahí vive con su  nieto que estudia en la  escuela de Vegaspamba, siendo única compañía.

Rosa se dedica a la artesanía teje chompas, y  hace seis años comenzó a tejer sogas y fueron sus compañeras de la comunidad quienes le enseñaron y ahora ella enseña a otras mujeres para que monten este tipo de negocio  en la comunidad, siendo el material principal los sacos de nylon.

Este es  su  cuarto ciclo trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación entrega y con ellos ha logrado mantener sus negocios y  nos comenta que le han ayudado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de sacos para su negocio y un poco para la comida de su hogar.

Su sueño es de tratar de estabilizarse económicamente.
texts.en:
The Vegaspamba Communal Bank was established in the community of the same name within the city of Cuenca. The residents engage in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of corn and vegetables. The area is well-known for its colorful festivals, traditional music, local customs (such as climbing the grease pole), fireworks, and numerous attractions that bring in domestic and foreign tourists. The Communal Bank consists of members who are related to one another. They are looking for new ways to be productive and generate income so that their families can have a better quality of life.

Sra. Flor F. D. is a member of the Vegaspamba Communal Bank. She lives in the San Joaquin Parrish located on the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 32 years old and has been separated from her husband for four years as a result of misunderstandings and a lack of communication. Flor is the mother of seven children ranging in age from 3 to 17. Her oldest daughter works as a housekeeper in order to help with the household expenses. The other children are students in either elementary or secondary school. Only her nine year old son lives with his grandmother in the community of Vegaspamba. Flor’s house is made only of boards and sheets of zinc.

Flor is engaged in agriculture, planting all types of vegetables so that she can sell them at the open fair or in the markets of Cuenca. She has been farming for many years since she learned the trade from her parents. Her work begins every day at 4am. On Wednesdays and Saturdays, she travels to the fair.

This is her fourth cycle working with the Institution. She used her previous loans to purchase seeds for planting crops. Flor also received training on how to save money. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase seeds for growing lettuce, tomatoes, spinach, carrots, broccoli, and other vegetables. Part of the money will be used to buy school supplies for her children.

Her goal is to increase her crop output and improve her financial situation so that her children can have a better future.

Sra. Rosa D. is also a member of the Vegaspamba Communal Bank and lives in the community of the same name. She is 57 years old and has been separated for 18 years when her husband abandoned the family. Rosa has six children, all of whom are married. Her home is a result of all the hard work she has performed since she was a young woman. Rosa currently lives with her grandson, who attends school in Vegaspamba. He is the only person who provides her company.

Rosa produces handmade sweaters. She took up weaving six years ago when friends from the neighborhood taught her this skill. Rosa now instructs other women how to start this type of business in their own communities. The women she teaches produce mainly nylon bags.

Rosa is participating in her fourth cycle with the Foundation. She says that her previous loans were a great help because they enabled her to maintain her business. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase bags for her business and some food for household consumption.

Rosa hopes to remain financially stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their various business activities

loans.name: Revilla

texts.en:
Revilla C. is from the village of Tru-cut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Revilla is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Revilla owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bananas and other retail products in the local community. Revilla has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Revilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Revilla is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Revilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily consumption. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia V. is from the town of Turod Norte Cordon. She is 42 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Leticia owns and operates a general store. She sells a variety of different products in the local community. Leticia earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Leticia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle D. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Annabelle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Annabelle is just starting this business.

In 2009, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  vive en la zona Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia, tiene tres hijos de los cuales la esposa se dedica a la crianza.

El señor trabaja en una empresa minera ya hace 15 años de la ciudad de La Paz. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra material de construcción para refaccionar su casa.

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own house in the Villa Exaltación zone of the city of El Alto. He has three children, and his wife is dedicated to their care. For 15 years, Pedro has worked for a mining company of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for building materials (cement, sand, etc) to refurbish his house. This is Pedro’s fourth loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation has qualified him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials such as cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Edralina

texts.en:
Edralina M., 34, is ensuring that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Noe M., a businessman, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn an income so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her cosmetics direct selling business for quite some time now.

Edralina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital by buying equipment and expanding her business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock

loans.name: Nemicia

texts.es:
Nemicia, D. 60 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo Ángel (63), y D. sus 3 hijos D. 15, 14 y 5 años, en una zona alejada D. la sierra del Perú.

DesD. muy pequeña aprendió a cultivar la tierra, le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas. Ahora trabaja junto a su esposo sembrado maíz y papa, el trabajo le gusta mucho porque si bien es cierto que no pudo estudiar, sus padres la capacitaron muy bien en las labores D. campo para que nunca le falte nada; es por esta razón que quiere que sus hijos estudien y hace lo posible, con su esposo, para darles lo mejor. También se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino que, según cuenta, es un negocio seguro, ya que venD. sus animales mensualmente y obtiene buenas ganancias. Y como es una mujer muy empeñosa, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además D. comprar más cabezas D. ganado.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando para el bienestar D. su familia. Nemicia tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes para el mantenimiento D. sus tierras; también adquirirá  algunas cabezas D. ganado ovino.
texts.en:
Nemicia is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Ángel (age 63) and their three children (ages 15, 14, and 5) in a remote area in the mountains of Peru.

From a young age, Nemicia learned how to cultivate the land. She enjoyed helping her parents with their farming duties. Now she works with her husband growing corn and potatoes. Nemicia was not able to attend school, so her parents trained her very well to perform field labor so that she could still earn a living. For this reason, she and her husband want their children to pursue an education and proviD. them the best if at all possible. Nemicia also raises cattle and sheep. She says this is a safe business because she can sell her animals every month and generate a good income. Being an enterprising woman, she hopes to plant more crops as well as buy more livestock.

This is her second loan with MFP. Nemicia is very grateful to everyone who maD. it possible for her to access a loan so that she can continue providing for her family's welfare. She will use the money to purchase fertilizers for maintaining her land and also buy a few heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & sheep

loans.name: Ema Carolina

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Ema V. se dedica arduamente a la venta de cosméticos tales como perfumes, cremas, gelatinas, shampoo, colonias y otros más.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los cosméticos para continuar ofertándolos ya que se le han estado agotando pero ella no pierde las esperanzas que el crédito le será de mucho beneficio y así logrará mejorar las ventas de los cosméticos.
texts.en:
Ema V. works arduously selling cosmetics like perfumes, creams, gels, shampoos, colognes, and others in the Mayoreo Market in Managua. She is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying cosmetics in order to continue selling. She has been running out of cosmetics, but she does not give up hope. The loan will be very beneficial to her. That way she will be able to improve her cosmetics sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco G. G. es un señor de 39 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Francisco   se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la agricultura, especialmente se ha interesado en el engorde de cerdos para su venta, , ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a las ganancias que ha obtenido va a poder arreglar su ya que se encuentra en muy mal estado.

El  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢617000 (seiscientos diecisiete mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de cuido, Y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más cerdos es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo; pero dice que así podrá fortalecer más su proyecto para llegar  a ser un microempresario exitoso.

Don Francisco es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Francisco G. G. is a 39 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and child in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. The community is situated in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with specific emphasis on the cultivation of grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Don Francisco has been engaged in farming since a very young age. He has been especially interested in fattening pigs to sell so that he can generate income for his family. Don Francisco says he is very happy with the gains he has made because he will be able to renovate his house because it is in very bad condition. He wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 665,000 CRC to purchase more pigs and improve the conditions for raising them, thereby increasing his production. He know that having more pigs is a greater sacrifice and demands more work, but doing so will strengthen his business so that he can become a successful micro-entrepreneur. Don Francisco is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to grow more on a personal and financial level. He also says that he is thankful for these types of organizations and credit facilitators who dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & rebuild a pig pen

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
Julia Angélica Q. tiene 33 años y es soltera tiene su  propio negocio de trenzado de mantas (macramé) hace dos años aproximadamente, ella tiene su pequeño taller en la zona Alto lima calle Eduardo Avaroa y entrega sus productos a diferentes tiendas. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar lana y tela de mantas.
Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Sorpresa tienen variados negocios como la venta de ropa para bebe, tejido de diversas prendas de vestir, confección de polleras (falda para mujer andina), venta de comida, producción de muebles (carpintería), transcripción de documentos y elaboración de pelucas para moreno (danza andina)
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o capital fijo. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Alto Lima.
texts.en:
Julia Angélica is 33 years old and single. She has had her own her own business that manufactures macramé blankets for the past two years. She has a small workshop in the Alto Lima Calle Eduardo Avaroa zone and she delivers her merchandise to different stores. She needs this loan in order to buy yarn and fabric. The other members of Asociación Comunal Sorpresa have various businesses, such as baby clothing sales, different articles of clothing, manufacturing polleras (a type of skirt worn by Andean women), food sales, furniture manufacture, document transcription, wig making for Moreno (an Andean dance). They each need this loan in order to invest in merchandise, supplies, or to provide working capital. They meet in the central office in Alto Lima every two weeks.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mamadjanova Zebikan Group

texts.ru:
Зебикан, 35, замужем. Супруг занимается представлением услуг на тракторе, занимается обработкой земли, зарабатывает $120 в месяц. У нее 4 детей: дочерям 12 и 10, сыну 7 и 5 лет. Клиент в астоящее время занимается сельским хозйством, выращиваением картофеля. Она на кредит планирует закупить минеральные удобрения для картофеля.

Жамилахан, 56, замужем. У нее двое сыновей. Старший сын строитель, заработок $120, младший сын член крестьянского хозяйства, невестка работает в школе Кебекбаева преподавателем. Ее супруг также член крестьянского хозяйства. Жамилахан активно занимается полеводством. На 0,91 га земли посадили картофель для реализации. На кредит планирует закупить удобрения для картофеля.

Замире 33 года. Ее супруг работает водителем. Она активно занимается откормом и разведением КРС. На кредит планирует закупить теленка для откорма и разведения.

Тургунали, 29. Он вместе с супругой занимается растениеводством. В этом году на земельном наделе посадили картофель. На кредит планирует закупить мин. удобрения для картофеля и для фруктового сада.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zebikan, 35, is married. Her husband makes $120 a month cultivating land with his tractor. Zebikan has 4 children: two daughters--12 and 10 and two sons--7 and 5. Zebikan grows potatoes. She will use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizer. Jamilahan, 56, is married. Her husband is a member of collective farm. Jamilahan has 2 children. Jamilahan's older son is a construction worker making $120 a month and her younger son is a member of collective farm. Jamilahan's daughter-in-law is a school teacher. On her 0.91 hectare (2.25 acre) parcel of land, Jamilahan grows potatoes she sells. Jamilahan will use this loan to purchase fertilizer. Zamira, 33, is married. Her husband is a driver. Zamira is a cattle farmer. She plans to use this loan to purchase a calf. Turgunali, 29, and his wife grow potatoes. They plan to use this loan to purchase fertilizer for their potato field and orchard.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es un hombre muy responsable y luchador pues siempre está al pendiente de surtir su pulpería. Pues ya tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, por lo que ha mejorado poco a poco. Y este negocio surge como una alternativa para sufragar sus ingresos para su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y galletas.
texts.en:
Abel is a responsible and tenacious man; he's always watching over his grocery store. He has been in this humble line of work for over 19 years and has worked with the Fundación for a long time; his business has been gradually improving. This business arose as an alternative way to earn funds to cover household expenses. He will use the funds to buy basic grains, detergents, sweets, natural beverages, bread and cookies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 26 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tienen sus dos hijas, Deysi y Yenifer de 8 y 4 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, donde tienen su propia casa. De niña vendía panes a sus vecinas de su comunidad, pese a que sus padres tenían sus propios ingresos por medio de la venta de cacao, éste no le rendía lo suficiente hasta que la familia quebró económicamente. Desde entonces y para salir adelante, Sarita empezó a trabajar las tierras que sus padres le dejaron, con el paso del tiempo pudo ahorrar lo suficiente. Hoy tiene su pequeña bodega, en donde cuenta con fieles clientes, dándole ventaja en el incremento de sus ganancias, aunado además al servicio que ella ofrece y lo productos de calidad que posee. Su prioridad, es el amor que tiene hacia sus hijas, es por eso y con la ayuda de su pareja se repartirán el trabajo, donde él se dedicará a la agricultura, mientras Sarita a su bodega, de esa manera podrá ofrecerles lo necesario a sus hijos. Su rutina diaria es desde las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, en donde su bodega se encuentra localizada en su misma casa de su propia comunidad. En el futuro espera poder ampliar su bodega con la finalidad de poder captar mayor clientela. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete seguir cumpliendo con sus compromisos de pagos durante las fechas establecidas, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la responsabilidad que tienen cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de una cantidad considerable de mercadería, para que así pueda abastecer su negocio y por ende poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes potenciales.
texts.en:
Sarita is 26 years old. She lives with her spouse and they have two daughters, Deysi and Yenifer who are 8 and 4, respectively. They live together in the lovely Cuzco jungle, located in the comunity of Sirenachayocc, where they have their own home. As a girl, she sold bread to her neighbors in the community, despite the fact that her parents had their own income from selling cacao. This dodn't produce enough income, so the family went financially bankrupt. Since then, to get ahead, Sarita began to work the land that her parents left her, and with time she was able to save enough. Today she has a little store with faithful customers. Combined with the service she offers and the quality of her products, this gives her an advantage by increasing her earnings. Her priority is the love she has for her daughters. That is why, with her spouse' help, they share the work. He works in agriculture and she works in her store. This way, they can offer their daughters whatever they need. Her daily routine is from 5:30 in the morning until 10:00 at night. Her store is located at her house in her own community. In the future, she hopes to expand her store to attract more customers. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to keep making the payments on the established dates. She is also grateful to her community group for the responsiblility that each member has. She plans on investing the loan in buying a considerable amount of merchandise so she can supply her business and satisfy her potential customer's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R., 61 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 2 adult children. Her business is hog-raising. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a hectare of rice field that her husband mostly manages. They sell their harvest to people in their community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for more than three years now.

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & also farm supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Francisca from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & also farm supplies

loans.name: Leonsa

texts.en: Leonsa A. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old and is married with three adult children. Leonsa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different kinds of vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Leonsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonsa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 9th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Carla Hermelinda

texts.pt:
Carla hermelinda Z. , nasceu num dos bairros prefericos da cidade capital  Maputo,onde concluiu o seu ensino medio
Com o crescimento do seu agregado familiar teve a necessidade de construir a sua propria casa.  Atravez do seu servico conheceu a hluvuku onde teve financiamento para iniciar a construcao da sua casa.
Com  o presente emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar materiais de construcao (cimento,portas ,ferros e tinta) para concluir a sua casa.
A sua vida vai melhorar com emprestimo pelo que vai ter uma casa condigna que lhe vai proporcionar o bem estar com a sua familia.
O seu sonho futuro e de construir um salao de beleza para para aumentar a renda familiar e vai recorrer a mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Carla Hermelinda was born in the suburbs of the capital, Maputo, where she finished high school. With the growth of her family she felt the need to build her own house. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her job and with Hluvuku she received the loan to start construction. With the current loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais, she intends to buy construction materials (cement, doors, iron and paint) to finish her house. Her life will be better with the loan since she will have a decent house and provide for her family's well being. Her future is to build a beauty salon to increase her family's income. She plans to request more loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, doors, iron and paint)

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina vive en la ciudad de la paz; es viuda, tiene tres hijos pero todos son casados, vive sola y la actividad que tiene es la venta de carne de vaca y de cordero con esta actividad ella se mantiene y aunque ya es mayor de edad sigue muy activa, ya saco 5 créditos en Impro y fue parte de Kiva en una oportunidad; está satisfecha por la tasa de interés y los plazos otorgados.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de carne en mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Se sugiere dar otro crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina lives in the city of La Paz. She has three children, but they are all married and she lives alone. Her business activity is the sale of beef and lamb. With this activity, she supports herself, and even though she is older, she continues being very active. She has already had five loans from Impro and one was a Kiva loan. She is satisfied with the interest rate and the terms offered. The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of meat in larger quantities to satisfy the demands of her customers. It is suggested that she be given another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef and lamb for subsequent sale to the public

loans.name: Gladys Rosita

texts.es:
Rosita es conviviente, no tiene hijos y vive en casa alquilada, Rosita tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Rosita vende salchipollos por las noches en la puerta de su tienda.
Rosita es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche.
Los sueños de Rosita son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosita lives in a rented house with her partner. She doesn't have any children. Rosita has a stO. where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats and drinks every day. In addition, she sells salchipollos (a traditional dish with fried, shredded chicken, fried potatoes and sausage) at night from the door of her stO.. Rosita is a member of the communal bank Delfín and is requesting a loan for 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to buy rice, sugar and milk. She dreams of expanding her business and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and milk for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has 20 years of experience working as a hairdresser. In 1995, he opened a barber shop in his town. Over the years, he has been able to gain a good number of clients and he is thankful for his business income. 

He took advantage of a first loan from Kiva, and he was a very reliable client with his repayments. Today, he is asking for a second loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his tools and purchase a new hairdressing machine in order to expand his business.

In the future, he hopes to open another barber shop branch and extend his business into other areas.

loans.use: To renew his tools and purchase a new hairdressing machine

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: To make a living, Genelita J. runs a grocery store. She is 60 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao. Genelita has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Genelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Genelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Genelita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of the business

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
YEREDON est un groupe de l’Association Soro Yiriwaton du village de Chien Kamakan. Il regroupe 10 femmes dont la présidente est FATOUMATA D.. Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, sont. mariées et mères d’au moins 6  enfants.  Elles mènent différentes activités  telles la  vente de riz, de condiments alimentaires etc. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Chien Kamakan dans l’ex-arrondissement de Yangasso, préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). Elles ont commencé leurs activités à bas âge auprès de leurs parents et sont très appréciées et  sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. 
FATOUMATA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  300 kg de riz au marché de Bla  en vu de le revendre à  la foire hebdomadaire du village en détail et au comptant aux consommateurs. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
NB : ALIMA  D. est absente de la photo pour raison de maladie.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group in the Soro Yiriwaton Association of the village of Chien Kamakan.  There are ten women in the group, whose president is Fatoumata D..  These women know one another through parental and neighborly ties.  They are, on average, 40 years old, married and the mothers of at least 6 children.  They run different businesses such as the sale of rice, condiments, etc.  They live in large traditional families in Chien Kamakan in the ex-neighborhood of Yangasso, in the SAN prefecture (in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali).  They started their business at a young age along side of their parents, and are very appreciated and sought-after in their businesses.  With the goal of meeting the growing needs of their customer base, the group has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, with whom they are on their first loan.  

Fatoumata D. expects to use her loan to buy 300 kg of rice at the Bla market in order to resell it at retail and for cash at the weekly village fair to consumers.  She hopes to make a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

NB: Alima D. is absent from the photo due to illness.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday L. is currently in the business of selling simsim, groundnut paste and beans.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans to sell.  Monday is 22 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children, one of whom goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan;   él tiene  34 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba de forma independiente, el trabaja en la ruta de Cusco Machupicchu como porteador, el socio se dedica al traslado de equipaje y equipo de camping de turistas, el socio trabaja para una agencia de viajes y va por temporadas largas a la ruta. El socio necesita el préstamo para construir su vivienda, el socio también comprara algunos animales menores para la crianza y su conyugue se encargara de administra. El socio solicita el préstamo para compra materiales de construcción y para la compra de animales menores.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the “PACHA ILLAIRY” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Ocongate, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco.

Juan is 34 years old.  He lives with his partner and 3 children.  He was born in Ocongate.  He used to work independently.  He works as a porter on the Cusco Machupicchu route.  He transports tourists' luggage and camping equipment.  He works for a travel agency and spends long periods of time on the route.  He needs this loan to build his house.  He will also buy some young animals to raise and his partner will take charge of running the business.  He is requesting this loan to buy building materials and to buy young animals.

He is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy building materials and young animals

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano es un padre de familia de 56 años que reside junto a su esposa y aun hijo en el sector La Clake, una zona rural del distrito de Reque, ubicado a más de quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos, el cría cerdos cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona a menudo, eventualmente los vende sacrificados a sus vecinos. Esta es su fuente mas importante de ingresos por lo que siempre trata de sacarla delante.

Luciano desea adquirir más cerdos y alimento balaceado para percibir mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Luciano is a 56-year-old father who lives with his wife and one child in the La Clake area, a rural zone of the district of Reque, located more than 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

His work is raising and selling pigs. He raises pigs near his home, and when they have reached a good stage of development, he offers them for sale to the commercial buyers who visit the area on a regular basis. Sometimes he butchers them and sells them to his neighbors. This is his most important source of income, and for this reason he is always trying to improve his business. 

Luciano would like to acquire more pigs and balanced animal feed so that he can earn a better income and improve his quality of life. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles, which will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: Buying pigs and animal feed to expand his business

loans.name: Milagros De Mozoquilpan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Milagros de Mozoquilpan, porque todas las integrantes viven en esta comunidad. Está ubicado en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  11  integrantes.La señora Gregoria S. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 56 años,es casada,  no tiene estudios, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos ( 2 mujeres y 2 varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes   (tienda) que inicio hace 1 año con el esfuerzo de 9 años de ahorro de las ganancias de la venta de tortillas hechas a mano, con lo cual ha podido darle estudios a nivel profesional a dos de sus hijos.Ella comenta que gracias a que cuenta con el apoyo de créditos ha podido invertir en la compra de  mercancía de su tienda y con las ganacias ha podido ahorrar para la construcción de  su propio local  y quiere poder hacer un ahorro para su vejez porque ella piensa asi ser más independiente y no darle muchas molestias a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Milagros de Mozoquilpan' (Mozoquilpan Miracles) because all its members live in Mozoquilpan which is located in the State of Mexico. The group has 11 members.

Gregoria S. is the group's president.  She is 56 years old, married, and didn't attend school.  She is a saleswoman and has 4 children (2 daughters and 2 sons).  Gregoria has a grocery store which she set up one year ago with 9 years' worth of savings which she had managed to put aside from the profits she'd made selling hand-made tortillas.  This business also allowed her to provide two of her children with professional-level studies.  She comments that thanks to the fact that she has the support of loans, she has been able to invest in buying merchandise for her store and, with the profits, she has been able to save up to build her own premises.  She would now like to be able to save for her old age because she plans to be independent and not have to bother her children.

loans.use: To invest in her business and save for her old age

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise M. W. is a married to a teacher.  She has three children between sixteen and nine years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kitengela.  It is known as Gatanga Race. She is served by the Kitengela Branch. 

Loise has a retail shop in which she sells general items, including milk, bread, tea leaves, sugar, detergents, cooking oil and other items.   She has run this business for the last one and half years. She serves the local people. She says that this business is profitable.  The major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business, that her customers are not loyal because they have many choices. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to own her own supermarket in the future. She describes herself as very aggressive.

loans.use: To buy sugar, detergents, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Bertha, La socia tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de artesanía. La socia se dedica a elaborar artesanái al por mayor y menor y los reparte por diferentes centros comerciales en la zona de Cusco. La socia realiza bellos trabajos y los hace con su familia los hijos de ella le ayudan a realizar los diferentes trabajos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de arcilla y realizar los trabajos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Minka communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Bertha is 48 years old, single, and has two children. She works buying and selling handicrafts. She makes wholesale and retail handicrafts and distributes them among the different shopping malls in the Cusco area. She makes beautiful crafts and does them with her family, as her children help her to make the different items. She is requesting the loan to purchase clay materials to make the crafts.

Bertha is happy for the loan granted and she promises to make her loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase clay materials to make the crafts

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto tiene 51 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdos. Anteriormente vendía gallinas, pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado adquirir experiencia pero decidió iniciar con el negocio de compra y venta de   cerdos, tiene ciertas personas que llegan a buscarlos para que Gilberto compre los cerdos. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para ellos.  Desea mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Gilberto is 51 years old and he buys and sells hogs.  He used to sell chickens, but over time he gained more experience and decided to begin buying and selling hogs.  People seek him out to sell hogs to him.  He will use the money from this loan to buy hogs and feed.  He wants to increase his income so that he can support his family.

loans.use: Hogs and feed

loans.name: Oyunbayar

texts.en: Oyunbayar, 26, is single and lives with her mother and younger brother in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  They have a decent standard of living and her younger brother attends a local secondary school.  They live in their own ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. She began her clothing trading business in 2007.  She sells clothing at an outdoor stall at a local market.  Oyunbayar is a hardworking and active person who has gained enough experience to operate a successful business.  She wants to expand her business and make more profit.  Oyunbayar is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai T., 38, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. sells fried bananas, earning an income of about $2.90 per day. Her husband went to Thailand to find a job. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $13 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase potato seeds to grow for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy potato seeds to grow for sale

loans.name: Yanis Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Yanis, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de 14 años que es su vida y a la cual cuida mucho, ella está en tercer año de colegio. Su marido es comerciante. Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos a podido aumentar su negocio.

Ella y su marido trabajan en la venta de frutas y legumbres, tienen un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en Manta, trabajan todos los días, el desde las 5am hasta las 16h00 y ella llega un poco más tarde luego que su hija se va al colegio y solo trabaja hasta el medio día ya que su hija requiere de muchos cuidados, su mercadería la compran a comerciantes mayoristas que venden en el mercado y ciertos productos los llevan desde Rocafuerte.
