Este crédito es para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando frutas y legumbres. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa y ver que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mujeres Organizadas" ["Organized Women"] Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte. It is a place known for the delicious sweets that locals prepare, which are known throughout the country.

This is where we find Ms. Yanis. She is 46 years old, married, and has one 14 year-old daughter who is her life. Her daughter is in her third year of high school and Yanis cares for her very much. Yanis' husband is a merchant. She is the founder of her communal bank and is very happy that, thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to expand her business.

She and her husband work selling fruits and vegetables. They have a stand in the Tarqui Market in Manta and work every day. He works from 5 AM until 4PM and she starts a little later, when her daughter leaves for school, and only works until midday so that she can take care of her daughter. They buy their merchandise from wholesale merchants that sell in the market and they bring some products from Rocafuerte.

This loan will be used to continue investing in their business of buying fruits and vegetables. Yanis' dreams are to have a store in her house and to see her daughter become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds and vegetables, as well as sacks of manure

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary was born in 1958. She is married and blessed with four children. She does tailoring in Kisii Village, which is a slum, hence most of the customers are low-income earners. She started operating the business three years ago with one employee. She hopes to makes clothes for wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is 62 years old, widowed and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Ceferina has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell. Ceferina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José R. A., tiene la edad de 28 años, está en unión libre  y vive con su 1 hijo y su señora que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende comprar los insumos necesarios para su cultivo y pagar la mano de obra de la siembra del cultivo. El cuenta con la experiencia y manejo de este cultivo por lo cual invertirá en el. El quiere generar ganancias para mejorar su nivel de vida y seguir invirtiendo para seguir aumentando la producción los próximos años  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José R. A. is 28 years old and in a common-law marriage. His wife and son are his top priorities. José intends to buy the necessary supplies for cultivating his crop as well as pay for labor. He has experience in managing his crops, so this is the reason why he wants to invest. With the earnings he will generate, José wants to improve his living standards and continue investing so that he can increase production in the years to come.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. José has not had any previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting beans and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Boumoutou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de  pâte arachide, de savon, de gâteaux et de galettes.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, des savons, de la farine de blé et du mil.                                                                   
AMI compte acheter de l’arachide avec les revendeurs du village, qui sera transformé en pâte d’arachide, qu’elle revendra au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Yeredeme are all married, and they average 28 years of age and four children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Boumoutou, sub-prefecture of Fana; Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in peanut butter, soap, cakes, and pancakes.

The group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy peanuts, soaps, wheat flour, and some millet.

AMI intends to use her loan to buy peanuts from the retailers in the village. She will process them into peanut butter. Accepting cash or credit, she will sell her product in the village to a customer base composed mostly of women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to contribute to societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her commerce.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 27 years old and married with two children, ages 8 months and 3 years. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last two years in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans, which are all sold locally. He is also a mechanic and provides motorcycle repair services to the local market. 

James has requested a loan of 51,600 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to buy chickens. He says that with the extra income from this loan his family will be able to afford a comfortable life. His main challenges have been fluctuations in the market prices of farm products, lack of animal feeds and diseases which affect his production. James hopes to venture into zero grazing and also acquire high yield dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal, en este momento tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas en las afueras de un colegio, donde trabaja solo por las mañanas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 bolsas de taps, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 1 bolsa de juguetes con grajeas, 1/2 ciento de calcomanía, 1 bolsa de chicle, 2 cajas de galletas, 3 tiras de chizitos, 2 tiras de maní confitado, 2 paquetes de frugos, 1 paquete de gaseosa, 1 paquete de agua.
Debido a que su principal clientela son niños, debe tener mucha variedad de golosinas.  Este negoico es relativamente nuevo pero le trae buenas ganancias y además es de medio tiempo.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido educar a sus hijos, porque ella sola tiene que criarlos y solventar los gastos del colegio, ahora solo tiene dos de ellos a su cargo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of the Year 2000) communal bank in the district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali department. She is 48 years old and the single mother of 3 children. She is also one of the founders of her communal bank. At present, she has a tiny business selling snacks outside a school, where she works mornings only.

With her new loan of 3,000 new sols, Maria will purchase 2 bags of taps, 2 bags of caramels, 1 bag of toys with small candies, half a hundred of decals, 1 box of chewing gum, 2 boxes of cookies, 3 strips of cheese puffs, 2 strips of crystallized peanuts, 2 packages of fruit drinks, 1 case of soft drinks, and 1 case of bottled water.

Since her principal customers are children, she needs to have a greater variety of snacks. This business is relatively new but it attracts good earnings and it is part time.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Maria has been able to educate her children. She alone has had to raise them and cover school costs. Now, she only has 2 in her charge.

loans.use: buy snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Lowella

texts.en:
Lowella  is married with 5 school aged children.  Lowella  is 32 years old and lives in  Sagbayan Dangcagan Bukidnon.
 
Lowella  sells entertainment services offering video karaoke to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year.  Each month she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She  has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional units of video karaoke to generate additional income.
Lowella started being a member of HSPFI this year.  In the future, Lowella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional units of video karaoke for entertainment

loans.name: A Florence

texts.fr: Florence est mariée et a à charge 3 enfants. Elle vit en location avec sa petite famille. Elle est aidée au foyer par son mari. Florence commercialise des chaussures de tout genre qu'elle étale aux abords de la voie dans l'enceinte du marché Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Elle fait ses ventes en gros et en détails aux usagers du marché. Florence fait ses approvisionnements au Togo, un pays frontalier au Bénin et les stock dans un magasin dans ledit marché. Elle est à son 7ème crédit à FINADEV et sollicite un renouvellement pour faire des approvisionnement. Une partie du revenu supplémentaire généré par cet appui financier sera réinvesti dans son commerce et l'autre lui permettra de faire face à ses charges personnelles et financières. Elle souhaiterait avoir d'autres variétés de chaussures afin de pouvoir faire face à la concurrence.
texts.en: Florence is married and has three children in her care. She rents a place to live with her small family. Her husband helps her in the household. Florence sells shoes of all types, which she displays near the road within the walls of the Tokpa market, the international market in Benin. She makes her sales in bulk and at retail to the market users. Florence gets her supplies in Togo, a country bordering Benin, and stocks them in a shop in the market. She is on her 7th loan with FINADEV and is seeking a renewal to obtain supplies. One portion of the additional income generated through this financial support will be reinvested in her business, and the remainder will allow her to provide for her personal and financial needs. She would like to have additional varieties of shoes in order to be competitive.

loans.use: To buy 35 dozen pairs of shoes of various kinds.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Eleonor, a 26-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she raises and sells pigs, an enterprise she has operated for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. In the future, Eleonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Maiminatou

texts.fr:
Maiminatou Afi est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et son conjoint est sérigraphe. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Maiminatou Afi travaille comme revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques depuis 2001. Elle vend seule à tous ceux qui sont dans le besoin. 
Elle achète les produits à Lomé et à l’extérieur.
Maiminatou Afi a requis son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des médicaments.
texts.en: Maiminatou Afi is a 33 year old woman and mother of two children living in Togo. Her husband works in the silkscreening industry. She has been selling pharmaceutical products since 2001, taking care only to sell to those with a real need for the medicine. She purchases her products in Lomé. She is asking for a secon loan from WAGES in order to purchase a greater stock of medicines.

loans.use: Purchase pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Sasine

texts.en:
Sasine is aged 26, single, and supports his parents. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He knew KADET through a registered client.  He is applying for his second loan which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. 

With the anticipated profit made, Sasine will use to purchase sheep for fattening.  He dreams that at the age of thirty five he will have a stable family life.

loans.use: purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatoulaye habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 42 ans. Elle s’adonne depuis
 Plus de 10 ans au  commerce de produits artistiques tels colliers, bracelets, boucles d’oreilles, etc.  Elle a ciblé une zone touristique pour y mener son activité. La confection, l’échange avec les touristes, la présentation des différents  produits a la clientèle  et les bénéfices réalisés sont les différentes  étapes de son activité qui l’intéressent  le plus. Elle  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2005. Elle n’y a jamais contracté de prêt. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’acquisition de nouveaux produits. Elle souhaite s’approvisionner par le biais de sa sœur associée qui va assister a une foire au Maroc.
texts.en:
Ms. Ramatoulaye lives in Senegal. She is 42 years old and has been devoting herself for over ten years to commerce in arts and crafts, such as necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc. She targeted a tourist area as a place to operate her business. The various stages of her business that interest her the most include making the art and craft items, the interacting with tourists, and presenting the various items. 

She has been a member of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since October 2005. She has never taken out a loan there. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for acquiring new items. She wishes to stock up via her sister, a business partner, who is going to attend a bazaar in Morocco.

loans.use: to buy art and craft items to resell

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is a 49-year-old married man with three children: one son and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Minh City. His wife is a tailor. 

For the past six years, Tien has supported his family by running a general shop in front of his house. He sells a range of products from household items to personal use products. 

Tien would like to get a loan to buy new products such as many kinds of drinking water, beverages, and confectionery to sell in his store to better meet his customers' needs.

He hopes that he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: To buy new products (drinking water, beverages, confectionery) to sell in his general store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main dream is to build a good permanent house for his family and educate his children. Robert operates a bar, a business he has operated for two years. His major challenge is the high cost of electricity and his dream is to set up a modern hotel. Robert needs a loan to buy crates of beer and sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Chimed

texts.en: Chimed is a 37 years old and lives with his wife and 4 kids in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He is a professional plumber and he does it part time. His wife helps with his clothing trading business.  Two kids are in school and 2 others are in day care. He started his business in 2005 by renting a counter in a market to sell garments. He is very well known for his stylish and high-quality clothes. He is a capable and diligent man who says "I love what I do, I live a fulfilled life and I have a bright vision for my kids to graduate college " He is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to buy winter clothes and to increase his assets.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes

loans.name: Wazi Na Ukweri Group

texts.en: Fadina is in her late 30s, married and has four children, three of them go to school. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling food, working from 3 p.m. to midnight every day of the week. She is applying for her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her first loan to buy more of the supplies she needs to run her business and pay school fees, and repaid her loan fully and on time. She plans to use her second loan to buy more food items to sell.  Her dream is to one day open a new business selling clothes. She will share this loan with her loan group "Wazi na Ukweri," which has a total of 24 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is applying for another loan to start a new cafe business. She will use this 70,000 KES loan to purchase new sofas, plates and other items for the cafe. In the future, Jennifer hopes to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Jennifer has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase new sofas, plates and other items for the cafe.

loans.name: Bi

texts.en:
Bi is a 65-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. She has owned a general store for over three years. 

Bi would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Irnel

texts.en:
Jose Irnel is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion, Molave. He is married with three children.

Jose Irnel has a boarding house business to rent and earns approximately 18,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase materials for his boarding house renting business.

Jose Irnel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Jose Irnel hopes to earn more in his new boarding house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his boarding house renting business

loans.name: Judith Roxana

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene dos hijos, realizó estudio de educación superior.

Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Actualmente se dedica a la confección y venta de vestidos de novia, bautizo, primera comunión y otros.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará telas bordadas, americana y francés, para la fabricación de vestidos.  Realiza las compra en la ciudad de Lima. Judith trabaja junto con su esposo.

La señora desea tener su casa de novias donde pueda exhibir muchas más prendas y mejorar sus ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el compartir con las socias y las bromas entre ellas.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the "Brisas del Lago" ["Lake Breeze"] communal bank, located in the province and department of Puno. She is 36, lives with her partner, and has two children. She has a higher education.
Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her grocery business. She now works making and selling dresses for weddings, baptisms, first communions, and other events.
With this new loan of 3,000 nuevo soles, she will buy American and French embroidered fabrics for making dresses. She makes her purchases in the city of Lima. Judith works with her husband.
She wants to have a bridal shop where she will be able to display many garments and improve her sales.
What she most likes about her communal bank are the meetings; sharing with the members, and the little jokes that they make together.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of American and French embroidered fabrics.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children, aged 23 and 21. 
 
In 2001, she established her cow's milk selling business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and for methane production.  

The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Cefferino Gustavo

texts.es:
Cefferino Gustavo tiene 43 años es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Cefferino se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para 
invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  

Su sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo.En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cefferino Gustavo, 43, is married living with his wife and children.  He lives in Recinto Las Blancas in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “26 de Noviembre” communal bank is located in Recinto Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Cefferino is a corn, rice and pigeon pea farmer; he buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market.

He asked for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure like urea and insecticides that are commonly used for crops.  The loan has helped him increase family income and to invest in seeds and supplies.  His dream is to buy a car for work.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Fidelia, continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría gallinas, cuyes; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de animales menores como 20 cuyes y 10 pares de gallinas para la crianza, reproducción y venta.
texts.en: Fidelia continues with her business raising small farm animals; she raises chickens and guinea pigs.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of small farm animals like 20 guinea pigs and 10 pairs of chicks to raise, breed and sell.

loans.use: to buy 20 guinea pigs and 10 pairs of chicks to raise, breed and sell.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena operates a dairy farming business in Kapsabet. Her spouse helps in fending for the family too. This has been Philomena's income generating business for the last seven years. She earns an average monthly income of KES 42,000.

Philomena plans to use the loan of KES 73,000 to purchase animal feeds. Her dream is to educate her children and to set up a zero grazing unit as well as a bio-gas unit

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Noe Jonathan

texts.en: Noe is a chef with six years of experience. He studied gastronomy and culinary arts and his focus is in packaged foods, particularly pastries. Noe Jhonatan is asking for a loan to finish paying for a laminating machine that he acquired and also to pay salaries for his workers. He says that his biggest achievement is finishing college and being able to start a business in a field that he loves.

loans.use: to finish paying for a laminating machine and to pay salaries for his workers.

loans.name: Wikurie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Lucy. She is 41 years old and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the enterprise and financial management training in order to run her farming business well.

She does mixed farming of maize and beans. She is borrowing money to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to increase her production, hence increasing her income. This will improve her living standards and enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to increase her production, hence increasing her income.

loans.name: St. Denis Makondo Boarding School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julia. She is the Head teacher of St. Denis Makondo S. Boarding School, a mixed School in the rural area of Lwengo with 240 students. St. Denis Makondo Boarding School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Denis Makondo Boarding School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Julia ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: John

texts.en: JOHN B. is an O-level leaver, married with four children. Prior to his current venture, he used to perform clearing & forwarding of cargo trucks at the Kenya-Uganda border. He started his business from capital raised through friends and family in 2003. His first loan of $143 from PEMCI enabled him to move into a permanent location (shop) unlike before, when he was in a kiosk. With a second loan of $300, he plans to increase the stock of parts in his new shop. Mr B. is also involved in a network marketing of a Chinese health product TIASH, which supplements his income. He is a well respected member of the local community.

loans.use: To stock a Cycle-Mart

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
María is a single mom with a 16 year old daughter and a 15 year old son. She also takes care of her elderly mother. She started her business five years ago, sewing and selling costume jewelry. She chose this work because it allowed her to have a more flexible schedule, so she could spend more time with her mother and take better care of her children. Both of her children are studying and they help María in any way that they can.

Lately, María's has had more work as well as more demand for her products. This is why she needs a $275 loan; she'll use the money to buy more costume jewelry and material she needs to continue sewing. María would like to see her business grow, because this means a better support for her family and that her children will be able to finish their studies. She needs your support and is sincerely thankful to you for any help you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria es madre soltera de una hija de 16 años y un hijo de 15, además se hace cargo de su mamá que es una persona de edad avanzada. Desde hace cinco años se dedica al negocio de costura y a la venta de bisutería, por que esto lo podía realizar en horarios más flexibles, que le permitieran pasar más tiempo con su madre y atender mejor a sus hijos. Sus dos hijos están estudiando y colaboran con el negocio de Maria en lo que les es posible.

Últimamente para Maria el trabajo se ha incrementado, igual que la demanda por sus productos, por lo que requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía de bisutería y artículos que requiere para la costura. Maria tiene muchos deseos de crecer porque sabe que de esta manera podrá ayudar a su familia, y sus hijos podrán concluir sus estudios, es por eso que necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is single, and she doesn’t know exactly how old she is, because she doesn’t have any identification documents. She lives with her mother and both work at making blouses and embroidering them. They sell them to the women in their community. They also have some foodstuffs in their house that they sell to the customers that buy their blouses. They belong to the “Clouds Group 1”. They would like to use the loan to buy more fabric to make a larger quantity of blouses, and also embroidery thread. They would also like to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, salt, and cooking oil and have a small grocery store in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA ES SOLTERA Y SE DESCONOCE CON EXACTITUD LA EDAD QUE TIENE PORQUE NO POSEE DOCUMENTOS DE IDENTIFICACION, VIVE CON SU MAMA Y AMBAS TRABAJAN CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS ARTESANALES Y BORDANDOLAS PARA POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLAS ENTRE LAS MUJERES QUE PERTENECEN A SU COMUNIDAD. ADEMAS TIENEN EN SU CASA ALGUNAS MERCADERIAS COMESTIBLES LAS QUE OFRECEN ENTRE LAS CLIENTES QUE COMPRAN SUS ARTESANIAS.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 1 CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR MAYOR CANTIDAD DE BLUSAS Y TAMBIEN HILO PARA BORDAR , ADEMAS QUIEREN COMPRAR MERCADERIA COMO ARROZ, AZUCAR, SAL , ACEITE Y COLOCAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDITA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA .

loans.use: To buy embroidery thread and cloth and to buy merchandise for a small grocery store

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: A. Aslan is 67 years old. He is married and lives in the southern Azerbaijani town Imishli. Aslan has been runing a small food store for the past 15 years. His produce sells so fast that sometimes Aslan has to close the store already after lunch. His daily sales exceed his purchases. Yet, Aslan has 5 children and, to cover all their needs, the store's profit is not sufficient. To increase the revenue, Aslan plans to diversify the products he sells, and is therefore applying for a loan of US$1,200.

loans.use: Expansion of the variety of products sold at a store

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz E. is a local butcher in his northeastern Azerbaijani home town of Devechi. Firuz is married with two children and has been working as a butcher for the last 10 years. He has already successfully re-paid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit in the amount of $400. He is currently looking to receive funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can begin to build a new shop for his business.

loans.use: Firuz would like to begin construction on a new shop for his business.

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Amaka O. is 30 years old, married and has 3 children; she lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sews and also sells clothes. She has been in this business since 2000 and she is in needs of a loan of $400 to enable her buy more machines and tailoring material.

loans.use: To buy more machine & tailoring material for sale

loans.name: Faalai

texts.en: Faalai came from a family of twelve children. Faalai is number eight and she is married with two children. She has been running a popcorn business since before she joined SPBD. Faalai has had hard times in running her business. Faalai is one happy mother in Levili Tuvao Centre and she is planning to start another business so she can earn better income.

loans.use: Faalai would like to buy supplies and ingredients for her popcorn business.

loans.name: Kamuli B4 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been toegether for one year. Justine is 30 years old and married with three chiildren. She sells used clothes. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up a boutique.Betty and Robinah have bar businesses. Rehema owns a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Margret wants to use the loan to purchase more charcoal for sale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, to improve 2 bar businesses, to buy more beauty salon equipment and to buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin Adekunle is married and has four children. She is 40 years old and hails from Ijanikin, Lagos state, Nigeria. Toyin needs a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna N. is a resident of Tangal, Lalitpur, and lives with her husband and two sons. The Tangal area is a very busy shopping area of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses, especially famous for brass, copper, and bronze pots and utensils in different varieties. Mrs. N. is a shopkeeper in Tangal, and sells pots and utensils. Her two sons are studying in grade 12 and 11 respectively. Mrs. N., along with her husband, Om Bahadur N., opened their shop 6 years ago. They equally contribute their efforts in their shop because they have no other source of income, and their children also help them.

Mrs. N. is asking for her fifth loan to expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses, and hotpots, to meet the increasing demands of customers. They want to strengthen the economic conditions of their family by increasing their income.

loans.use: To buy items for her shop

loans.name: Carla  Vanesa

texts.es:
The business that Carla B. is involved with is the sale of natural soft drinks and sodas from her own store in the Somotillo neighborhood in the city of Chinandega. She is well-known in the area for making delicious soft drinks, which has brought her new customers who want to try them.

Currently she wants to diversify her beverages and offer greater quantities of soft drinks. In order to do this, she primarily needs to buy fruit to make the soft drinks. For this reason, she has asked Ceprodel to help her with a loan that would permit her to buy the raw materials to make and sell the beverages. Little by little, she will be able to diversity her soft drink business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Carla B. es a la venta de refrescos naturales y gaseosas en su propio establecimiento en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es muy reconocida en su sector por el hecho de que elaborar deliciosos refrescos el cual han atraído a nuevos clientes para consumirlos.

Actualmente, el anhelo de ella es diversificar sus bebidas ofreciendo mejores cantidades de refrescos. Para esto necesita primeramente adquirir las frutas para elaborar los refrescos. Por dicha situación es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para recibir el oportuno crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para luego comercializar las bebidas y así poco a poco ir diversificándose en su negocio de refresquería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa E. prepares a native food called ‘banku’, which is made from maize. It is very popular with the natives of her area. Mrs. E. is married and has 4 dependants. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales, but she is running out of ingredients.

She is asking for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for food production and sale

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi T., 34 years old, joined TYM since 2001. Her husband is a kind man who always help out his wife with the housework after coming home from work. He is currently working as a handyman, earning around 1.5 million VND per month. They already have 3 children, all going to school at the moment. Mrs. T. work as a tailor and all of her loans had been invested into this business. This cycle, she would like to borrow 10 million VND to invest into this shop. Her family monthly income is around 4 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Thủy 34 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001, chồng chị là người hiền lành chịu khó luôn giúp chị trong công việc gia đình khi có thời gia dỗi hiện tại anh đang làm công nhân thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Anh chị có 3 con các cháu đang trong độ tuổi ăn học, bản thân chị là người phụ nữ hiền lành chịu khó lại khéo tay nên chị đã chọn cho mình nghề may, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vào cửa hàng may, chị và anh đều có công việc ổn định nên điều kiện kinh tế gia đình tương đối ổn định, việc vay vốn của Quỹ với gia đình anh chị là rất phù hợp. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vốn vào hiệu may. Thu nhập bình quân: 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Tailor

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Born in about 1980 in Cotonou and married to Cyprien BODEHOUSSE, agent at the ‘les Cheminots’ pharmacy, Mrs. Jeannette H. is a mother with two children: Geoffroy, who is six years old and is in the first year of primary school (grade 1), and Abigaëlle who is three years old. She sells cookies, toothpaste and toothbrushes. She has been running this business for seven years and she lives with her husband in her parents’ house. She got to know our organization in 2007 when she had financial problems that were restricting her ability to purchase supplies. She received a total amount of 40,000 CFA Francs ($100) in her very first loan. Her business has grown considerably and her working capital has improved appreciably. For her third loan, she is requesting 100,000 CFA Francs ($250) to improve her business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1980 à Cotonou et mariée à BODEHOUSSE Cyprien, agent à la pharmacie les Cheminots, dame H. Jeannette est mère de deux enfants. Geoffroy, 6ans est au Cours élémentaire 1 et Abigaëlle âgée de trois ans. Elle vend les biscuits, les pâtes dentifrices et les brosses à dents. Elle exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et habite la maison de ses parents avec son mari. Elle fit la connaissance de notre institution en 2007 à un moment où elle avait quelques difficultés financières qui l'handicapaient dans son approvisionnement. Elle avait reçu comme montant de son tout premier prêt 40000F CFA. Son activité s’est beaucoup développée et son fonds de roulement a été sensiblement amélioré. Pour son troisième prêt, elle sollicite 100000F CFA pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use: To buy three boxes of cookies and three dozen boxes of toothpaste.

loans.name: Isabella Mgaya's Upendo Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
Isabella M., 42, is married with four children (ages 22, 18, 11, and 8). She has a general store which she started 4 years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $87.

Isabella has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to build a small house. She now hopes for a new loan to buy a big stock of rice from upcounty. Isabella will share this loan with her subgroup members with businesses selling cereals, vegetables, chicken feed, and also a food vendor.

In the photo Isabella is 1st on the left.

loans.use: To buy up a large stock of rice from upcountry

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar inició el negocio por que desde muy chico le gustaba hacer guisos y por necesidad se fue a laborar a Estados Unidos donde consiguió trabajo en un restaurante y hay fue adquiriendo experiencia y con el tiempo se decidió a regresar a su pueblo por que su esposa iba a tener su primera hija y no quería estar lejos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 4 años aunque de experiencia tiene mas años y ahora en la localidad labora también un restaurante por lo que de hay se ha dado a conocer para la elaboración de los banquetes ahora por su cuenta.

El necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir los ingredientes para la elaboración de un banquete de boda.
texts.en:
Oscar started the business because since he was a young boy he liked to cook dishes. By necessity, he went to work in the United States, where he obtained work in a restaurant and there he acquired experience. In time he decided to return to his hometown because his wife was going to have their first daughter and he did not want to be far away. He began approximately 4 years ago, although he has more years of experience and now in his town he also works for a restaurant where he has become known for preparing banquets, by his account.

He needs a loan of $150 US, that will be repaid in 3 months, to supply the ingredients for making the foods for a wedding reception.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for preparing food for a wedding reception

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
U. Sulton lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. After hearing many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan process, Mr. U. Sulton decided to ask for a loan for business development. He improved his existing situation. The business stability and income increase helped him repay the previous loans on time.

Mr. U. Sulton was engaged first in agricultural products and rice cultivation. But thanks to the previous loans he started a new business. Now he is engaged in the livestock business. He has two cows, one bull, and four rams. Mr. U. Sulton would like a KIVA loan for 2800 STJ for 5 months in order to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: pedigree bull purchasing.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy E. sells drinks. She buys the drinks from distributors in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is happy because the festive season is approaching and the demands for her drinks will increase. She is requesting the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is 58 years old and married with seven children. She and her family live in Benin City. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates drinks to sell

loans.name: San Felipe Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Felipe” esta representado por la señora Maura, en general los integrantes del grupos se dedican al comercio de prendas de vestir, cosméticos, masitas, abarrotes y algunos se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir y mascaras o caretas. Son gente responsable como lo demostraron en anteriores ciclos. Ellas saben que el trabajo en el mercado tiene mucha competencia pero tienen años de experiencia trabajando en el rubro y conocen la modalidad del mercado de la oferta y la demanda. El destino del financiamiento es para incrementar su mercadería así como a la compra de herramientas de trabajo para mejorar sus pequeñas tiendas ya que la época navideña existe más posibilidad para incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The group “San Felipe” is represented by Mrs. Maura. In general the members of this group work selling clothes, make up, groceries and some work sawing clothes and creating masks. They are all very responsible people as proven before. They know that work on the market has lots of competition, but they have years of experience working on it and know supply and demand principles. They will use the loan to increase their inventory to be ready for the holiday season, when they hope they will increase sales and their income to help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La señora Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró cosméticos, bisutería para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su quisco ha variado de productos, tiene pelotas, juguetes y regalos para toda ocasión.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará peluches, cofres de hueso y tintes para cabello para vender en la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Señora Lucy is a member of the communal bank "Dante Nava" in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 30, is married, and has one son. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased cosmetics and jewelry to sell at her stand where she works. She has worked for almost 8 years with the communal bank, and she tells us that she sells various products at her kiosk. She has balls, toys, and gifts for every occasion. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase stuffed animals, jewelry boxes, and hair dyes to sell during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase stuffed animals, jewelry boxes, and hair dye.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is twenty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has one child, a boy who is currently at elementary school. Agnes’ husband is a welder by profession, and farms as well. Agnes and the family live in a family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Offinso either farm or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Agnes trades in second hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second hand clothes, including bed spreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc., from Kumasi, a nearby city. She then sells them at the market square in her community. She says she also travels to nearby markets to sell there as well. Agnes has been in this business for barely a year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
La señorita Katia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es el engorde de ganado menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas ganado (ovejas) para su engorde y venta de carne en los mercados locales. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, monto que decidió pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas ganado, en este caso toros para engorde y algunos animales menores (ovejas), los mismos que engordará y venderá en las ferias y mercados locales de Ilave; con las  ganancias ella piensa seguir sus estudios superiores y apoyar en el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the community bank Ciudad Blanca, in the town of Chijichaya, Ilave district, Collao province, department of Puno. She is 18 years old, single, has no children, and has completed her high school education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six months. Katia is in the business of raising cattle, and with her first loan of 500 soles, she was able to purchase more livestock (sheep) to raise and later sell for meat at local markets. With a new loan of 900 soles, which Katia plans to repay in three monthly instalments, she'll be able to buy more livestock such as bulls and sheep, which she can also sell for meat at local markets in Ilave. With the money she makes, Katia plans to pursue higher education and help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and later sell at market for a better price.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is a seamstress. She is 50 years old and has three children. Previously she engaged in mat weaving. She sells her mats to the village for Php 100.00 per piece. She has a very old sewing machine which she uses also to make dresses. She earns a reasonable profit from sewing clothes for the whole family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine and repair her old one. She plans to teach her children to sew so that when they are older they could have an alternative source of income for their future families.

CEVI is a non-profit organization partnered with KIVA in the Phillippines. They help people start and have their own businesses. They provide their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help their business to grow.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy a new one

loans.name: Comite Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo a partir de la union de varias vecinas del barrio Ñande Tava de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité tinen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben.  Varias integrantes del comité son artesanas, dedicadas a la confeccion de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales. Tambien integran el comité varias personas que se dedican a la venta de ropas y otros articulos.

Elsa H. de Leon	Venta de Ropas.
Maria E. A.	Despensa
Andrea E. C.	Venta de lenceria
 Estelvina D.	Despensa
Maria C. B.	Venta de ropas
Graciela M.	Despensa
Lisa B.	Venta de cosmeticos
Mariana C.	Venta de carbon
Griselda V.	Artesana
Isidora H. 	Costurera
Angela O.	Kiosco
Cresencia V.	Venta de carne
Susana C. A. 	Venta de Bebidas
Myrian D. H.	Venta de frutas
Rumilda G.	Venta de cosmeticos y ropas
Nilsa V.              Costurera.
Carmen C. L..	Venta de Comidas
texts.en:
The committee was created when a number of women from the Ñande Tava neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa joined together. All of the members of the group have a job in which they invest the money they receive. Some of the group members are artisans, dedicated to the creation of traditional clothes and other handiworks. There are also various people in the group who sell clothing and other articles. Elsa H. de Leon Clothing sales Maria E. A. General store Andrea E. C. Lingerie sales Estelvina D. General store Maria C. B. Clothing sales Graciela M. General store Lisa B. Cosmetics sales Mariana C. Charcoal sales Griselda V. Artisan Isidora H. Seamstress Angela O. Kiosk Cresencia V. Meat sales Susana C. A. Beverage sales Myrian D. H. Fruit sales Rumilda G. Cosmetics and clothing sales Nilsa V. Seamstress Carmen C. L.. Prepared food sales

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans granted to the members of the committee were used primarily for the purchase of merchandise such as clothing, sheets, charcoal.  These articles were purchased by the women who sell them.  The artisans purchased raw materials such as thread, fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Doña Josefina Ordonez is 37 years old and is single with 3 children. When she was 3 years old her older brother accidentally cut off her hand with an ax. The hand was completely amputated, but Josefina is still able to weave and happily says that she functions the same as someone with 2 hands. 

About 4 years ago she became part of a women’s lending group with FAPE and received her first loan. A few years ago her nephew learned to make sandals and Josefina helped him to open his own shop so that he could make more money. They have been making sandals now in their own workshop for 4 years and she needs capital in order to buy materials like leather and rubber soles. 

They dream of selling their shoes in many of the local markets and of having a lot of employees. Josefina hopes that her children will be able to continue studying and that someday she will be able to expand her home so that each child can have their own room.

**********************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
**********************************************

Doña Josefina Ordóñez, es una señora de 37 años de edad, esta sola con, 3 hijos, ella por accidente cuando tenia 3 años su hermano mayor le corta la mano con un hacha, fue amputada, mas sin embargo, ella teje hasta este momento, hace 4 años se integra a un grupo de mujeres para un crédito, luego un sobrino, aprende hacer sandalias, ella lo impulsó para que se iniciaran un taller propio y no mas ser empleado, llevan 4 años de fabricar sandalias, ahora necesitan capital para comprar suelas y cuero para  elaborar Zapatos, el sueño que tienen es de poder vender en muchos mercados locales, tener muchos empleados, y que sus hijos puedan  seguir estudiando, una habitación cada hijo.

loans.use: Materials to make shoes

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Shinebayar V. lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children both go to a local primary school.

Shinebayar has a small retail business selling clothing. She rents a small stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells clothing for women and men. Her husband also helps her business. Shinebayar travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, and purchases cheap yet fashionable clothing for women and men. When she is away traveling to China to buy inventory, her husband stays at the stall and sells the clothing.

Since the start in 2002, her business has stabilized and she hopes to expand her business soon. She requests a loan to purchase clothing as the summer season approaches.

loans.use: To purchase clothing as the summer season approaches.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y su último hijo de 14 años en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace 5 años tuvo la idea de comprar carbón por camionadas y venderlo, desde entonces abastece cada semana a sus principales compradores que son las pequeñas fábricas de ladrillo que abundan por su localidad, ya que les sirve como combustible de sus hornos de condensación. En época de lluvia baja la demanda, por lo que es importante tener un almacén, este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados, y constantemente compra carbón de piedra y lo almacena en el patio de su casa. Para más adelante, Antonia desea seguir trabajando en esta actividad pero comprando mayores cantidades. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y su deseo es trabajar de manera armoniosa con sus compañeros de grupo. Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para Antonia, pues planea comprar una camionada de carbón de piedra para abastecerse.
texts.en:
Antonia is 58 years old and lives with her husband and youngest child, who is 14 years old. They live in their own home. Five years ago she had the idea of buying a truck load of coal and selling it. Ever since, she stocks her main buyers on a weekly basis. Her buyers are the many small factories that make bricks in her area. They use it for fuel in their condensation ovens. During the rainy season, there is not as much demand, which is why it’s important to have a warehouse. This business has been good so she is constantly buying stone coal and storing it on her home's patio. In the future, Antonia would like to continue working in this field, but she would like to buy in bigger quantities. This is her first loan with MFP, and she would like to work harmoniously with the other members of the group. The loan will be very useful to Antonia as she is planning to buy a load of stone coal to stock up.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị
loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: Roly tiene 22 años, es un joven soltero, noble y muy trabajador. Es el mayor de 3 hermanos, vive en la casa de sus padres apoyándolos en los trabajos agrícolas. Cuando obtuvo la mayoría de edad (18 años) se dio cuenta de que tenía que trabajar duro en las chacras de su padre para ayudar a mejorar la economía de su casa, en vista de que les faltaba dinero para cubrir la educación de sus hermanas menores. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprano para que a las 8 de la mañana ya esté trabajando en sus cultivos. Durante los meses de verano inicia su labor removiendo la tierra y preparándola para las siembras del nuevo año; llegada la temporada de sembrar cava los surcos donde se entierra la papa. Esta dinámica de trabajo la realiza con el valioso apoyo de su padre, pero para los meses de cosecha su madre y sus hermanas se suman a la faena, recogiendo la papa y seleccionándola por tamaño para después enviarla al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Esta cosecha le resultó muy rentable, puesto que vendió cada saco de papa entre 70 a 80 soles, reuniendo dinero para las necesidades de sus hermanas y otra parte para su próxima siembra. Roly está feliz con su trabajo, ama sus cultivos y se siente útil para su hogar. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, durante los 3 ciclos anteriores demostró pagar puntualmente, y en este préstamo reitera su compromiso. Roly es el secretario de su banco comunal, por ello que en cada reunión anota los acuerdos en el libro de actas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y pesticidas para el follaje de las hojas de sus plantas de papa.
texts.en:
Roly is 22-years old and single; he is a very noble and hard working young man. He is the eldest of 3 brothers and lives in his parents' house, helping them with farming work. When he came of age (18-years old) he realized he had to work hard on his father's farm to help improve his family's financial situation, considering that they don't have money to cover his younger brothers' schooling. Since then, Roly gets up very early so that by 8:00 a.m. he is already working his crops. During the summer he starts turning over the soil and preparing it for next season's planting. It is now time to plow the furrows where he will plant potatoes. Roly accomplishes this work with the valuable help of his father, but during the harvest his mother and sisters join him to work on the land, picking the potatoes and sorting them by size to send to the market in Tarma city. This harvest turned out very profitable, since he sold each sack of potatoes at 70 to 80 PEN. He put the money towards meeting the needs of his sisters, also setting aside a portion for the next planting season. Roly is happy with his work; he loves his crops and feels useful in his home. This is his fourth loan with MFP. In his prior loans he demonstrated that he makes his repayments punctually, and in this loan he will again follow through on his commitment. Roly is the secretary of his community bank, so he records minutes for each meeting in the group's log book (Libro de Actas). The money he requests is to buy chemical fertilizers and pesticides for his potato plants.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Delfina De La Luz

texts.es: Delfina nació en agua blanca Jutiapa el 12 de octubre de 1,958 tiene 50 años de edad y 5 hijos 4 varones y una mujer el mayor tiene 30 años y la menor tiene 22 el mayor de sus hijos ya es casado y los menores viven con ella, el esposo de doña Delfina se fue al extranjero para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y les manda remesas hace 8 años inicio su negocio de tortillas con 1 arroba de maíz y  torteaba con leña así fue subiendo su ingreso y aumentando clientes, actualmente tortea con 1 quintal de maíz diario y  utiliza gas propano solicita un préstamo de Q7,000.00, para comprar una estufa industrial y un fogón para coser su maíz y de esa manera generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Delfina was born in Agua Blanca Jutiapa on October 12, 1958 and is 50 years old. She has 5 children – 4 sons and 1 daughter. The oldest is 30 years old, while the youngest is 22 years old. Most of her children are married, but the younger ones still live with her. Doña Delfina’s husband works abroad to help pay for their children’s education expenses. He has been sending home remittances for 8 years.

She started her tortilla business with only 1 sack (11.5 kg) of corn and some firewood. From that point, she started generating an income and attracting customers. She now goes through 46 kg of corn each day and is cooking with propane gas. Doña Delfina is requesting a loan of 7000 QTZ ($875 USD) to buy an industrial stove and a firebox for roasting corn. She hopes this will help generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, an industrial oven and a firebox

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria moved with her husband to the United States from Venezuela five years ago.  Their adult son was already living in South Florida and had started a business.  He employed his father and the two of them took care of the household expenses and Maria’s bills.  

Despite their support, Maria wanted to contribute to the household finances and keep herself busy. She was always been good at sewing. Two years ago, little by little, she started to develop a small clientèle that used her services for clothing alterations. She was proud of her small business, but her sewing machine started to fail due to overuse.  

Maria learned about ACCION USA’s lending program and applied for a loan to buy two new sewing machines.  With this loan, Maria was able to invest in her business, and also establish a credit history. She paid her loan off perfectly and would now like a larger loan to make additional investments in her business.  

A local factory wants to contract for her services, which would proviD. her with consistent work. Another business owner, who currently imports bathing suits, wants Maria to hand-make the swimwear for them. In order to sign these contracts, Maria would need an embroidery machine and a digital sewing machine to create her own designs. She will also need to purchase more inventory to maintain a more sizeable stock. For example, now, if she doesn't have the right color zipper, she has to take the bus downtown, incurring a $4 round-trip fare and more than 2 hours of her time.  

Currently, Maria works in her quaint, one-bedroom apartment in Miami Beach. She hopes to be able to expand her business so she can rent a modest storefront where her customers can stop by and drop off items that need to be mended.  

She is a very friendly person who always has a smile on her face. She loves to visit with people and to get to know her regular customers. In her own space, she can welcome clients and, hopefully, hire a helper, too.

loans.use: An embroidery machine, digital sewing machine, inventory

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 30-year-old widow with two children aged 7 and 9 years. Both her children are in school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Sarah doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a poultry farm in Kalerwe. She incurs extra transport costs from and to Mengo Kisenyi where she buys chicken feed.

Sarah sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last three years.

Sarah has been with MCDT for three years and is servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. Sarah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent rental rooms. .

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mr. Han N. is a villager in Preak Russey village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. On his farm he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed to cultivate. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy seed and he will use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field.

Mr. Han N. is the father of five children who are all attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Pin Yeoun, helps him with farming. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field

loans.name: Alicia Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza, está formado por un grupo de socias muy unidas, dispuestas a salir adelante ante todas las adversidades de la vida, solidarias entre las compañeras y siempre con una mentalidad positiva irradian alegría en las reuniones quincenales  donde comparten sus vivencias del día a día, viven en  diferentes localidades  de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora Alicia Dolores Zuñiga vive en el sector de la Mutualista Azuay a unos 30 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 48 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada tienen una buena relación conyugal, concibió cuatro hijos de 27, 26, 25, 14 años de edad, sus tres primeras hijas son profesionales en Contabilidad y Auditoría, le ayudan económicamente en su hogar, su último hijo  estudia en el colegio Antonia Ávila, su esposo es ejecutivo en ventas; juntos han  llegando a construir su casa propia fruto del esfuerzo de varios años.

Alicia tiene un bazar desde hace veinte y cinco años, además tiene una tienda de víveres hace cinco, nos comenta que las ventas han bajado un poco ya que se cambio de domicilio perdiendo toda su clientela, su horario de trabajo es de 7 a.m.  9 p.m., nos comenta que tener su tienda propia le beneficia mucho porque no sabe que es comprar por libras y que si algo le hace falta ocupa de su tienda.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando en su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha porque con los préstamos que ha recibido amplió su negocio y, con el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de mercadería  para surtir su tienda y comprar más artículos para su bazar como útiles escolares, articulos para el hogar, juguetes, etc.

El sueño de Alicia  es  que sus negocios sigan creciendo porque es el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Nueva Esperanza is formed by a group of very united members willing to overcome any life adversities. Solidarity is strong between the members and they always have a positive mentality. They shine joy in their bi-weekly meetings where they share their day-to-day lives. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca. Mrs. Alicia Dolores Zuñiga lives in the Mutualista Azuay area about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 48 years old, happily married, and with a good marriage relationship. She has four children ages, 27, 26, 25, and 14. Her first 3 daughters are professionals in Accounting and Audits. They help her financially at home. Her youngest son attends Antonio Avila school. Her husband is a Sales Executive. Together, they have built their own home which is the fruit of many years of effort. Alicia has had a bazaar for 25 years. In addition, she has a store where she has sold provisions for 5 years. She tells us that sales have dropped because she moved and lost her clients. She works from 7am to 9pm. She tells us that owning her store is very beneficial because she doesn't know what is like to purchase things by pounds and if she needs something, she gets it from her store. This is her third cycle working with the bank. She feels satisfied because the loans have helped her improve her business and with the loan FUNDACION ESPOIR grants her, she will invest buying additional provisions for her store and more merchandise for her bazaar such as school supplies, home supplies, toys, etc. Alicia's dream is that her businesses continue to improve because they are what sustain the family.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise to further stock her store and bazaar with items such as school supplies, home supplies, toys, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for business

loans.name: Daisy Xiomara

texts.es:
la señora Daisy Xiomara I. P. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada con el señor Ciriaco Castillo quien labora en una empresa como guardia de seguridad, dependen de ellos tres hijos que estan estudiando en el colegio de la comunidad de san lorenzo.
su negocio es la venta de abarroteria y granos basicos su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de San Lorenzo, vende maiz, frijoles, arroz, maisillo, cloro, café, azucar etc. 
necesita el prestamo para comprar mas producto y asi abastecer mas su negocio. 
quiere poder abastecerce para la navidad ya que en esa fecha se vende mucho y se obtienen muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Daisy Xiomara I. P., 36, is married to Ciriaco Castillo. He works for a business as a security guard. They have three children who are dependent upon them. The children go to school in the San Lorenzo community. Her business is selling groceries and basic grains. Her business is located inside the San Lorenzo Municipal Market. She sells corn, beans, rice, sorghum, chlorine, coffee, and sugar, etc. She needs the loan to buy more products to better stock her business. She wants to stock up for Christmas. On that date she sells a lot and gets great earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eggs, salsas, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, rice, sugar, tortillas, bread, crackers, shortening, oil, milk, cheese, butter, and churros

loans.name: Saria

texts.es:
La señora Saria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y madre de 02  hijos, los 02 que aun depende de ella.

Saria, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. 
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Saria is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, in the San Martin province and department. She is 34 years old and lives with her domestic partner and two children who still depend on her.
Saria is a very capable and determined woman. She sells clothes from a room in her house. She tells us that her business is going well due to her loyal clientele. Her strength and perseverance has helped her grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of her accomplishments.
The loan she is requesting (S/. 1,200.00) will be used to buy clothes, such as, pants, shorts, shirts, sweaters and dresses, to stock her inventory.
Saria is an established and hard working woman. She is thankful for the opportunity that Movimiento Manuela Ramos has given her to grow as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Rigoberto

texts.es: Carlos Rigoberto G. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a un hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar. Carlos, es una persona muy responsable, el cual trabaja mucho por el bienestar de su familia, él posee una venta de productos lácteos tales como  crema y queso. El solicita un préstamo con el fin de aumentar la variedad de queso y así mismo comprarlo en mayores cantidades. Debido a que Carlos posee la venta de lácteos en las afueras del mercado municipal de San Miguel, cuenta con muy buena clientela, lo cual lo incentiva a solicitar dicho préstamo y  a seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos Rigoberto G. is 30 years old. He lives in the department of San Miguel with his wife, who works as a shopkeeper, and his son, who is a student. Carlos is a very responsible person. He works a lot to ensure the well being of his family. He sells dairy products like cream and cheese. Carlos is asking for a loan to increase the variety of cheeses he sells as well as the quantity. Carlos sells outside the municipal market of San Miguel and has a very good client base, which has inspired to him ask for this loan and continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying dairy products

loans.name: Romania

texts.en: Romania T. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Romania owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Romania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Romania is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kisan A Group

texts.en:
Kisan A Group is a group of eight farmers in Tunbaun Village, West Amarasi Sub District, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara. Tunbaun is situated about 23 kilometres from Kupang City. Most of the village community consumes corn and cassava as their staple food. The agricultural products also generate money for their family needs. The agricultural products are sold at Baun Market in the nearest neighboring village and also in Inpres Market in Kupang City. The view surrounding the village is beautiful as many trees and wild flowers grow well in the rainy season. The village seems green.

Kisan A Group is led by Damaris Runisi.  She is a 47 year-old farmer. She is married to a farmer from her village and their marriage has been blessed with three children. They are:
- Devri Runisi, 17 – who is now working in Jakarta;
- Dance Runisi, 14  – he did not complete elementary school and spends his days helping his parents on the farm;
- Ayub Runisi, 10, who is in the fourth grade of Elementary School. 

Damaris is a good mother to her children and her life is dedicated to her family. She usually starts her day at five am.  She prepares breakfast for her children and husband and helps Ayub in preparing himself to go to school. Damaris has to walk about one kilometre to reach a spring in order to get water for washing and cooking. Using two buckets, Damaris carries the water on her shoulders. After completing her work at home she goes to the farm to help her husband. They usually spend about six hours on the farm. They plant coconut, betel vine and bananas and sell them in Inpres Market once a week. They also plant peanuts, peas, cassavas and corn in the rainy season. To generate more income, Damaris’ husband also buys vegetables and fruits from other farmers and resells them at the market. Damaris used to own another farm but because of landslide lost her land. As a result, she and her family can only depend on their current farm.

As the mother of three children, Damaris is concerned about her family. Her husband is a hard worker but the income he generates is only just enough to support their family needs. This is the reason that motivated Damaris to find another way to support her family. She heard about the TLM cattle fattening program and would like to join it.  Together with other farmers also interested in joining the program, they formed Kisan A Group to apply for the loan. Damaris is requesting a loan of IDR 3,300,000 to buy a calf to fatten over a 12 month period. The other group members are also requesting the same loan. All of them have the same goal:  to improve their lives.

Note: Melinda was not present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
