Mary is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Mary works hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Mary prepares and sells kenkey (corn or cassava dumplings) with fried fish. She sells them by the roadside in her community. She buys bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. Mary has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Faithful Business Group

texts.en: Jacob J. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called the Faithful Business Group. He is 34 years old and married with two children, who are 8 and 5 years old and in kindergarten and third grade. Jacob and his family live in the Freeport Community, near the Sea Port of Monrovia and located close to downtown Monrovia. He works at the intersection of Randall and Water Street in downtown Monrovia. Jacob is a high school graduate. Jacob’s business is the sale of food such as rice, beans, etc. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table in downtown Monrovia. He has been running this business for 16 years and hopes to become an importer and exporter of general goods to Liberia in the near future. Jacob started selling with 4000.00 Liberian Dollars as working capital but now operates with 12000.00 Liberian Dollars. He has faced difficulty with siting his business, because he does not have a stable site. He sells quality goods and interacts with his customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from him. Jacob needs this loan to purchase more rice, oil, beans, etc., for resale. He dreams and hopes that he and his family will remain in good health. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jacob is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP, a Kiva partner, seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, oil, beans and other foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 39 years old and she is married with four children. She is carrying her youngest child on her back in the picture. Her husband is a commercial driver, and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client. The "Lift Above Poverty Organization" is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Evelyn sells foodstuffs like tubers of yam and garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Rum

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 47 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns a living as a garment worker, getting a specific salary of over a hundred dollars a month. S. has a life partner in her husband, who helps support the family by working as a local chef. The couple was married many years ago and has two children. One of them is married and other one is single and a security guard. S. will be using her first loan to mend and improve her house, which is too old and breaking down. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To mend and improve her old house

loans.name: Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Manuela de Jesús J., es una señora emprendedora de un negocio de venta de Bisutería   y otros productos el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de ahorro hace 15 años. Este negocio está ubicado Mercado Israel lewite callejón principal del mercado. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra prendas de fantasías, colas, prensadores, chapas de madera y carey. 
Ella es casada tiene a su cargo un hijo y se encuentran  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella  Vendía ambulante en el mercado Israel lewite. 

Lleva 16 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 4 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela de Jesús is an enterprising woman with a business selling a variety of products. It began with an initial capital of 5,000 córdobas, and has been expanding for 15 years. Her business is located in the principal aisle of the Israel Lewite Market. The loan she solicits is to be invested in working capital, such as buying women's accessories, tails, pins, wooden plates,etc. She is married and has a school-age boy in her charge. She says that before this business, she sold goods on foot in the Israel Lewite Market. Manuela has had 16 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 4 years. Each was invested in her business, which has been growing, with diversified products, thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOMEN'S ACCESSORIES, TAILS, PINS, AND WOODEN PLATES TO SELL

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es:
Este cliente es un productor de plátanos de la zona de Tonalá es hombre soltero padre de 1 hijo 
Este cliente aparte de ser productor es maestro de educación primaria pero con el bajo salario no puede sufragar los gastos por lo que esta solicitando este crédito
texts.en:
This gentleman raises bananas in the Tonalá zone. He is single and has one son. Aside from being a farmer, he also teaches elementary school, but can’t afford to defray expenses, so he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain banana crop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 años, vive sola con su única hija, en su casa que es propia. Tiene 23 años de experiencia en la venta de verduras, desde entonces lleva su mercadería a las principales ferias comerciales que se ubican en zonas rurales de  su localidad. Es así que sale 3 veces por semana, realizando estos viajes, siendo su hija, quien lo acompaña desde muy temprano a comprar la cantidad de verduras necesarias al por mayor en el mercado central de la ciudad. De esta manera le permite tener suficientes ganancias que le ayuden a alcanzar el progreso de su negocio. Ante esto, espera mas adelante implementar su puesto con otros productos y hacer crecer su capital de trabajo. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será de mucho beneficio en su negocio. El crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de más variedad de verduras para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, age 59, lives alone with her only daughter in her own house. She has 23 years of experience selling vegetables. She takes her merchandise to the main commercial fairs, which are located in the rural areas of her location. She leaves three times a week to make these trips. Her daughter goes with her when she leaves very early to buy the quantity of vegetables that she needs. She buys wholesale at the central market of the city. That allows her to have sufficient income, which helps her make progress in her business. Later she hopes to set up her stall with other products and make her working capital grow. She will use the loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables to meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Adelina's Group

texts.en:
Adelina D. is from the village of Brgy.Paniki, Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Adelina is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Adelina is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns & operates a business making & selling fish balls and other dim sum to the local community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which she used to purchase raw ingredients. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa L. is from the village of Calamba. She is 46 years old, married and has adult-aged children. Melissa owns and operates an Internet cafe. Melissa has been involved in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Melissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Melissa is requesting a new loan, her 7th, of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase accessories for computers.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for computers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma T. is from the village of Salimpuno,Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Vilma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used purchase fertilizers for her coconut. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to grow coconuts.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 58 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Jesus owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been engaged in this business for more than a few years.

In 2009, Jesus joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jesus has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jesus is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. He also plans to buy a pig to raise. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jesus from CEVI. He plans to improve his business by reinvesting the additional revenue generated.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Numeriano

texts.en:
Numeriano P. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 70 years old. Numeriano is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Numeriano owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Numeriano has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Numeriano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Numeriano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from GDMPC. Numeriano is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Numeriano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Señor Javier  se dedica al servicio de taxi ya hace dos años atrás obteniendo buenos resultados en sus ingresos diarios, siendo esta s u actividad principal se levanta muy temprano para iniciar su jornada de trabajo. Con este trabajo el puede ayudar a su familia en la alimentación de sus pequeñas hermanas, el solo mantiene el hogar ya que sus Papas no trabajan. En esta oportunidad el requiere el crédito es para cambiar el motor de su vehículo que ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo, es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Javier has worked in a taxi service for two years and has obtained good daily income. This is his main activity and he gets up very early to begin his work day. With this job he is able to help family to feed his two little sisters. He is the household's only support since his parents don't work. At this time, he needs the loan to change his vehicle's engine, since it has finished its useful life. He is a hardworking and responsible young man and he is grateful with the institution for the opportunity it has offered.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an engine and other replacement parts

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa C. lives in Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu City. She is married to Eleseo C., 68 years old, and they have eight children, all grown. Teresa operates a general store, and her husband helps her in her business activities. Teresa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 49,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, and lifted the family's standard of living. Her 11th cycle loan of PHP 29,500 will be used as additional capital to expand her business. Her earnings will help her save up for the future, meet monthly household expenses, and do house repair. Teresa C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Lungujja neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Annet sells firewood. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. Annet sells her products retail from home. She lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of firewood. The main business challenge for Annet is transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to improve her standard of living and also to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy R. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 43 years old. Daisy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Daisy is just starting this business.

In 2009, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been selling clothes and shoes in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 32 years old, married to Magdalene Wanjiru and they have two children who are going to school.

Peter was introduced to KADET  LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to add stock of trousers and shirts to sell in his shop. In the future, Peter plans to be selling clothes for all people as currently he has specialized only with men clothing.

loans.use: To buy more trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Alex Mwachenye

texts.en:
Alex Mwachenye L. is a 49-year-old milk supplier in Tezo Karen Kilifi. He is married to Sarah Saro, who is a farmer. Both of them earn an income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. Alex has been in this business for the last year and has done great.

He joined an existing group of KADET lenders. He has applied for a loan that he will use to buy one cow. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to add another cow.

He hopes to be a commercial farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony, es un comerciante de CD Y DVD, es casado y reside con su esposa, su madre y hermanos en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, aun no tiene hijos. Este negocio de venta de Cd y DVD es la fuente de ingreso que él tiene, de acá logra compra todas sus cosas y ver por las necesidades del hogar. 
Él quiere mejorar el negocio y para esto quiere invertir solicitando un préstamo por un monto que considera será suficiente para realizar la inversión, al mismo tiempo quiere una parte de préstamo tomarla para reparar su vehículo ya que está presentando algunos problemas mecánicos porque él quiere que antes que el problema se le complique poder en este momento solucionarlo, llevando al mecánico para que este la repare.
Su objetivo es tener bien establecido el negocio, que sus ventas aumenten, tener en buenas condiciones su vehículo y velar cada día por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony is a CD and DVD merchant. He is married and lives with his wife, his mother, and his siblings in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He does not yet have children. His business of selling CDs and DVDs is his source of income and it is what allows him to buy things and provide the household necessities.
 
He wants to improve his business and in order to do that he is requesting a loan for an amount that he considers sufficient to make the needed investment. He would also like to use a portion of the loan to repair his car because it has some mechanical problems; before it gets worse, he wants to take it to a mechanic to repair it. 

His goals are to get his business well established, to increase sales, to have his car in good working condition, and to look after his family’s well-being every day.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila R. is forty years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Purok 4 within Mansabay Bajo barangay, a part of the municipality of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Mila sells fish. She has been in business for ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Mila is requesting a new loan, her tenth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more fish and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and for working capital

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es:
Gladys Narváez es una persona muy activa y dinámica, que le gusta mucho el negocio, característica de sus ancestros por eso ella lo aprendió casi que de una manera  instintiva. Ella se dedica a  la actividad de comerciante y en sus inicios lo hizo mediante la venta de mercancía por encargo de   sus compañeras de trabajo y del personal de empleados del algunas empresas; también realizaba labores de costuras, siendo su especialidad  elaborar ropa infantil femenina, esa época fue muy difícil para ella  porque sus 2 hijos estaban pequeños y los ingresos eran muy pocos. Pero un día unas amigas  le hablaron de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  se interesó  y con 3 amigas   conformaron  el grupo  solidario Las Kenesianas y recibieron su primer  crédito de $60.000.oo COP para pagarlos en 4 cuotas. Con este dinero compró mercancía y le dio más impulso a su   negocio, por lo cual considera que “pagar con puntualidad las cuotas pactadas y no quedar mal es primordial para seguir adelante apoyada por esta organización, o por quienes le den la mano”. Su negocio ha sido un peldaño importante para su  vida y la de su familia, porque todos han puesto su granito de arena para sacarlo adelante. En el  negocio Gladys vende papelería, detalles, ropa de niños y niñas, pequeños electrodomésticos, refrescos, cervezas y con sus ganancias ha logrado ayudar a formar profesionalmente a su hija hasta terminar su carrera de Contaduría Pública como también a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.    Gladys   se siente  muy contenta ella goza  dándole gracias a Dios y a la Fundación por los beneficio recibidos y la confianza de esta al otorgarle prestamos consecutivos a los largo de 18 años, por su  buen manejo de responsabilidad y sentido de pertenencia.  Gladys considera que a lo largo  de todos estos años, la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha sido muy enriquecedora con sus capacitaciones y su apoyo económico para el crecimiento y el buen manejo del negocio, tanto en la parte espiritual como material, porque esto le ha servido para encontrarse en paz con Dios y expresar agradecimientos a  la fundación, y a  las personas que de una u otra forma le han colaborado para que los resultados sean positivos. Con los cursos de formación microempresarial en los que ha participado, aprendió a distinguir entre clientes buenos y malos, así como mercancías que son más fácil de vender y otras no, a ser ordenada con los recaudos y a tener una visión  diferente con respecto a los proveedores, ya que no es muy partidaria de adquirir mercancías a crédito, sino comprarlas con el efectivo por lo que manifiesta que le deja un mayor margen de utilidad.
En la actualidad ha logrado conformar en sociedad una Cooperativa Multiactiva que se encuentra legalizada en la cámara de comercio, producto de los conocimientos adquiridos en el largo recorrido de su carrera como microempresaria, y de los  ofrecidos por la fundación que han sido muy importante y de  apoyo para alcanzar  sus metas y consolidar este , su proyecto de vida.  
Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y carismática que se desempeña como docente en un Hogar Infantil,  ubicado en sur occidente de la ciudad donde se atienden Niños de escasos recursos. De su grupo inicial “ Las Kenesianas” la única que ha permanecido consecutivamente es   Gladys, porque es persistente y disciplinada, ella es una mujer felizmente realizada y a punto de recibir su  pensión.
En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva que es el financiamiento número 22 y con el piensa comprar mercancías para surtir su negocio en la época mas linda porque concentra a la familia en su hogar con festividades mientras lucen vestidos, calzados, accesorios y perfumes que Gladys vende a crédito y de contado.
Su desafío y meta principal es dedicarse completamente a la cooperativa multiactiva, así  como también a su familia y a sus nietos, futuros herederos del negocio que con mucha disciplina, esfuerzo y trabajo ha levantado.
texts.en:
Gladys Narvaéz is a very active and dynamic person who likes business a lot.  This is a characteristic of her ancestors and she learned it almost instinctively.  Gladys is a saleswoman.  Initially she sold merchandise which her work colleagues and employees of other businesses ordered.  She also performed sewing tasks, her speciality being making clothes for little girls.  This period was very difficult for her because her two children were young and her income was very small.  However, one day some friends talked to her about Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she became interested.  Together with three friends, she set up the 'Las Kenesianas' solidarity group and they received their first loan for 60,000 Colombian pesos which was to be repaid over 4 instalments.  With this money, she bought merchandise and it gave her business a boost.  She considers that “paying your instalments punctually and not making a bad impression is essential if you want to continue to get ahead with the support of this organization or those who are giving you a hand”.  

Gladys' business has been an important stepping stone in her life and that of her family because everybody has done their bit to get her business ahead.  In her business, Gladys sells stationery, notions, boys' and girls' clothing, small domestic appliances, soft drinks, beer and, with her profits, she has managed to help train her daughter professionally until she finished her course in Public Accountancy.  It has also helped her to improve the condition of her home.  Gladys feels very happy.  She gives thanks to God and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the benefits which she has received and the trust that the organization has placed in her by giving her consecutive loans for 18 years, for their good management, responsibility and sense of belonging.  Gladys considers that throughout all these years, being a part of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has been a very enriching experience with their training programs and their financial support.  They have helped her business to grow and helped her to manage it well, both spiritually and materially.  This has helped her to find herself at peace with God and she is grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and the people who in one way or another have contributed to her positive results.  Through the small business courses which she has participated in, she has learned to distinguish between good customers and bad customers as well as between goods which are easy to sell and others which are not.  She is now organized in her accounts and has a different view with respect to her providers since she is no longer a fan of acquiring goods on credit, rather she prefers to buy in cash because she says that this gives her a bigger profit margin.

She has currently managed to form a Multiactive Cooperative which has been legalized in the Chamber of Commerce.  This is a product of the knowledge which she has acquired throughout her long career as a small businesswoman.  The training she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has been very important and has supported her so that she can achieve her goals and consolidate her life's project.

Gladys is a hard-working and charismatic woman who works as a teacher in a child development center located in the south-west of the city where she looks after children whose parents have low economic means.  From her initial 'Las Kenesianas' group, the only one who has remained consecutively is Gladys because she is persistent and disciplined.  She is a woman who feels happily fulfilled and is about to receive her pension.  She is currently applying for her Kiva loan, which is her 22nd loan, and plans to use it to buy merchandise to stock her business in this period of the year which is the most beautiful because she gets her family together in her home and gets to enjoy the festive season while everyone shows off dresses, shoes, accessories and perfumes which Gladys sells on credit and for cash.

Glady's challenge and main goal is to dedicate herself entirely to the multiactive cooperative as well as to her family and her grandchildren who are the future heirs to her business which she has built up with a lot of discipline, effort and hard work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her business in this most beautiful of seasons when her family gets together in her home to celebrate the festive season whilst they show off dresses , shoes, accessories and perfumes which Gladys sells on credit or for cash

loans.name: Rosa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Rosa de 23 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su tía quien la creció, Rosa está soltera y viven en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de productos empacados, ella tiene dos años de dedicarse al negocio y lo aprendió en su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio y hacerle algunas reparaciones al vehículo de trabajo, con esta ayuda podrá fortalecer el negocio comprando mercadería para ofrecer mejores productos a los clientes, así mismo mejorar la condición de su vehículo que es el medio para transportar la mercadería. 
Las aspiraciones de ella son mejorar su condición económica a través del negocio, contar con salud para seguir trabajando y progresando.
texts.en:
Rosa, 23, lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  She lives with an aunt who raised her.  Rosa is single, and they live in their own home.  Rosa has a business selling packaged goods.  She has had this business for 2 years, and she learned this trade from her family.

Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in her business and to make some repairs to the vehicle she uses in her work.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business in two ways: she can buy merchandise so that she can offer better products to her customers; and she can improve the condition of her vehicle, which is her means of transporting her merchandise.

Rosa aspires to improve her financial situation through her business, and hopes to have good health so that she can continue to work and progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Natividad; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de verduras y animales menores, la socia vende en las diferentes ferias de la provincia de Urubamba, distrito de Yucay, la socia quiere mejorar los negocios de venta de animales y venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y animales como conejos y pollos.         

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the "Los Andenes" community bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Maria Natividad. She is 42 years old, and she lives with her partner and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, which is selling vegetables and small animals. She sells in various fairs in the province of Urubamba, in the Yucay district. She wants to improve her business, and she is applying for the loan to buy vegetables and animals such as rabbits and chickens.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and animals such as rabbits and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan G. y su esposa la señora Fermina Isabel Gordillo, tiene un hijo y a quien le quieren dar lo mejor. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar el trámite de las escrituras de su vivienda, pero por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar los trámites y les están ofreciendo una oferta un descuento ya quieren aprovechar esta oportunidad. Para asegurar el patrimonio de la familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su pensión gubernamental, ya que la señora Fermina Isabel se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan G. lives with his wife Fermina Isabel Gordillo.  They have one child whom they would like to provide with the best in life.  They are requesting this loan so that they can pay for the preparation of legal deeds for their home.  Right now they don't have the money they need to pay for this to be done.  They are being offered a discount and they would like to take advantage of this opportunity in order to guarantee the family's property.

Juan plans to pay the loan back with the income that he obtains from his government pension since his wife Fermina Isabel will take care of their family expenses.

loans.use: To pay for the preparation of the deeds for his home

loans.name: Tumendelger

texts.en: Tumendelger, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is his co-worker and his two sons go to kindergarten. For the past three years, the family has been living in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Tumendelger began his retail trading business in 2007. He sells firewood, coal and dung at a local market. He purchases coal and firewood from individuals who operate a delivery service business. After being in business for two years, he used his profits to buy a mini-truck, which can carry two tons of merchandise. In 2010, he bought a car as well. He works hard and wants to expand his business in order to buy a large delivery truck so he can transport coal from the mining site at a much cheaper price to sell at the local market. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more firewood to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and a sewing machine, and enlarge her shop

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, hace años su esposos falleció pero  de esa relación tuvo cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija con su esposo y dos hijos menores.

Nuestra amiga hace varios años trabajo en Pacifictel pero ya se jubilo, pero desde hace mucho se  dedica a la venta de productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres  días a la semana en las mañanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe ella y sus compañeras a través de los créditos. Sus metas son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Here we find 60 year old Maria.  Her husband passed away years ago, but she has five adult children from that relationship.  One of her daughters and her husband and two children live with her.

Our friend used to work for Pacifictel, but has since retired and now sells Avon and Yanabel (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She works three days a week in the morning, when she goes door to door and accepts orders.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  Cosmetics and perfumes are her best sellers.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products.  She has been part of the communal bank for three years and likes it because it helps her and her friends through the loan program.  Her goal is to open her own small store.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Serenidad, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009, gracias a que la Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Maria Mercedes C., quien se dedica a la venta de especias, ya formó parte de otro grupo anteriomente, que al desintegrarse dicho grupo, decidió contactar con la asesora y formar su propio grupo, la misma contactó con sus vecinas y logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La sra. Maria Mercedes vende especias, desde hace mucho tiempo mantiene a su familia con este pequeño negocio, hoy día quiere ampliarlo comprando mayor cantidad de especias y venderlas en proporciones igualmente cuantitativas por ello solicita el crédito para poder hacerlo y alcanzar su meta económica.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Women’s Committee was formed on January 17, 2009 by the Financial Director Sra. Maria Mercedes C.. In the past she was part of another group, but when it broke up, she decided to contact the advisor and form her own group. She talked to her neighbours and managed to put together a group of seventeen women who enjoy working together. They are now in their eighth loan cycle in the program.

Maria earns her living by selling spices. With the income from this small business, she has supported her family for many years. Now she wishes to expand it by buying and selling a larger quantity of spices. As a result, Maria is seeking a loan so she can do this and reach her financial goals.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel nació en la provincia de Canchis del departamento del Cusco, él tiene 50 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. En la ciudad del Cusco hay hermosos paisajes, donde hay sitios históricos y donde hay centros arqueológicos de los antiguos pobladores del imperio Inca. 

Miguel Angel es docente y trabaja en el colegio de la comunidad de Huallachoca de la provincia de Anta y también se dedica a la distribución de comestibles, galletas, dulces y muchas cosas más, a las tiendas escolares y tiendas de abarrotes en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracia al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Miguel Angel requiere el crédito para comprar más comestibles como galletas, dulces y otras cosas que faltan.  
  
Miguel Angel es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco se encuentra la ciudadela de los Incas de Machupicchu, Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua quechua que traducido al castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel was born in Canchis province in Cusco department.  He is 50 and lives with his two children in the city of Cusco.  In Cusco there are beautiful landscapes with historical sites and archaelogical centers from the ancient Incan empire.

Miguel Angel is a teacher and he works in the school in Huallachoca in the Anta province. He also has a business selling food such as cookies, sweets and many other items to the school stores and grocery stores in Cusco.  He has had this business for five years and it's going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Now Miguel Angel needs the loan to buy more food such as cookies, candy, and other items that he needs.

Miguel Angel is a responsible person who belongs to the Warmicuna Llanqanchis communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Cusco, Peru.  In Cusco one can see the fort of the Incas of Machupicchu.  The word Warmicuna Llanqanchis comes from the Quechua language and translated from Spanish it means “Women who Work”.

loans.use: To buy foods such as cookies, candy, and other items that he needs

loans.name: Gina Piator Group

texts.en:
Gina P. is currently residing at Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. Gina is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Gina is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children all of whom are still school-aged. To make a living, Gina is engaged in cosmetic sales with which she's able to earn a monthly net income of not less than PHP 3600. She has been in this business for more than five years. 

In 2007, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 7,000. She is now requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as her 12th loan which will be used for educational purposes.   

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta V. is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates an entertainment business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 16 years, and that she earns additional income from a general store.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of 17,000 PHP ($400) through NWTF to purchase additional pieces of equipment for her entertainment business. Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to better provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her business

loans.name: Frank Arley

texts.es:
Frank Arley es un joven que se ha rebuscado la forma de generar ingresos, pues de él depende su esposa y sus 4 hijos a los cuales espera sacar adelante y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Es así como desde hace dos años decidió pararse en una calle de Itagüí, municipio del Área Metropolitana de Medellín, donde empezó a  darle indicaciones a los conductores para el parqueo de sus vehículos, fue allí donde descubrió otra oportunidad de negocio, una venta de chiqules, cigarrillos y dulces. 

Frank sueña con convertir su negocio en un minimercado, pero para ello es consciente que debe trabajar duramente y esforzarse cada vez más; por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de dulces y snaks que le permitan ofrecerle mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Frank Arley is a young man who has consistently searched for a way to generate an income. His wife and their 4 children depend on him and he wants to support him and to offer them a better future. Two years ago he decided to stand at a street in Itagui, a municipality of the metropolitan region of Medellin, and he started to help drivers find parking spots. This is how he discovered another business opportunity: the sale of gum, cigarettes, and sweets.

Frank dreams of converting his business into a mini-market. But to achieve his goal he knows that he needs to work very hard and to increasingly expend a greater effort. He currently needs a loan to purchase a greater variety of sweets and snacks which will give him the ability to offer a better variety to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Carmensitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Carmensitas" está integrado por 9 personas entre ellas se encuentra la señora Petra es originaria del estado D. México, tiene 39 años D. edad, madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos (4 mujeres y 1 hombre). Ella venD. tortillas desD. hace un año y anteriormente vendía ropa, ella tuvo que dedicarse al comercio desD. hace varios años ya que como no tiene el apoyo del padre D. sus hijos así que tiene que cubrir los gastos D. la casa, desD. que comenzo con los prestamos a podido mejorar su economía y como sus hijos la apoyan en la elaboración D. tortillas pueden tener un mayor número D. clientes y así incrementar su producción e ingresos. la señora Petra se siente muy feliz porque sus hijos la apoyan en su negocio y por esta razón le gustaria apoyarlos dandoles educación para que puedan tener un mejor futuro y continuando haciendo crecer su negocio para poder cumplir con este objetivo. Ella quiere el prestamo para comprar masa y maíz para hacer sus tortillas y comprar por cantidades grandes.
texts.en: The"Carmensitas” Communal Bank is maD. up of 9 people, among them is Mrs. Petra. She is originally from the state of México, is 39 years old, a single mother and has 5 children (4 women and 1 man). Petra has sold tortillas for a year, before she sold clothing. She had to become a salesperson because she doesn’t have the support of the father of her children and she has to meet the household expenses by herself. Ever since Petra began getting loans she has been able to improve her finances and since her children help her make the tortillas she is able to have a greater quantity of customers as her production and income increase. Mrs. Petra is very happy because her children support her in her business and by continuing to making her business grow she can support them by giving them a good education so that they can have a better future. Mrs. Petra would like the loan to buy dough and corn to make her tortillas and to buy them in greater quantities.

loans.use: buy dough and corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en:
Bazarragchaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is an unemployed man who stays home all day. She manages a general goods trading business at her store. She started her business in March, 2010. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to increase her working capital to 500,000-600,000 MNT. Now her business earnings are the only source of income for her family. Therefore she works hard in order to continue her business. 

She is a diligent woman who is planning to expand her business and to have a PC service center in near future. She says, "I am planning to open a PC service center that will be managed by my husband." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory such is a socks, hairpins, picture-frames, etc., for her business.

loans.use: purchase more inventory of general goods to resell.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Fransisca  is 38 years old and single. She owns a retail shop in Tala where by she sells things like cooking oil and sugar, and at the same time she does farming as her secondary business. She has been doing this business for the last 23 years and gets an income of  KES 18,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd, which she plans to buy more stock like cooking oil and sugar for sale, and seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the anticipated profits to increase her capital.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop some day. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock like cooking oil and sugar to sell, and seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mkaratusi Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani, who is in his early 40s, is married with five children who go to school. He has had a food vending business for 2 years now.  He works from 4am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his 3rd Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  He used the previous loans to start selling chips and to pay school fees and household expenses, and he has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more food stock for the food cafe. His dream is to be able to build his own house one day.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mkaratusi" which has a total of 10 members, and who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for the food cafe.

loans.name: Ana Leah

texts.en:
Ana Leah is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Ana Leah has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Ana Leah is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es: Luz (50 años) ,es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en casa propia junto a sus 2 hijas, un nieto y su esposo quienes le hacen feliz.El multiservicio de Luz esta ubicado en su propia casa, en una zona cerca de un colegio, ella se dedica a sacar copias, vender útiles, cabinas telefónicas y venta de ropa; además de realizar la actividad ya mencionada ella también se dedica a la preparación de alimentos para eventos que le soliciten.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es el movimiento que hay ya que ella se divierte mucho en su trabaja, al mismo tiempo que le genera ganancias ya que es muy conocida y cada fin de semana le llegan contratos los cuales ella cumple con toda responsabilidad. Tiene en mente muchos planes y proyectos los cuales espera poder concretar más adelante con la ayuda Dios.Este es el sexto préstamo que recibe de MFP y espera poder seguir con el grupo ya que cuando los problemas se presentaron ahí estuvieron todos para poder solucionarlos como grupo que son.Con los 1000 soles que le prestaran serán para poder incrementar sus multiservicios y así poder satisfacer con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 50, is a modest and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her two daughters, a grandson, and her husband who make her happy. Luz has a multi-service business located in her home, which is situated near a school. She makes copies, sells school supplies, offers phone booths for rent, and sells clothing. In addition to these services, she prepares food for events upon request. What she likes most about her work is the high level of activity in her job. This allows her to generate an income while enjoying what she does. Luz is well-known and responsibly fulfills all of her contracts each weekend. She has many plans and projects, so she hopes to complete them with the help of God.

This is the sixth loan she has received from MFP. She hopes to continue with her group because the other members can provide solutions when problems occur. The loan of 1000 PEN being issued to her will enable her to increase her services so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to increase the services that she offers in her business.

loans.name: Hylene

texts.en: Hylene is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She is a hard-working business-lady who sells kerosene. She also runs a grocery shop for extra income. She has been operating her business for seven years and has employed one person. In addition, she does poultry farming. She has been able to retain her customers because of her good service. Hylene hopes to own a car in the future. She has requested 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy kerosene, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy kerosene, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anibal Medardo

texts.es:
Anibal Medardo tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar una camioneta para poder transportar los productos que cultiva para salir a venderlos y no pagar flete.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Aníbal Medardo, 21, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading towards the Future) communal bank located in Jesús de Gran Poder are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Aníbal is a corn and rice farmer.  He buys his supplies at the Marlín supply center and does his sales there too and in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizer for his crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like diseases and infestations.  His dream is to be able to buy a pick-up truck to be able to transport the products he harvests to go out and sell them and not have to pay transportation fees.  He likes to go on excursions in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Komi Sena

texts.fr:
Komi est  un homme âgé de 30 ans, il est célibataire et père d’un enfant. komi est revendeur depuis 2006. Il achète et revend pour ses clients composés de toute personne des habits. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé au marché local d’adawlato .
Il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 jeans, 20 habits et 18 ensembles.
texts.en:
Komi, age 30, is single and the father of one child. He's been a reseller since 2006. He buys clothing for resale to a wide variety of customers.

He gets his supplies in Lomé at the Adawlato market. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 jeans, 20 outfits and 18 ensembles.

loans.use: to buy 20 jeans, 20 outfits and 18 ensembles

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 48-year-old married woman with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build her own permanent house. 

Violet is a primary school teacher and has been in teaching for 10 years.  She needs the Kiva loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Munhbaatar

texts.en:
Munhbaatar lives with her mother in a ger, the traditional Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her mother is old and stays at home. She started her business in 2006 by renting a counter in a local market to sell commodities such as kitchen implements, toilet service, etc. 

During the summer, she sells his goods across the countryside. She started her business from scratch and now she has her own home. She is very skilled and talented at her business. In the future, she is willing to expand her business. She is a skilled and experienced women who says, "I am very good at what I do and I want to expand my business." She is requesting 3,600,000 MNT to purchase more goods and to increase her assets.

loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de vender canastas, la socia teje canastas y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que hay en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de canastas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las canastas como yute, hilos y tejedores al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the "SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY" ("Lord of the Earthquakes-Poroy") community bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The partner is Juana, 34, who lives with her partner and has 6 children. Alongside her daily activities she has a basket selling business. She weaves baskets and sells them in the different markets in the city of Cusco. She works from 8am to 7pm. The business allows her to support her children. She would like to expand her basket selling business. That's why she's requesting a loan to buy materials to make baskets with, such as jute, yarn and weaves, wholesale.

The partner is grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy materials to make baskets with, such as jute, yarn and weaves, wholesale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29-years-old, married and has two children. He lives with three family members; two of them work.

Ahmad has been the owner of a photography shop since 2008. He gained sufficient experience in this field from his father. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Farida 44 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Farida yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. 
7 let tomu nazad ona otkrila magazin kotoriy nazivayetsya  1001 meloch v kotoroy ona prodayot vse raznoye ( tapochki dlya doma, nojnicci, svechi,razniye kremi, brilok dlya kluchey i .d ). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye i noviye tovari kotoriye imeyut bolshuyu potrebnost  sredi pokupateley , dllya svayego magazina.
texts.en: Farida is 44 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Farida is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the Kalbadjar region and now lives with her husband and children in the Absheron region.  She opened a store, called "1001 Meloch," seven years ago and sells various merchandise (house slippers, scissors, candles, various lotions, key chains, etc.) there.  Farida currently needs 2000 AZN to buy necessary and new merchandise that is in high demand among customers for her store.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Mansueta Group

texts.en:
Mansueta is married with 12 children. Mansueta is 56 years old and lives in Montol, Ozamiz City.

Mansueta is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 14,999 PHP to purchase abaca products for her business. Mansueta has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mansueta hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

Mansueta is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase abaca products for her business.

loans.name: Tania Patricia

texts.es: Tania Patricia de 30 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Tenia se dedica al negocio de transporte escolar. Tiene varios años de realizar esta actividad y gracias a Dios los resultados obtenidos han sido muy favorables hasta el momento. Posee un microbús en el cual realiza  viajes a  estudiantes de diferentes centros escolares. Tania es una mujer increíble ya que es muy emprendedora, trabajadora y responsable.  Tiene muchos clientes fijos ya que ha sabido ganárselos gracias a su responsabilidad y dedicación en su trabajo. Últimamente ha notado que su microbús ha estado dando algunas fallas por lo que ha decidido invertir en algunas reparaciones. Para poder hacer lo anterior ha  decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en las reparaciones necesarias de su transporte ya que  es su herramienta principal de trabajo y este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Espera poder mejorar las condiciones de su transporte y poder prestar un mejor servicio con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos así como su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Tania Patricia is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and their two school-age children. She operates a school transportation business. Tania has been in business for several years. Thanks to God, she has obtained very favorable results to this point. Tania owns a minibus that she uses to transport students to different schools. She is an incredible woman who is very enterprising, hardworking, and responsible. Tania has several established customers who know that she is responsible and dedicated to her work.

Recently she has noticed that her minibus has experienced a few problems, so she has decided to invest in some repairs. Like she did before, Tania is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in the necessary repairs to her vehicle since it is the main piece of equipment in her business and an important source of income. By improving the condition of her vehicle, she hopes to provide better service so that she can generate more income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Mercy S.

texts.en: Mercy is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has five children, and her husband is a machine operator.  For the past fifteen years, Mercy has been selling coal by bags in the market.  She makes a lot of profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags for her business, and she plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y decidida, así como le gusta mucho los negocios, es conviviente con Luis quien es operador en un aserradero, vive en compañía de su padre, madre, tres hermanos, su hija de 3 años de edad y su pareja, cómodamente instalados en la casa de sus padres.
El negocio que tiene Marlene es la venta de bebidas gaseosas lo cual realiza desde la casa de sus padres contando para eso con una refrigeradora que compró con el apoyo de su pareja, comenzó por iniciativa propia ya que viendo la necesidad económica que atravesaban con su pareja y que con el ingreso económico de él no les alcanzaba, ahora después de 5 años con su negocio a logrado hacerlo crecer teniendo mayor volumen de mercadería en su casa, contando con el apoyo de su madre en la atención a los clientes solo ciando ella esta fuera de casa.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa  para atender y cuidar a su pequeño hijo a quien desea poder brindarle  una mejor calidad de vida, viendo lo lucrativo que es el negocio por la demanda que tiene, desea continuar con su negocio y ampliar abriendo un minimarket en donde pueda vender  mayor variedad de productos y así tener mayores ganancias. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse muy cómoda con su grupo comunal ya que conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera personas tranquilas y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas en mayor volumen y variadas marcas y presentaciones a precio por mayor para de esa manera tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlene, who is 25 years old, is happy and determined woman, as well as being a woman who is interested in business. She lives with her partner, Luis, who operates a sawmill. She lives with her father, mother, three siblings, her daughter, who is three years old, and her partner, all of them comfortably installed in the house of her parents.

Marlene's business is the sale of soft drinks, which she does in the house of her parents, relying on a refrigerator that she bought with the help of her partner. She began this business on her own initiative, since she could see the economic needs her partner was experiencing and that his income was not sufficient. Now, after five years with her business, she has succeeded in making it grow and in having a larger volume of merchandise in her house. She relies on the help of her mother to tend to the customers only when she is out of the house.

She likes her business since it allows her to be at home to tend to and take care of her little child, to whom she wants to be able to offer a better quality of life. Seeing how lucrative her business is because of the demand she has, she wants to continue with her business and enlarge it, opening a minimarket where she can sell a greater variety of products and thus have better earnings. This will be her second loan with the MFP institution, so she hopes for their assistance so that she can continue with her goals. In addition, she comments that she feels very comfortable with her communal bank, since she knows the majority of its members and considers them peaceful and responsible people.

She will invest the 1000 PEN that she applied for in the wholesale purchase of soft drinks in greater quantities and of various brands and packaging, so that in this way she will have better profit margins.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks.

loans.name: Las Negras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Negras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Elizabeth del Carmen de 28 años quien es comerciante de verduras y carne de manera ambulante. Ella este negocio lo hace aproximadamente seis años para seguir mejorando y apoyar a sus cinco hijos de 12, 11, 6 y 2 años y el menor de 7 meses.
Ella con el crédito anterior además de incrementar su inventario logro comprar utensilios, mesas, canastos, balanzas. Con este crédito piensa invertir  productos en especial carne y verduras y seguir mejorando el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Yolanda de 21 años quien tiene una pulpería y Verónica de 24 años quien vende productos Avon
texts.en:
The “Las Negras” group is composed of three hardworking, enterprising women.  The group coordinator is Elizabeth del Carmen, 28, who is an itinerant vegetable and meat merchant.  She’s been in business for about six years to continue improving and supporting her five children who are 12, 11, 6 and 2 years old and the youngest who is 7 months old.

With the previous loan in addition to increasing her inventory she managed to buy utensils, tables, baskets and scales.  With this loan she plans to buy products, especially meat and vegetables, and continue improving the business.

The other group members are Yolanda, 21, who has a grocery store and Verónica, 24, who sells Avon products.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 57 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy empeñoso, esta casado y es padre de 10 hijos, a quienes crió y educó de tal manera que ya todos son independientes. Nunca permitió que les faltara algo, ahora él vive en su casa a lado de su esposa a quien desea seguir brindándole una mejor calidad de vida para así poder tener juntos una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Cesar consiste en la venta de zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias y mas, tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes productos nuevos y usados de acuerdo a sus gustos y necesidades, siempre atiende con una sonrisa y es por eso que ha captado mucha clientela. A diario sale al mercado en donde camina  para realizar sus ventas. Cuando se inicio solo vendía productos de segunda, pero con el tiempo fue incrementando su capital y ahora vende nuevos. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 6 años y desea continuar haciéndolo por muchos años más. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener su tiempo a disposición además de poder tener la libertad de poner su horario y sus días de trabajo, además tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite tener buenos ingresos. Espera más adelante llegar a tener un local para así crecer su negocio. Éste será el crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además está muy comprometido en pagar una vez más con las cuotas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Se siente muy cómodo en su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará más mercadería y productos para aumentar la variedad que ofrece, además de empezar con la construcción de un local para tener lugar en donde vender.
texts.en:
Cesar, 57, is a good, kind, hard-working man who is married and has ten children.  He raised and educated them all to be independent, always making sure they never went without.  Now he lives with his wife for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life and prepare the way for a tranquil retirement.  Cesar sells shoes, sneakers, sandals and other footwear.  He sells both new and used products depending on customer demand and need.  When he started his business he only sold second-hand items but over time began increasing his capital and now he sells new products.

He has been in business for six years and hopes to continue many more.  He enjoys his work because it lets him establish his own work schedule.  He has a high sales volume which gives him a nice income.  Hopefully in the future he can open a sales outlet and grow his business.  This is his eighth loan through MFP and he is counting on your support to help him meet his goals.  He is totally committed to paying back the loan on time.  He is very comfortable with his communal bank since the members of the group are very responsible and supportive of each other.  With the 1,200 PEN loan he will buy more merchandise and products to broaden the range he offers.  He also will begin construction of the new outlet where can can sell his goods.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sneakers, and also build a sales outlet.

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en:
Joanes is 32 years old and married with 2 children.  He does carpentry to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 16 years and has employed 3 people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joanes has been able to improve his living standards and he hopes to expand his business in the future. 

Joanes has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber to make cupboards for sale.

loans.use: buy timber to make cupboards

loans.name: July Roxana

texts.es:
July es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pareja y su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente July no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, July trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, adicionalmente también tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana, cuenta con un pequeño puesto de ventas, el cual alquila en un mercado de su ciudad, July puede trabajar por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
July se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como polos, blusas, pantalones, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, así pues July tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
July is 27 years old. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her partner and young daughter, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, together with her partner, strives every day to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, July has not been able to study a professional career since she had to start working very young to help her parents with the household expenses. During her free time, she enjoys playing sports and occasionally cooking a delicious Chicken and Rice dish to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with effort and dedication, July works in her small business, selling drinks. She also has a business selling clothing. She works everyday, starting very early in the morning. She has a small stall which she rents in the city market. July works about 8 hours a day and believes it is going well because of the kind treatment she gives her customers.

July is very thankful for Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided, she is able to buy merchandise for her business, such as polo shirts, blouses, trousers, t-shirts and other clothing for men, woman and children. In this way, July will have a better stocked business and she hopes to increase her sales and income, which will help her expand her business little by little.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ginder Gilberto

texts.es:
